column1:
[SAK-31410] Assignments associated with the same GBNG item automatically given same grade,https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/browse/SAK-31410,10057,SAK,Sakai,"

If multiple assignments are associated with the same GBNG item, instructor is not able to set different grades for each assignment. A change to either grade is automatically reflected in both.

column2: • Create an assignment and associate it with that GBNG item
• Create another assignment and associate it with the same GBNG item
• In Assignments, click Grade under first assignment
• Note grade is shown but status is 'No Submission' or 'Ungraded' (varies if student has submitted assignment)
• Change the grade, then click Save and Release to Student
• Click Grade Report - note both have grade from the previous step (10)

[SAK-31409] Change the default configuration in sakai 11.0 so that the option for users to generate a private URL for their My Workspace (Home) 'collated calendar' is enabled by default,https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/browse/SAK-31409,10057,SAK,Sakai,"

Change the *default *configuration in Sakai 11.0 so that the option to allow all users to 'privately' publish (the 'Publish (Private)' button) site calendars is always shown in My Workspace and exports all the users collated calendars in one feed. This property is called 'ical.myworkspace.auto.export'.

This is notably distinct from the 'Publish (Public)' facility as the URL that is generated here is un-guessable and is NOT meant for public circulation. If compromised, it can be regenerated. It means that users can subscribe to their My Workspace (ahem, sorry, 'Home') Calendar which, of course, includes a collated view of all their sakai site calendars.

This is a duplicate of

<a href=""https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/browse/SAK-31371"" class=""jira-issue-macro-key issue-link""  title=""Resources Folder "Add Details" does nothing if multiple folders are being created"" >

[SAK-31406] write a demo provider to supply Institutional Anonymous IDs and "additional information",https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/browse/SAK-31406,10057,SAK,Sakai,"

In order for the features described in

<a href=""https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/browse/SAK-31404"" class=""jira-issue-macro-key issue-link""  title=""Allow an Institutional Anonymous Candidate ID to used as the anonymous identifier in Assignments"" >
<a href=""https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/browse/SAK-31405"" class=""jira-issue-macro-key issue-link""  title=""Allow "Additional Notes" about a user to be displayed in Assigments"" >

to be QAd, a provider that is used in ""demo mode"" needs to be written. This should provide additional attributes (""Institutional Anonymous IDs"" & ""Additional Information"") about Demo Sakai users (ie, users that are created when Sakai is run in demo mode).

The demo provider should be used when sakai.demo=true system property is set (by having a components.demo.xml file in a sakai-component). It should have implementations of all of the interface and should exercise all possible cases that the interfaces defines. It should not have a list of valid users but should work for any user passed to it.
The provider should have 2 ways of deciding on the returned value:

1/ If a property is set on the objects passed in then they should be returned. These properties should be documented. This is to allow testing of specific cases. On the user object it could be a resource property keyed with ""INSTITUTIONAL_ANONYMOUS_ID"" for example.

2/ If the property isn't set a simple algorithm should be used. This allows for easy testing without any setup and for testing of larger datasets. For deciding on return options is to use the hash of the ID of the objects passed into it. So for example to decide if there should be a candidate ID returned the provider can take get the hash of the ID and then just see it the least significant digit is divisible by 4 and if it is then don't return a candidate ID, otherwise return the last 5 characters of the SHA1 of the ID. The algorithm has to be consistent in the return values it generates.

[SAK-31405] Allow "Additional Notes" about a user to be displayed in Assigments,https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/browse/SAK-31405,10057,SAK,Sakai,"

Communicate ""additional information"" about a student, eg, ""English not first language"", and / or ""resitting the year"", and / or, ""Non-sighted"", and / or, ""Dyslexic"" or all of the preceding 'attributes' and so on.
This data should be fetched from a provider (eg, LDAP), salted and encrypted and stored against a specific user.
Surface this ""additional information"". To do this we will

1 include a 'cover sheet' (HTML file) at the top level of the ZIP file download listing all names or if the assignment is anonymously submitted, the institutional anonymous IDs and the corresponding ""additional information"".

2 add a link to the above-mentioned 'cover sheet' just above the table of submissions on the Assignments Tool ""View Submissions"" / ""Mark"" page and in the same part of the page, explicitly list the names or anonymous IDs that have ""additional info""

Display whether or not the current user has any ""additional information"" on the student upload submission page. This will reassure the student that we know about them and will take it into account. We should highlight the statement perhaps in the ""Morpheus way"" (blue panel.)

",,53840,SAK-31405,"Allow ""Additional Notes"" about a user to be displayed in Assigments",10012,https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/secure/viewavatar?size=medium&avatarId=10315&avatarType=issuetype,Feature Request,10002,https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/images/icons/priorities/major.svg,Major,5,https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/images/icons/statuses/resolved.png,"A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. [SAK-31404] Allow an Institutional Anonymous Candidate ID to used as the anonymous identifier in Assignments,https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/browse/SAK-31404,10057,SAK,Sakai,"

Provide an option for a different anonymous ID to be used in the Assignments tool when the ""anonymous submission"" option is selected.
This ID should be retrieved from some sort of provider (eg, LDAP) then salted and encrypted and stored against a particular user.
). This can be set system-wide or on a site-by-site basis.

Where his is set, the regular Sakai anonymous ID is replaced by the 'institutionalAnonymousID' both on-screen and in the ZIP file download (& in /direct JSON/XML if appropriate). Where it is not set, no action is taken.

[SAK-31403] Remove fMath plugin from Sakai because of mathjax and flash deprecation,https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/browse/SAK-31403,10057,SAK,Sakai,"

In April 2016, fMath released an javascript based formula editor for CKEditor.
This should replace the Flash one that's there, seeing that Chrome is intending to remove Flash support Q4 2016 and this existing one has known issues anyway.

http://www.theverge.com/2016/5/15/11679394/chrome-to-block-flash-later-2016

",,45222,SAK-31403,Remove fMath plugin from Sakai because of mathjax and flash deprecation,10007,https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/secure/viewavatar?size=medium&avatarId=10303&avatarType=issuetype,Bug,10001,https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/images/icons/priorities/critical.svg,Critical,10025,https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/images/icons/statuses/generic.png,Indicates QA is complete and an issue has been tested and verified (Migrated on 12 Oct 2021 03:05 UTC),Verified,3,done,green,10000,Fixed,70121:ec0fd122-4a2d-4492-a966-78d3f9aa9080,Matthew Jones,70121:ec0fd122-4a2d-4492-a966-78d3f9aa9080,Matthew Jones,"Wed, 22 Jun 2016 15:42:50 -0400","Mon, 16 Apr 2018 09:23:52 -0400",11.0,WYSIWYG Widget (FCK & CK Editor),0,3,Development,customfield_10000,com.atlassian.jira.plugins.jira-development-integration-plugin:devsummarycf,Rank,0|10950o:,customfield_10019,com.pyxis.greenhopper.jira:gh-lexo-rank,Sprint,customfield_10020,com.pyxis.greenhopper.jira:gh-sprint,"Mon, 16 Oct 2017 06:14:36 -0400",,,,,,,[CHART] Date of First Response,customfield_10024,com.atlassian.jira.ext.charting:firstresponsedate,[CHART] Time in Status,customfield_10025,com.atlassian.jira.ext.charting:timeinstatus,,,12.0,19.0,74471,70121:ec0fd122-4a2d-4492-a966-78d3f9aa9080,"Mon, 15 Aug 2016 15:58:04 -0400",

",175818,70121:ec0fd122-4a2d-4492-a966-78d3f9aa9080,"Fri, 15 Sep 2017 02:59:54 -0400","

Yeah, back in 2016 I tried to get the javascript based editor to work but was unsuccessful. I forget what the problem was.

Daniel Merino had +1'd removing this plugin back then on the dev list, with the only downside being any existing math placed would not be editable (but it would still be viewable). I'm not sure how important it is to anyone to retain editable equations though.

[SAK-31402] Provide more finer grained variables to ease custom skin development,https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/browse/SAK-31402,10057,SAK,Sakai,"

In developing a custom skin, I've found it a little tricky to apply custom colors to specific elements due to the sharing of particular variables. For example the variable `$background-color` is used as the background (and text color in some cases) for multiple components.

It'd be great if all colors had their own specific variable. Once added, these variables can be share the more generic color settings to achieve the current default styling e.g. $top-header-font-color=$background-color.

",,40878,SAK-31402,Provide more finer grained variables to ease custom skin development,10012,https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/secure/viewavatar?size=medium&avatarId=10315&avatarType=issuetype,Feature Request,10002,https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/images/icons/priorities/major.svg,Major,10025,https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/images/icons/statuses/generic.png,Indicates QA is complete and an issue has been tested and verified (Migrated on 12 Oct 2021 03:05 UTC),Verified,3,done,green,10000,Fixed,-1,Unassigned,557058:26381954-9854-4801-9b32-e9b1c33fd072,Payten Giles,"Wed, 22 Jun 2016 15:10:08 -0400","Wed, 3 Aug 2016 09:05:10 -0400",11.0,morpheus,0,8,11 status,customfield_10122,com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.customfieldtypes:select,Development,,customfield_10000,com.atlassian.jira.plugins.jira-development-integration-plugin:devsummarycf,Rank,customfield_10019,com.pyxis.greenhopper.jira:gh-lexo-rank,"Mon, 27 Jun 2016 22:10:43 -0400",,,,,,0|10950w:,Sprint,customfield_10020,com.pyxis.greenhopper.jira:gh-sprint,[CHART] Date of First Response,customfield_10024,com.atlassian.jira.ext.charting:firstresponsedate,,,11.1,12.0,40555,557058:26381954-9854-4801-9b32-e9b1c33fd072,"Thu, 23 Jun 2016 13:08:45 -0400","

Hi Jose Mariano Lujan, Eduardo Rey Jara,

I've made a first pass to specify a few more variables for colors. I only really wanted to focus on the components in the portal, which should be the things people will want to tinker with most. I've intended to retain the existing defaults, so the end result shouldn't look any different than before.
I also refactored the variables for the message colors and changed the camel-case names to match the snake-case used throughout.
The PR is here for review: https://github.com/sakaiproject/sakai/pull/2941

Payten

",124630,6164e4a69cdb930072de1f6e,"Mon, 27 Jun 2016 22:03:33 -0400",

[SAK-31401] Sorting options behave differently/don't work at all in Grade Report tab,https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/browse/SAK-31401,10057,SAK,Sakai,"

In the Grade Report tab, initial ordering of assignments looks random. Clicking the Assignments column, the items are not in alphabetical order and the normal sorting icon is not shown (Sorting.png). Subsequent clicks reverse the order but to not correct it.
Using the Scale column has the same issue.

It is unclear if this is related to specific Assignment settings: HW1/HW2 were associated with the same gradebook item, Run1/Run2 were associated with the same gradebook item. Checking was associated with it's own gradebook item.

[SAK-31400] Errors when double-clicking on buttons within the interface (such as the "Remove" button in the Trash),https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/browse/SAK-31400,10057,SAK,Sakai,"

In Resources, it's possible to click on buttons in the interface twice in a row (that is, clicking a second time before an action has completed). This can cause errors.
1. Send a file to the Trash.
2. In trash, click the ""Remove"" button, then click it again before the screen refreshes.
You will end up getting error messages like the following:
The items were removed, yet this error makes it seem like they were not.

To remedy this, buttons should be disabled throughout Resources following an initial click.

[SAK-34263] Samigo/Tomcat fails viewing submission with huge amount of them,https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/browse/SAK-34263,10057,SAK,Sakai,"

The set the scene....
We're now having all placement testing at Rutgers being done through Sakai, this means that we have thousands (currently highest is 5300+) submissions in Samigo.
We noticed a problem that when trying to view submissions for a particular student when there are a HUGE amount of submissions causes a Tomcat error.(thousands)

INFO: More than the maximum number of request parameters (GET plus POST) for a single request ([10,000]) were detected. Any parameters beyond this limit have been ignored. To change this limit, set the maxParameterCount attribute on the Connector.
Got a way to fix it from this SO link.

I believe this is because of the way Samigo handles edits/links on the page. Instead of just getting the info for a single user when you click their name, it does a giant post request with parameters for every user on that page.

Perhaps it should be that if you click a single users name, it does a GET for just that user.

",,36449,SAK-34263,Samigo/Tomcat fails viewing submission with huge amount of them,10007,https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/secure/viewavatar?size=medium&avatarId=10303&avatarType=issuetype,Bug,10002,https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/images/icons/priorities/major.svg,Major,1,https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/images/icons/statuses/open.png,The issue is open and ready for the assignee to start work on it.,Open,2,new,blue-gray,-1,Unresolved,6164d8abc7bea400699b1b9e,Core Team,6164f3e464ff010071b8a44d,William Karavites,"Tue, 21 Jun 2016 09:36:29 -0400","Tue, 17 Apr 2018 04:01:53 -0400",10.4,Tests & Quizzes (Samigo),0,5,Development,customfield_10000,com.atlassian.jira.plugins.jira-development-integration-plugin:devsummarycf,Rank,0|10953c:,customfield_10019,com.pyxis.greenhopper.jira:gh-lexo-rank,Sprint,customfield_10020,com.pyxis.greenhopper.jira:gh-sprint,,,,,,,,[CHART] Date of First Response,customfield_10024,com.atlassian.jira.ext.charting:firstresponsedate,,,,,,,,191332,70121:ec0fd122-4a2d-4492-a966-78d3f9aa9080,"Tue, 21 Jun 2016 11:14:23 -0400","

Yeah, we saw the same thing in Evaluation
<a href=""https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/browse/EVALSYS-1464"" class=""jira-issue-macro-key issue-link""  title=""Stacktrace and parameter error with too many groups"" >

. There's the quick fix on the Connector so all of the parameters go through, but really fixing these problems especially in in some of these application frameworks seems like it can be a lot of work to change.

",74373,70121:ec0fd122-4a2d-4492-a966-78d3f9aa9080,"Tue, 21 Jun 2016 11:58:32 -0400","

I don't think for most JSF tools like this though it's going to be an easy fix.
It has to POST almost every page through because the javax.faces.ViewState has to be pushed to every page since data is stored on the client after
<a href=""https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/browse/SAK-25677"" class=""jira-issue-macro-key issue-link""  title=""Store all JSF STATE on client and not server"" >

It looks like in JSF it does get stateless views (https://blog.oio.de/2013/10/02/going-stateless-with-jsf/) for some forms like this. It seems like you'd have to at least re-design this page to reduce the number of form elements, or maybe make the users list paginated and change the workflow a little to actually solve this problem without having to change the config.

",141347,557058:652d59a6-8d32-486e-8682-fa97a1afe06f,"Mon, 27 Jun 2016 06:49:14 -0400","

I believe there needs to be documentation on what fit use of Samigo is, that it should not be used for high stakes or high volume testing. With or without this item being fixed, that would be true, IMO.

","Tue, 21 Jun 2016 15:14:23 +0000",,,,,,,,,,,191348,6164d3a564ff010071b75c26,"Wed, 29 Jun 2016 08:31:57 -0400","

This is a perfectly reasonable use case. It can also be fixed. The unfixable problem is working with a page that has thousands of items on it. But there's no need to do that if paging works.
So the biggest fix is that search and paging didn't work. That's been fixed by someone else.
However there are a couple more things to do, which I'll submit a PR for with this Jira.

column2: • Currently the submissions page defaults to showing all. When there's a huge number of items, this is a mistake. My patch will default to paging when there's more than 500 items.

• Getting the initial view is way too slow. This can be improved. First, it's building a hash table using all the item results. That hash table is never used. Remove it. Second, most of the time in the display is actually spent in sorting. BeanSort is an elegant solution to sorting by multiple criteria, but because it uses introspection it's very slow. (At least I assume that's what is going on.) I'm optimizing the 3 most common sorts.

column1: These changes get the initial display from a couple of minutes to 17 sec, with changing the order in 8 seconds. This is for 3319 submissions. The problem is that we're going to end up with 9000 submissions, so we had to do something.

My fix will be to master but it's actually in use in our Sakai 10. That means I can't use Java 8 constructs. I suspect that I could make the sort more elegant using method handles or lambdas, but they aren't available. And I don't want to put them in the code without being able to test them with our production data.

",124635,6164d3a564ff010071b75c26,"Thu, 30 Jun 2016 06:08:31 -0400","

We have a site with 17,000 submissions for a test. With this patch, and with
in server.xml, we can load the page in about a minute the first time. It takes about 10 sec to move to a new page or search for a user.
I can't quite see how we could come up with a larger case than this, so that's going to be the limit of our tuning.

To do better than this we'd need to redo a couple of beans so they only fetch the data that they need for the specific page they're displaying. Currently it fetches all the data and then pages through it. This wouldn't be a difficult project, as the changes are pretty localized.

",141355,6164d3a564ff010071b75c26,"Thu, 30 Jun 2016 07:14:20 -0400","

I looked back at the discussion for
<a href=""https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/browse/SAK-25677"" class=""jira-issue-macro-key issue-link""  title=""Store all JSF STATE on client and not server"" >

. I think that was the wrong decision. Memory is not that expensive. I'd rather use more memory if it would buy faster response, less bandwidth, and (probably) better security.

",109235,557058:659546e5-b282-4002-b951-2315a1044157,"Fri, 3 Nov 2017 04:20:21 -0400","

It appears to be some time since this was JIRA was updated. Has JIRA

incorporated a fix for this issue?

",142611,70121:ec0fd122-4a2d-4492-a966-78d3f9aa9080,"Fri, 3 Nov 2017 04:31:00 -0400","

[SAK-33032] "Import From Site" Issue - Cannot import content from GB Classic,https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/browse/SAK-33032,10057,SAK,Sakai,"

To replicate:
1. Have a GB set up in an origin site, w/ GB Classic enabled.
2. In the destination site, enable GB Classic *or* GBNG.
3. Attempt to ""Import from Site,"" pulling data from the origin site's GB Classic tool.

Regardless of the existence of GBNG in the destination site, imports from GB Classic don't appear to be working. This might be a bigger blocker issue for 11.0, as folks will need to be able to import content from old GB's into GBNG (or just import GB Classic content into another instance of GB Classic).

What do you think, Former user ? Should this be a JIRA, or is it sufficient for this to be recorded in git?

[SAK-31392] Gradebook Classic - Can add external items with different point totals to existing Drop Highest/Lowest Categories,https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/browse/SAK-31392,10057,SAK,Sakai,"

It is possible to cause significant calculation errors with Drop Highest / Drop Lowest / Keep Highest when using external GB items (e.g., Assignments, Samigo, etc.).

column2: • Set up Categories & Weighting. Create a category called ""Category 1"".
• Add Gradebook items to Category 1. Ensure that all items have the same total point value (e.g., 100).
• Back within ""Gradebook Setup,"" enable ""Drop Lowest"" and set it to drop the lowest 1 score in Category 1.
• Now, within Assignments, create a new assignment. Set the point value to a different point total (e.g., 200), and add to the Gradebook. Choose to add it to Category 1.

column1: The Assignment will be successfully created. It will be added to the GB with a point value of 200.
What this means for drop highest / drop lowest / keep highest:

column2: • Incorrect values can end up getting dropped. Example: If providing a score of 75/100 for a manual item and 100/200 for the assignment, the 75/100 will end up getting dropped because Drop Lowest only looks to the recorded score. The category subtotal will accurate reflect that the student has a 50% for the category, but Drop Lowest is dropping the incorrect score.

• You can no longer edit the Drop Lowest field for this category. It's stuck with ""1"" in the field. In fact, you can no longer remove Drop Lowest at all. Trying to remove Drop Lowest and saving results in a screen refresh, and Drop Lowest will still be implemented.

column1:
",,58158,SAK-31392,Gradebook Classic - Can add external items with different point totals to existing Drop Highest/Lowest Categories,10007,https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/secure/viewavatar?size=medium&avatarId=10303&avatarType=issuetype,Bug,10002,https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/images/icons/priorities/major.svg,Major,1,https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/images/icons/statuses/open.png,The issue is open and ready for the assignee to start work on it.,Open,2,new,blue-gray,-1,Unresolved,6164d8abc7bea400699b1b9e,Core Team,70121:24ac83d3-f5a7-4a57-be09-13263a37e0cd,Kyle Blythe,"Mon, 20 Jun 2016 07:11:10 -0400","Mon, 22 Feb 2021 09:00:52 -0500",10.4,Assignments,0,2,Development,customfield_10000,com.atlassian.jira.plugins.jira-development-integration-plugin:devsummarycf,Rank,0|109554:,customfield_10019,com.pyxis.greenhopper.jira:gh-lexo-rank,Sprint,customfield_10020,com.pyxis.greenhopper.jira:gh-sprint,,Gradebook Classic,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,74368,70121:24ac83d3-f5a7-4a57-be09-13263a37e0cd,"Mon, 20 Jun 2016 07:13:40 -0400","

While this is a pretty bad bug for the Drop/Keep calculations, it's also present in 10.x (and likely earlier). Since this hasn't been reported previously (that I'm aware of), I would not consider this a blocker.
Possible fixes for this would involve some sort of validation in the external tool to either:

column2: • prevent the instructor from adding an external item with a different point total to an existing category with drop/keep in place
• change the external item's point total to reflect the existing items' established point totals in BOTH the external tool and the GB

column1:
",91238,70121:24ac83d3-f5a7-4a57-be09-13263a37e0cd,"Mon, 20 Jun 2016 07:20:17 -0400","

Another scenario that can cause significant calculation errors with GB Classic when using Drop/Keep and external GB items. To reproduce:

column2: • Set up Categories & Weighting. Create a category called ""Category 2""
• Add Gradebook items to Category 1. Ensure that all items have the same total point value (e.g., 100).
• Back within ""Gradebook Setup,"" enable ""Drop Lowest"" and set it to drop the lowest 1 score in Category 2.

• Within Assignments, create a new assignment. Set the point value to a different point total (e.g., 200), and add to the Gradebook. Do not add it to Category 2. Instead, add it as an ""unassigned"" item.
• Now, within the Gradebook, edit the external GB item and assign it to Category 2.

column1: Result: the GB will change the external GB item's point value to 100. However, the item will still have a point value of 200 in Assignments.

What's the use case for this?

,191341,6164f496c669a60069cc6981,"Mon, 27 Jun 2016 01:59:30 -0400","

Few users from 'Department of Continued Education' at Oxford were not happy with the Lessons tool remembering it's state , their was an internal request to reset tool after each navigation.

",57562,557058:c7ed084d-c59c-4475-8ab7-81e1908270f0,"Tue, 28 Jun 2016 10:37:08 -0400","

Perhaps this should be a tool property then, otherwise every tool will be affected.

",,,,,,,,,,,,107972,6164f496c669a60069cc6981,"Thu, 30 Jun 2016 04:51:54 -0400","

Yes we are aware of this side effect but they have multiple copies of Lessons tool on each site so if they add a new page with lessons tool in it , it needs to be set again. So an easy way is to have a site property set for all the tools.

",57566,557058:c7ed084d-c59c-4475-8ab7-81e1908270f0,"Sat, 2 Jul 2016 21:56:21 -0400",

If it was a tool property you could have it turned on by default in the tool registration. Then every time Lessons was added to a site the property would be turned on and other tools would be unaffected.

,108056,70121:9335f09f-0d23-4a59-9aac-ba36f9cb223a,"Wed, 17 Aug 2016 11:58:06 -0400","

Neelam Bhandari how is this tested?

",191433,6164f496c669a60069cc6981,"Thu, 18 Aug 2016 00:02:22 -0400","

Hi Molly, I have added test plan for this Jira.

",91349,70121:9335f09f-0d23-4a59-9aac-ba36f9cb223a,"Fri, 19 Aug 2016 11:13:13 -0400","

Tested on the experimental trunk and mysql trunk servers, neither reset the Lessons tool. I followed the steps in the test plan and set the portal.experimental.auto.reset to true and verified that it was set but was never taken back to the main Lessons page.

",,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,10732,Resolved,"

1.
column2: Click on ‘Other Users Login’ and login as admin.
Go to ‘Administration Workspace’ --> 'Sites'. click on the site for which you want to set the property.
Add new property ‘portal.experimental.auto.reset' with value as ‘true’ and save site.

column1: 6. go to any tool (for e.g Lessons) in the site ,go inside subpages in the Lessons.
7. Now click on any other tool let's say 'Site-info'

8. Now go back to Lessons tool , you should be on the top of the Lessons page and not on the subpages.

[SAK-34943] Refactor autosubmit to enclose each update in a separate transaction and notify on failure,https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/browse/SAK-34943,10057,SAK,Sakai,"

The entire autosubmit loop happens in the same transaction, so any failure during the loop iteration causes all previous work to be rolled back, effectively silently killing the job. To improve this:

column2: • Each loop iteration gets its own transaction
• In the event of an iteration failing (an exception is caught), rather than just logging and continuing, note the failure and send an email to a configurable address when the job completes.

column1:
samigo.email.autoSubmit.errorNotification.toAddress=notifyus@example.com

• After the retract date, run the autosubmit job

Overview"" To properly test this requires database manipulation to set up a scenario that will cause a database exception. The method I use mirrors what happened to us in production, but there could be a simpler method.
1) a) Turn on the properties : samigo.email.autoSubmit.errorNotification.enabled=true, set the quartz job and run the sql script (see the readme file) , or set a template (if the
1b) Also you need to have autosubmit on:
(and need to add the job to Quartz as admin)
1c) and set an email address that you can check (or check the catalina.out logs, but this means setting
so that email goes to the logs).

2) First create two quizzes with the same retract dates that send grades to gradebook and are eligible for autosubmit, and attempt them without submitting. Setting ""Send assessment score to Gradebook immediately, regardless of options below""
3) Find the corresponding columns in GB_GRADABLE_OBJECT_T
Set the external_id on one of them to match the other (now you have two columns for the same quiz)
Create a third quiz eligible for autosubmit, with the same retract date as the first two, and attempt it without submitting
4) After the retract date, run the autosubmit job
Expected result: The first two attempts should fail and you should get an email about it, but the third attempt should be successful

Prior to this change, all 3 attempts would fail without notice

",125794,557058:48227012-f9a6-40a4-97e6-94c8ef57f33e,"Thu, 7 Sep 2017 10:16:33 -0400","

Paul Lukasewych can you explain the changes made in this JIRA a bit? I'm having a tough time with this code while testing for Sakai 12. Specifically, can you explain your transaction changes especially PROPAGATION_REQUIRES_NEW?

",175807,5ba29b8f0b4e302eb612ef8b,"Thu, 7 Sep 2017 11:32:44 -0400","

It has been a while since I wrote this, but the idea was that the PROPAGATION_REQUIRES_NEW would make every method call create a new transaction. So for each iteration of the loop, the call to PersistenceService.getInstance().getAutoSubmitQueries().autoSubmitSingleAssessment() is done in its own transaction so that if it errors out it does not affect the rest of the submissions. Originally the entire batch of submissions was in a single transaction that rolled back if anything failed, so if you have an unrecoverable error with one of the submissions it just keeps rolling back each time, building up more and more queued submissions to process, yet never actually completing any of them.

When I was working on this job recently for our 11.3 upgrade, I realized that this implementation does not perfectly match the logic of the autosubmit job. It really should be collecting all the attempts for a single user/quiz pairing into one transaction, in case there is something wrong with an individual submission, as the logic relies on seeing all the attempts and deciding which one to autosubmit. However, that will likely require either introducing manual transaction management or collecting up the attempts and calling a new method to autosubmit them in batches. But when I was writing this originally, the problem we had encountered was related to the quiz itself (multiple gradebook entries for the same quiz), so it wouldn't have mattered in that case, none of the attempts for that quiz would have been processed.

<a href=""https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/browse/SAK-37056"" class=""jira-issue-macro-key issue-link""  title=""Auto-submit always sends last score which can allow zeros to override scores on multiple submissions in various cases"" >

[SAK-31384] Add template updating code to EmailTemplateService.xmlToTemplate(),https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/browse/SAK-31384,10057,SAK,Sakai,"

Currently, all updates to email templates have to be propagated manually, either though database script updates, or through the GUI.
This is because in the past the ETS.updateTemplate() method didnt't seem to work. It now works properly, but is not called when processing XML email templates during server start-up.
The linked PR will add code to the xmlToTemplate() method to call the updateTemplate() method if the template already exists and the version is greater than the version currently loaded.

The result of this work is that all updates to email templates can be done in code (in the XML files). Provided that you also bump up the version (whole integers), the code will update the template for you. No more database scripts and no more manual updating via the GUI!

,40549,6164d3a564ff010071b75c26,"Wed, 22 Jun 2016 04:25:12 -0400","

The menu looks fine to me. If you mean that it doesn't appear directly under the button you clicked, I gave up trying to make that happen. In 10, that menu is produced by code that's completely separate from the jQueryUI code used for the other menus. There were issues with weird cases: it was hard to make sure the menu was always on the screen. And I had to do separate accessibily work, which jQueryUI does. So when Chuck Severance redid all the Lessons menus to match other Sakai menus, I included the pulldowns.

With multiple columns and portable devices it's hard to get everything right in all configurations. The default in 10 is a fixed number of pixels. That caused trouble in several configuration. I default to 100% width now. It's easy to configure the width to be whatever you want. I'm not sure quite what would be right as a default. Width is now set with javascript if you don't specify anything, so in theory I could say 100% or some number of pixels (I think I used 640 before), whichever is smaller. Any suggestions?

",141328,70121:ec0fd122-4a2d-4492-a966-78d3f9aa9080,"Mon, 20 Jun 2016 06:58:07 -0400","

I think it could be nice for the workflow if you had the option to specify the width when you're adding the item initially.

Now you have to add it the URL, save. Then know to click the edit button to make it smaller. Otherwise I think this looks okay to me.

",174640,6164d3a564ff010071b75c26,"Mon, 20 Jun 2016 07:03:22 -0400","

That's easy to do. But I'm not sure any fixed value is going to work well. Consider portable devices. I'm considering min (100%, 640px) as a default.

","Mon, 20 Jun 2016 10:41:39 +0000",,,,,,29175,Sakai11youtube-embed-vs-url-display .png,183611,ug:43654dc1-6458-4f7f-9664-cd36b8df2c8c,"Thu, 16 Jun 2016 09:37:49 -0400",40542,557058:8214380d-0bd8-4eec-9d5a-cff0db82aa8e,"Mon, 20 Jun 2016 07:05:32 -0400","

Unfortunately, I don't think the average faculty user is going to know what width to put in for a YouTube video either....

I'm going to test 50% width on Sakai 11 and see how that looks in different sized browsers (simulating mobile devices).

",57539,557058:8214380d-0bd8-4eec-9d5a-cff0db82aa8e,"Mon, 20 Jun 2016 07:09:50 -0400","

Ugh, 50% width for a youtube video creates a horrible length for mobile devices..I'd like to see what 100%, 640px does for mobile and desktop!

",107946,6164d3a564ff010071b75c26,"Mon, 20 Jun 2016 07:30:12 -0400","

Youtube seems to be using 854 rather than 640 now. So maybe min(100%, 854). Their embed code includes an explicit width, which I'm not so happy about.

",124612,6164d3a564ff010071b75c26,"Tue, 21 Jun 2016 04:30:25 -0400","

In 10, the default is 100% width but 300 px height. Most players will put the player all the way across but limit the actual video to something like 400 px, because they will maintain the ratio of width to height of the video.
In 11, I removed the height setting, without thinking carefully enough about the results. This often give very large videos.

First, I think it's a mistake to put default values in the database. If the user doesn't specify a width or height, we shouldn't store one with the item in the database. The default should be supplied at runtime. That lets us change defaults as average screen sizes get larger. At the moment things stored under 10 will have 300 px height in the database. Since we can't tell whether the user supplied it or it's the default, we'll have to honor it.

I'm going to play with the exact numbers, but I'm currently thinking of having the database entry have blank where the user doesn't supply a value. On display width should be set to some default. Maybe 640, maybe 854, or maybe even 640 except for youtube. I'll play. Height won't be specified but will flow from the width.
There will be a max-width of 100%, which will handle small columns and portable devices.

I'll try to check this in today so you can play with it in the QA system for master.

",,,,,57544,6164d3a564ff010071b75c26,"Tue, 21 Jun 2016 08:53:28 -0400","

I've checked this into master. It's not in 11 yet, so it has to be tested on one of the master or trunk QA systems, not the 11 QA.
Testing is a bear. It needs to be tested with a variety of

column2: • no width / height specified, just width and both width and height

column1: I've tested with Youtube, vimeo, MP4 video, MP3 audio, FLV video, AU audio file, Mac Safari, Firefox, Chome, Windows 7 IE 11.

This is probably better testing than the previous 11 code, but not as good as 10. I hadn't actually gone through this level of testing with the earlier 11 code. Note that we couldn't just retain the 10 code because there were known problems with narrow windows and other situations.

With no width specified, it defaults to 640. With no height specified it defaults to 75% of actually displayed width (i.e. with narrow pages where width is less than specified, height should be 75% of what's actually shown, not specified width). Except for audio players which default to 100 px high.

This works for the players I tried. However there could certainly be older players that don't support Javascript correctly.

",91244,6164d3a564ff010071b75c26,"Tue, 21 Jun 2016 09:31:06 -0400","

With the new code, here's the advice to users:

column2: • You're probably best not specifying size at all

• If you specify only the width, and it's in px (not percent), we'll treat it juts like our default 640. I.e. we'll make sure it fits in narrow screens, and we'll scale height to 3/4 of displayed width
• If you specify more than that, we can't fix things up for different screen sizes, so results are likely to be unexpected for narrow screens.

column1: With the old code, advice isn't so clear because it's harder to describe how it works.

Note that the 10 code saves width and height parameters, this limiting my ability to fix them up at runtime. It should work as with 10.

",107951,6164d3a564ff010071b75c26,"Tue, 21 Jun 2016 09:40:16 -0400","

There's a second commit. During further testing, I found a bug (not due to this patch, but a preexisting problem in the 11 version) that caused the kinds of parameters set in Sakai 10 not to function for HTML5 video.

In 10, there was a problem so that the 100% was ignored for HTML5 players. So it would see height of 300px but no width. Typically players would do something reasonable, picking a width that corresponded to a height of 300.
In 11, the 100% worked but the 300 px height didn't, so you'd get a huge player.

I've fixed it so both parameters work. You should get a player the same size as in 10, except that because the 100% width is working, it will look slightly different. It works OK in Mac Safari, Chrome and Edge on Windows 10. I think this is the right fix.

",91356,6164d3a564ff010071b75c26,"Tue, 23 Aug 2016 10:43:04 -0400","

The reason this works is that padding-bottom (like margin-bottom) interprets % as % of width. height:100% is basically unusable, because it's 100% of some height. What this hack does is let you specify height in terms of width. It defines a box with 100% width, and by defining padding, 56% height. Then it embeds another box with 100% width and height. Of course that normally wouldn't work, since it would be inside the padding. But position: absolute makes the 100% height ignore the padding of the containing box. I hate code like this, because it's basically magic, but it may still be the right approach.

",74487,70121:ec0fd122-4a2d-4492-a966-78d3f9aa9080,"Tue, 23 Aug 2016 11:24:36 -0400","

[SAK-31375] Hover Effects for Elements in Sakai Top Banner,https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/browse/SAK-31375,10057,SAK,Sakai,"

The following are mouseover/hover effects to be introduced for elements in the top menu bar in Sakai. These effects provide useful feedback & consistency with other elements in the menu bar.

column2: • The ""Home"" button - provide a blue mouseover for the text/icon (similar to the ""Sites"" button and user's name)
• The user's photo - provide a subtle drop-shadow on the photo to signify that it is clickable (similar to what you find with the user icon in the upper-right of Google apps)

[SAK-31374] Tests & Quiz Short Answer question type does not load when MathJax enabled for Samigo,https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/browse/SAK-31374,10057,SAK,Sakai,"

Reproduce by
1. Enabling LaTex for the site through Site Info > Edit Site Information > checkbox at bottom, save
2. Enabling LaTex for the tool through Site Info > manage tools, checkbox next to Tests & Quizzes. Save.
3. Create an assessment, add a single question through dropdown option ""Short Answer/Essay"" ... wait
4.Reverse. Remove LaTex checkbox for the tool.
7. Box for question text appears (without CKEditor palette enabled).
8. Click on linked text ""Show Rich-Text Editor (and character count)""

10. With LaTex still disabled for Tests & Quizzes, but enabled at the site level, return to Tests & Quizzes and create another short answer type question. Click on the 'sigma' symbol. Click on the <tex> symbol in the MathML editor tool palette. Paste in this text:

It appears that LaTex works without being enabled at the tool level. Is this a documentation issue?

[SAK-31373] Removing / cancelling sign-up sends an e-mail for every day that is cancelled to the organizer,https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/browse/SAK-31373,10057,SAK,Sakai,"

To reproduce this issue, create a new meeting/sign-up and set a recurrence (does not matter much which) so that it creates additional sign-ups in the future.

Then from the main page, click the check box and remove, confirm the warning. It will remove the signup and sends the organizer (not the person who does the removal) an e-mail for every sign-up recurrence that is cancelled.

Suggested that it should send only ONE e-mail for the cancellation, or not send an e-mail by default (opt-in for a notification, with a warning on how many notifications the organizer will receive).

",trunk-oracle.nightly.sakaiproject.org Chrome 51.0.2704.84 (64-bit) / Mac OS 10.9.5,40857,SAK-31370,Site Access Settings needs to be implemented more clearly,10007,https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/secure/viewavatar?size=medium&avatarId=10303&avatarType=issuetype,Bug,10002,https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/images/icons/priorities/major.svg,Major,1,https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/images/icons/statuses/open.png,The issue is open and ready for the assignee to start work on it.,Open,2,new,blue-gray,-1,Unresolved,6164d8abc7bea400699b1b9e,Core Team,557058:652d59a6-8d32-486e-8682-fa97a1afe06f,Laura Gekeler,"Wed, 15 Jun 2016 05:43:36 -0400","Mon, 15 Aug 2016 07:34:42 -0400",11.0,Site Info,0,3,Development,customfield_10000,com.atlassian.jira.plugins.jira-development-integration-plugin:devsummarycf,Rank,0|1095cg:,customfield_10019,com.pyxis.greenhopper.jira:gh-lexo-rank,Sprint,customfield_10020,com.pyxis.greenhopper.jira:gh-sprint,,,,,,,,[CHART] Date of First Response,customfield_10024,com.atlassian.jira.ext.charting:firstresponsedate,,,,,,,,74357,557058:7074e357-325c-4f04-880f-321ecd7c7dc5,"Thu, 16 Jun 2016 04:11:22 -0400","

I think that the default is correct. ""Logged in users only"" to me means any user logged into the system should have access to the site.
Maybe it should say ""Any user logged in, will have access to the site"" or ""All
users have access to this site"" . Or maybe ""Anyone logged in"" would be simplest.

I can see where this check box may be worded correctly from a technical perspective but could be confusing to at least 50% (probably higher percent) of Sakai users.

",107947,557058:652d59a6-8d32-486e-8682-fa97a1afe06f,"Mon, 20 Jun 2016 08:56:12 -0400","

I'm not objecting to the wording as much as I'm objecting to the fact that neither of the radio boxes is selected by default. One of them should be.

Currently the site can be saved with no selection made. In that case, what kind of access would you think the site actually has?

",124611,557058:7074e357-325c-4f04-880f-321ecd7c7dc5,"Mon, 20 Jun 2016 09:25:04 -0400","

The default is correct, but confusing. You have to look at the Global Access section as well (see site_access.png). The default is to limit site access to course members, which is correct.

The ""Anyone (including non-logged in)"" is a completely public site, even outside your institution. The ""Logged in users"" is any user logged into Sakai, whether or not they are enrolled in your site.
""Limit to official course members or to those I add manually (recommended)"" is what is wanted 90% of the time (probably more) and is the default.

""Allow any Sakai user to join the site"" means that if the user is logged on, she has the ability to add herself to your site. I think that is a little different than ""Logged in users"" which means they have access to your site even if they don't join it.

We discussed this on Jira triage today and all agreed it was confusing, but we think the defaults are correct.

","Thu, 16 Jun 2016 08:11:22 +0000",Relate,27252,SAK-28084,relates to,10008,19395,site_access.png,97554,ug:1671d36f-069f-4996-adac-04871fe3c79b,"Mon, 20 Jun 2016 09:19:22 -0400",141332,557058:652d59a6-8d32-486e-8682-fa97a1afe06f,"Tue, 21 Jun 2016 06:28:27 -0400","

",124615,557058:5e9b51e2-3d91-4079-943a-ed719d119ea1,"Tue, 21 Jun 2016 06:56:52 -0400","

Responding to Laura's questions
We also need to document what behavior Anyone or Logged-In Non-Member can expect.
The default behaviour of ""non-logged in users"" or ""logged in users"" depends on how the default permissions are set up in the Realms tool - look at the !site.roles template.
The 2 'new' roles (called .auth and .anon) have existed in Sakai since the year dot, all we're doing here is surfacing the options within a site.
I dont know what the default options are at Notre Dame but here's what i'd suggest.
Can they Import from Site to their own site?
Does this Site appear in everyone's Resources ,Copy from other Sites ?
No - only sites that one is a member of appear there
If I'm given Student role, can I submit assignments and tests & quizzes and get grades?
If you have the .anon or .auth role then you cannot have another role so you cannot have the student role unless you are a site member and have been given that role.
If I'm Anyone, can I add a name and submit assignments and tests & quizzes and forums and get grades or does that mean I just get View?

""Anyone"" (ie, .anon / public) should never be allowed to submit anything to Sakai, it would be a huge security risk. logged in users, aka .auth can be allowed to submit (via permissions helper of the tool in question). this is OK as we know who did what and when.
If I'm Anyone, is there anything I can't View?

Assuming the permissions are set to ""view"" for all tools then everything should work EXCEPT Forums dont work with non-logged in users.

",141334,557058:5e9b51e2-3d91-4079-943a-ed719d119ea1,"Tue, 21 Jun 2016 06:58:10 -0400","

Here's an idea:

[SAK-31369] Rename "Site Tab Display Format" Options in Preferences "Sites" screen,https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/browse/SAK-31369,10057,SAK,Sakai,"

Related to
<a href=""https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/browse/SAK-31273"" class=""jira-issue-macro-key issue-link""  title=""Regression: Show site tabs as course code or course name missing"" >
The titles of the two different options in the ""Site Tab Display Format"" (formerly ""Show tabs as"") area in the Preferences ""Sites"" screen are misleading.
""Course code (e.g. F13-ACCT-134C-01)"" does not mean the actual roster ID in Sakai. Additionally, many sites do not use the site title format given as an example above.
""Course name/description (e.g. First Year Accounting)"" does not mean the course title.

column2: • Change ""Course name/description (e.g. First Year Accounting)"" to ""Site Short Description""

Earle Nietzel can we just recreate these tables instead of trying to drop the FKs?

",40536,557058:d4bf1967-6188-4b29-bf4a-95cf874b4a08,"Thu, 16 Jun 2016 11:13:22 -0400","

Dropping the tables would remove all of the currently configured triggers... Also the ScheduledInvocation job that runs would need to be re-added.
If someone were ok with recreating them then you could just drop them and run the following:

INSERT INTO QRTZ_TRIGGERS (SCHED_NAME, TRIGGER_NAME, TRIGGER_GROUP, JOB_NAME, JOB_GROUP, DESCRIPTION, NEXT_FIRE_TIME, PREV_FIRE_TIME, PRIORITY, TRIGGER_STATE, TRIGGER_TYPE, START_TIME, END_TIME, CALENDAR_NAME, MISFIRE_INSTR, JOB_DATA) VALUES ('QuartzScheduler', 'org.sakaiproject.component.app.scheduler.ScheduledInvocationManagerImpl.runner', 'org.sakaiproject.component.app.scheduler.ScheduledInvocationManagerImpl', 'org.sakaiproject.component.app.scheduler.ScheduledInvocationManagerImpl.runner', 'org.sakaiproject.component.app.scheduler.ScheduledInvocationManagerImpl', null, 0, 0, 5, 'WAITING', 'SIMPLE', 0, 0, null, 0, null);

INSERT INTO QRTZ_SIMPLE_TRIGGERS (SCHED_NAME, TRIGGER_NAME, TRIGGER_GROUP, REPEAT_COUNT, REPEAT_INTERVAL, TIMES_TRIGGERED) VALUES ('QuartzScheduler', 'org.sakaiproject.component.app.scheduler.ScheduledInvocationManagerImpl.runner', 'org.sakaiproject.component.app.scheduler.ScheduledInvocationManagerImpl', -1, 120000, 0);

[SAK-31364] Better Handle Legacy Semicolon (;) Separator Custom Strings in LTI Launches,https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/browse/SAK-31364,10057,SAK,Sakai,"

Sorry folks - In passing the LTI Compliance Tests, I switched from using semicolons to newlines to separate parameters. So strings like this:
x=2;y=3;z=4 did not get parsed properly for LTI 1.x placements installed via the Administrator external tools console or through Lessons.
But at the same time we need to support things like this for the certification test.

So a simple strategy to always or never map semicolons to newlines does not work to both pass certification and maintain upwards compatibility with existing LTI placements in Sakai.

",,49507,SAK-31364,Better Handle Legacy Semicolon (;) Separator Custom Strings in LTI Launches,10007,https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/secure/viewavatar?size=medium&avatarId=10303&avatarType=issuetype,Bug,10000,https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/images/icons/priorities/blocker.svg,Blocker,10025,https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/images/icons/statuses/generic.png,Indicates QA is complete and an issue has been tested and verified (Migrated on 12 Oct 2021 03:05 UTC),Verified,3,done,green,10000,Fixed,557058:718cd3f6-5ff9-42fa-8914-b4224aff1730,Charles Severance,557058:718cd3f6-5ff9-42fa-8914-b4224aff1730,Charles Severance,"Tue, 14 Jun 2016 12:38:15 -0400","Fri, 8 Jul 2016 06:17:36 -0400",11.0,BasicLTI,0,1,Development,customfield_10000,com.atlassian.jira.plugins.jira-development-integration-plugin:devsummarycf,Rank,0|1095e8:,customfield_10019,com.pyxis.greenhopper.jira:gh-lexo-rank,Sprint,customfield_10020,com.pyxis.greenhopper.jira:gh-sprint,"Fri, 17 Jun 2016 06:31:01 -0400",,,,,,,Test Plan,customfield_10038,com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.customfieldtypes:textarea,[CHART] Date of First Response,customfield_10024,com.atlassian.jira.ext.charting:firstresponsedate,,,11.0,12.0,57524,557058:718cd3f6-5ff9-42fa-8914-b4224aff1730,"Tue, 14 Jun 2016 14:49:29 -0400","

[SAK-31363] Session timeout dialog appears off-screen when user is scrolled down a page,https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/browse/SAK-31363,10057,SAK,Sakai,"

If you are on a long page in Sakai and near the bottom (or just further down than the height of your screen) when the session timeout dialog appears, the page just goes dark - the message remains at the top of the page.

This patch makes the dialog always appear in the middle of the screen, so the user will always know what's going on. I've also centred things a bit better.

[SAK-37834] Issue with making a page a PreRequisite for another page,https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/browse/SAK-37834,10057,SAK,Sakai,"

1. Login as Instructor, Select one of test site, click on Lessons
2. Add data into the page using, 'Add Content' -> 'Embed contents on page' -> Click on 'Choose file'
3. After selecting the files to upload, Click 'Save'
4. Click on 'Gear' icon (settings) -> Check 'Don't Release Page Until All Prerequisite Pages are Completed'
5. Now, Click on 'More tools' -> 'Add More Pages' -> Enter title for the PreReq page as ""LessonPreReq"" -> Click 'Save'
6. Add data into the (LessonPreReq) page using, 'Add Content' -> 'Embed contents on page' -> Click on 'Choose file'
7. After selecting the files to upload, Click 'Save'
Click on 'Gear' icon (settings) -> Check 'Require This Page'
8. Now Login as Student, Select the test site, click on Lessons
A student shouldn't see contents in 'Lessons' page unless 'LessonsPreReq' is opened in the first place. But the student is able to open the Lessons page directly

[SAK-36721] ExtendedTime entries may duplicate,https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/browse/SAK-36721,10057,SAK,Sakai,"

Within the original extended time code, it was possible for the following situation to occur:
Here is an example from PublishedMetadata database entries:
AssessmentID and Label should be a unique pair.
This occurred on 11.x based on 7eb73319d75. It also occurred locally on our original extendedTime code.

This is not a good situation. Extended time data is retrieved using the getAssessmentMetaDataByLabel method. As there are two labels for the same AssessmentID it's a toss up on which entry would be retrieved. This can result in odd behavior (entries showing up in the UI, refreshing, and then not being present); this behavior is what was experienced in the original 2.9 implementation.

To resolve this, I've refactored how extendedTime entries are saved.

",,27609,SAK-36721,ExtendedTime entries may duplicate,10007,https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/secure/viewavatar?size=medium&avatarId=10303&avatarType=issuetype,Bug,10001,https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/images/icons/priorities/critical.svg,Critical,5,https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/images/icons/statuses/resolved.png,"A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.",Resolved,3,done,green,10004,Incorporated,6164daac2f6aed00680684e4,SAMIGO TEAM,557058:484caead-d9ac-463d-bf51-f7c22821a458,Leonardo Canessa,"Tue, 14 Jun 2016 05:04:20 -0400","Tue, 17 Apr 2018 04:38:59 -0400",11.0,Tests & Quizzes (Samigo),1,3,Development,customfield_10000,com.atlassian.jira.plugins.jira-development-integration-plugin:devsummarycf,Rank,0|1095fc:,customfield_10019,com.pyxis.greenhopper.jira:gh-lexo-rank,Sprint,customfield_10020,com.pyxis.greenhopper.jira:gh-sprint,"Tue, 22 Nov 2016 15:27:23 -0500",,,,,,,[CHART] Date of First Response,customfield_10024,com.atlassian.jira.ext.charting:firstresponsedate,[CHART] Time in Status,customfield_10025,com.atlassian.jira.ext.charting:timeinstatus,,,,,157998,557058:7074e357-325c-4f04-880f-321ecd7c7dc5,"Thu, 16 Jun 2016 04:24:26 -0400",

This seems like at least a critical priority issue. How can the use be affected?

,74358,557058:484caead-d9ac-463d-bf51-f7c22821a458,"Thu, 16 Jun 2016 05:06:52 -0400","

We only noticed it causing extended time issues to not show up in the UI in the original 2.9.3 based version. When I was testing it in 11, I only went so far as to check if a duplicate (null) record was present. It could in theory cause unexplained behavior. The data structures which store this information are HashSet's / HashMaps which If I recall correctly do not allow duplicates. I do not know hibernate well enough to know how it would handle this case.

Extended Time is one thing, among many, which must be refactored within Samigo.

",191600,70121:ec0fd122-4a2d-4492-a966-78d3f9aa9080,"Tue, 22 Nov 2016 15:27:31 -0500","

This should be incorporated now by
<a href=""https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/browse/SAK-35101"" class=""jira-issue-macro-key issue-link""  title=""Refactor extended time database model to be more efficient"" >

",174621,70121:2bc1ac0d-6e97-45b2-8f53-2c25be8f3f6a,"Tue, 14 Jun 2016 06:12:58 -0400","

Charles Hedrick In lesson, when we click add content link, click upload zip files and upload the zipped file (that has word, pdf, png, jpg files in it) we are getting the message as shown in the snapshot : http://www.evernote.com/shard/s657/sh/46044046-17aa-4f00-ac5e-4a694f0feef7/9e6221c8185a3232bcfa7df14421acb9

","Tue, 14 Jun 2016 08:35:49 +0000",,,,,,,,,,,124592,6164d3a564ff010071b75c26,"Tue, 14 Jun 2016 06:33:43 -0400","

The expected behavior is this:

column2: • Look for a web page to show in Lessons. The simplest is a file index.html or index.htm at the top level. Some other things can be recognized that are produced by the three tools I listed.

column1: If we find the web page, then we add a link to it in Lessons. Otherwise there's nothing to show in Lessons, so we give that warning message.

The intent was never to show some kind of file browser into the contents of the ZIP file. Rather, the idea was that someone would be using a desktop tool that prepares content. A lot of those tools output a set of web pages in a ZIP file with index.html as an index into them. E.g. it used to be that Powerpoint would output a presentation as a set of web pages (though I'm not sure current versions still do that). There was an index.html at the top level. It's actually not that hard to display a browser. Sakai has a URL that would do that. But no one ever suggested that that would be something faculty would want.

",158008,557058:7074e357-325c-4f04-880f-321ecd7c7dc5,"Mon, 20 Jun 2016 07:01:20 -0400",

I moved this from a bug to a feature request .

[SAK-36534] Survey: Matrix of Choices - many instances of this type in a single page produces misbehavior,https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/browse/SAK-36534,10057,SAK,Sakai,"

When many instances of the Survey: Matrix of Choices type question are in a single page, the front end handler for the ""forced ranking"" (single answer per column) code, from won't properly identified the isolated container for each question, leading to misbehavior.
It picks up the forced property of other matrices, not allowing people to either select multiple, or select a single options per column. Also, it makes already selected same-row options disappear.
I uploaded an example XML which can be imported in 11 and tested. The third matrix - part 5, question 1 - is not constrained for single answers per column, yet the handler fails.

Pull request: SAM-2926

Interesting. The original patch (which was contributed – I didn't write it, and probably wouldn't have) was only intended to allow multiple files through the resources helper. As far as I know, only one file will be accepted from the upload button. I didn't realize that the file HTML control allowed you to select more than one. That's why there's no code in Lessons to deal with it. If it's true across browsers, I'll look at supporting it. I'm not sure whether I want to do that for 11 or not. It's a bit late for new features, and that's going to require a fair amount of Javascript.

",157991,6164d3a564ff010071b75c26,"Tue, 14 Jun 2016 08:36:59 -0400","

At least with Safari, multiple files work fine. I need to put some work into the UI to reflect that.

",141317,6164d3a564ff010071b75c26,"Wed, 15 Jun 2016 06:33:46 -0400","

I'm redoing the UI so you get a list of files chosen, with red X to let you remove one.

There's going to be a price for this. I'm disabling the ability to choose more than one file at a time. You can choose one and then choose another. But you can't open the browser's pick window and pick two adjacent files at once.

The problem is that Javascript doesn't let you remove one file from the list of files chosen. You can probably get away with it, but it's specifically documented as prohibited. I don't want to write code that does things you're not supposed to do, because it's liable to break the next time the browser vendors decide to tighten security.

I think overall it's a much more usable UI, but there will that loss.

","Tue, 14 Jun 2016 08:42:28 +0000",,,,,,,,,,,57533,6164d3a564ff010071b75c26,"Thu, 16 Jun 2016 07:37:01 -0400","

I'm showing no merge status for 10 or 11. This isn't a bug fix, exactly, but it is a definite improvement in the UI. My concern is that the same dialog is used in something like 6 contexts, and there are lots of paths through the code. Testing is going to be a bear. So I think this may be a bit late for 11. On the other hand, without this, there are some loose ends with the patch adding item names to the file chooser. That was put into 10 even though it might not have been quite ready. So maybe this patch should go into 10 and 11.

[SAK-31358] Condense Add Participants workflow to two screens,https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/browse/SAK-31358,10057,SAK,Sakai,"

The ""Add Participants"" workflow should be simplified and condensed to two screens.

column2: • The first screen allows a user to enter the accounts that they would like to add to the site (preferably in only one box).
• The next page allows the user to set the role for each user, whether they should be marked active or inactive, and if emails should be sent to notify users. There is no confirmation page.

column1: There is a much bigger discussion to be had about the various other workflows in Site Info, but this change will take a step in the right direction.

The University of Dayton has completed work similar to this and will create a pull request within the next two weeks.

[SAK-31354] Move Profile2 popup styles into global compiled css.,https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/browse/SAK-31354,10057,SAK,Sakai,"

Profile2 styles are currently served up by the tool itself and are not automatically available globally. This means that if you want to incorporate a fragment of profile into another tool you need to include the css in a div, or merge it into the header with some JS. Neither of these are ideal. Profile2 is a core part of Sakai so the styles should live in a globally available place.

[SAK-31352] Add the ability for the Calendar Entity Provider to return a detailed response when in list mode,https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/browse/SAK-31352,10057,SAK,Sakai,"

In the current entity provider, the description of an event is inside the CalendarEventDetails object, which is only accessible once you have the eventId. This was designed on purpose to allow for a faster and leaner response when in list mode then drilling into the details.
However sometimes it is useful to have the full details up front so that you don't need to make subsequent multiple requests to get the details for each event.
Combined with the recent time range params that were added (
<a href=""https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/browse/SAK-31206"" class=""jira-issue-macro-key issue-link""  title=""Add the ability to get a range of events from the calendar entityprovider"" >
), you can request the events for a given day. If that day had 5 events, you would need to make 5 subsequent requests to get the descriptions for each.

This tickets adds an optional detailed param that if true, will return the full detailed object instead of the summary. Defaults to false to maintain backwards compatibility.

",,23072,SAK-31352,Add the ability for the Calendar Entity Provider to return a detailed response when in list mode,10030,https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/secure/viewavatar?size=medium&avatarId=10300&avatarType=issuetype,(Deprecated) Contributed Patch,10002,https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/images/icons/priorities/major.svg,Major,6,https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/images/icons/statuses/closed.png,"The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Is this related to

<a href=""https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/browse/SAK-37640"" class=""jira-issue-macro-key issue-link""  title=""Lessons: images in multiple columns exceed the boundary of a block – see screenshot "" >

?

",124715,6164d3a564ff010071b75c26,"Mon, 15 Aug 2016 07:34:58 -0400","

Related, but not the same. I'm not sure how to fix it, because I'm not sure what a fix would look like.
At the moment there are two interacting specifications:

column2: • width and height: if you specify them I use them

column1: In the normal case you don't specify width and height. The image comes up its natural size. If the column is too small it gets scaled to fit.
However if you specify a width and a height, it will use the height, but use a maximum width of 100%. This can result in an image with the wrong aspect ratio.

The right solution seems to be to specify the width but not the height. In that case it uses the specified width, but if the column gets narrow it is scaled. The problem is that for some reason if you specify a width but not a height, I don't actually use it. So this is a bug (or more likely, I didn't think carefully enough about the possible cases).

This could produce unexpected results with an existing page that has a height specified, with narrow columns. I don't think I want to do overflow auto. That will produce horizontal scrolling. In an environment with multiple columns, and even worse, on an iPhone, that's a mess. I think scaling makes a lot more sense.

Normally there's no issue, as you'll let the size default. If you really need to change the size, I'm going to recommend setting width only. But then I have to fix the problem. It's a one-line patch, so it would be safe for sakai 11.1 if you want it.

",158110,6164d3a564ff010071b75c26,"Mon, 15 Aug 2016 07:43:56 -0400","

Another approach would be to check exactly what is and isn't specified. If height is specified, then remove the max-width and add overflow auto. That would cause horizontal scrolling only in the case where someone specifically give a height. I just really don't think horizontal scrolling is sensible

Another possibility would be to ignore the height entirely. That makes sense if you don't think there's ever a case where someone intentionally wants to display an image with an aspect ratio other than what's in the file.

There's just no really wonderful solution.

","Mon, 15 Aug 2016 11:07:55 +0000",,,,,,38735,image1.png,847455,ug:1256d28e-678c-4790-9374-95d6ebeda011,"Fri, 10 Jun 2016 10:46:01 -0400",174747,6164d3a564ff010071b75c26,"Mon, 15 Aug 2016 07:47:33 -0400","

The same issue could probably occur for some types of video if the user specifies a height that's too large. However normally video players assume that the size is the size of the player, but they display the video within it with the right aspect ratio. Even if it puts black bars around it.

",57641,6164d3a564ff010071b75c26,"Mon, 15 Aug 2016 11:11:13 -0400","

I've added a second commit that has javascript to preserve the aspect ratio. If the user specifies both width and height, I use the aspect ratio from that. Otherwise I compute it from the native size of the image.

If the image, using the size specified by the user, is too large for the column, the width is reduced to fit because of max-width:100%. Javascript then recomputes the height to have the correct aspect ratio.

Both commits together should be a complete solution that scales rather than doing horizontal scrolling.

",57642,70121:9335f09f-0d23-4a59-9aac-ba36f9cb223a,"Tue, 16 Aug 2016 06:56:56 -0400","

[SAK-34195] Tests & Quizzes - "Require Rationale" is not a required element once enabled,https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/browse/SAK-34195,10057,SAK,Sakai,"

When enabled, the ""Require Rationale"" option displays a text box, but this element is not a ""required"" element for the given question. A user can leave the box blank and continue with an assessment or submit for grading.

Either this is a language/UX issue (for example, the wording should be changed from ""Require Rationale"" to ""Request Rationale"" or similar) or a bug (any logic test for content in the rationale text box is not working).
I do not know if this was designed to treat the ""rationale"" box as optional, so I am marking as a bug since the word ""required"" is part of the page.

(If technical review determines that logic was never in place to test against data entered in the Rationale box, I can update this JIRA ticket or create a new ticket to add a ""feature request."" I would then modify the description to recommend changing the word ""Require"" to ""Request"" and then recommend adding a selection checkbox for the instructor below or to the right of ""Request Rationale"" to indicate whether this is should be a required element. If this option is checked, then add new programming logic to test the box to be sure a student enters something into the box.)
Tested on maintenance 10 branch since trunk is down for the moment.

Thank you.

","https://qa10-mysql.nightly.sakaiproject.org/portal/",49497,SAK-34195,"Tests & Quizzes - ""Require Rationale"" is not a required element once enabled",10007,https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/secure/viewavatar?size=medium&avatarId=10303&avatarType=issuetype,Bug,10003,https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/images/icons/priorities/minor.svg,Minor,10000,https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/images/icons/statuses/generic.png,"Issue has been created but has not yet been reviewed and validated, should not be worked on yet (Migrated on 12 Oct 2021 03:05 UTC)",Awaiting Review,2,new,blue-gray,-1,Unresolved,6164daac2f6aed00680684e4,SAMIGO TEAM,557058:28026415-aa37-4afe-90ce-f986ae44e5d8,Alan Regan,"Fri, 10 Jun 2016 08:20:26 -0400","Tue, 26 Feb 2019 02:55:37 -0500",10.7,Tests & Quizzes (Samigo),1,4,Development,customfield_10000,com.atlassian.jira.plugins.jira-development-integration-plugin:devsummarycf,Rank,0|1095kw:,customfield_10019,com.pyxis.greenhopper.jira:gh-lexo-rank,Sprint,customfield_10020,com.pyxis.greenhopper.jira:gh-sprint,,,,,,,,[CHART] Date of First Response,customfield_10024,com.atlassian.jira.ext.charting:firstresponsedate,,,,,,,,175219,5d275d132c5a110c1d476990,"Fri, 5 May 2017 09:47:54 -0400","

Test-takers can and should be able to submit assessments with any question(s) blank, including the ""required"" part of a question that impacts scoring (i.e. if you leave the answer for a multiple choice question blank, you get it wrong).

If a validation error were to prevent submission with blank questions, how could a timer thread or autosubmit job possibly handle that situation? If the label for the text box is confusing, just change it. Logic to attempt to block submission on blank answers could have devastatingly negative consequences for users.

",76523,557058:28026415-aa37-4afe-90ce-f986ae44e5d8,"Mon, 25 Feb 2019 10:57:14 -0500","

Follow up on this older request, if the item is changed to simply update the language to ""Request Rationale"" instead of ""Require Rationale"" – would that be acceptable? The word ""require"" suggests data validation to me. Since implementing validation would prove problematic (and I agree with your points), changing the instructor label when creating a question could help explain the feature (and not set a false expectation)?
I could see either ""Request Rationale"" or ""Ask for Rationale"" as possible labels.

column2: • The label for this feature is different between a ""Multiple Choice"" question and a ""True/False"" question. M/C says ""Require Rationale"" and T/F says ""Required Rationale."" I stumbled upon this when testing. Whatever label is selected, it should be consistent for any question type that uses this feature. If there is consensus on changing the label, we can kill two birds with one JIRA.

• The default help articles should be updated to reflect how this feature works. The documentation currently says, ""This option determines whether or not students are required to state why the statement is true or false when they submit a response."" Use of ""are required"" in the help content can set a false expectation that students must enter something in the box. Since students can leave the box empty, Possible language to consider:

column3: • Indicate whether students will see a ""Rationale"" box with the question to explain why they have selected their answer(s).
• This option offers a ""Rationale"" box to accompany the question, where a student may enter an explanation for the answer(s) they selected.

column2: • Separate item – The ""Reset Selection"" link displays to the right of the Rationale box for a student. Since the link will reset both the selection options and the content in the Rationale box, perhaps locating the link below the box rather than to the right of the box is a better choice? I can create a separate JIRA ticket for this (if one doesn't already exist).

• Separate item – When clicking the ""Reset Selection,"" the user receives a notice that seems unrelated to the action taken. The notification prompt says, ""(URL) says Please use the previous and next buttons on the page to navigate."" I'm not sure if a different message was intended to confirm the action or if any notification is needed at all. I can create a separate JIRA (if one doesn't already exist) if desired.

• Separate item – Should any student instruction be included in the assessment with the ""Rationale"" box? Currently, a student sees the text ""Rationale:"" followed by the box. This may be self-explanatory, but I wonder whether a short statement might help students. A possible instruction might be, ""Please explain why you selected your answer(s).""

column1:
Sorry to add a number of items here, but wanted to get down my thoughts after revisiting this topic.

",93369,557058:28026415-aa37-4afe-90ce-f986ae44e5d8,"Mon, 25 Feb 2019 10:58:35 -0500","

Note – if a text label change is the preferred action, I will change this from a ""bug"" to a ""feature request"" and update the ticket accordingly.

","Fri, 5 May 2017 13:47:54 +0000",,,,,,,,,,,110096,5d275d132c5a110c1d476990,"Mon, 25 Feb 2019 12:57:46 -0500","

Alan Regan I'm surprised that many instructors would take the word ""require"" when referring to any part of an assessment to mean ""data validation"". I'd assume most users (excluding computer science instructors or other technology experts) would read ""required"" as ""students will be awarded points for entering an appropriate explanation in this box"", in much the same way as an answer to an essay question would be ""required"".
That being said, I'm not a fan of the label Require Rationale anyway, and I don't feel it sufficiently describes the option. I think some text changes would suffice to resolve the issue.

Do we even want to keep the word ""Rationale""? There is a good technical argument in its favor - #rationale is what you type in to include the rationale option in a question created from markup text. However, if there's confusion about the function of the option, I might call it something like Allow Student Explanation, or even Allow students to explain their answer. The second label I suggest is probably too long for a check box, but it seems pretty clear that the option will provide some space where students can state why they chose particular answer option(s).

column2: • Obviously the typo/text difference on editing True/False questions should be fixed. It's such a minor issue, I haven't bothered to create a jira for it, but it has been around since Sakai 10.2 or earlier.
<li>I'm not sure to which default Help article you are referring (or is this text within Samigo itself?), but I have submitted the following text to be included in the Sakai Help:

column1: The default setting is No for requiring rationale. Select Yes to include a Rationale text box where students can enter a reason for choosing their answer.
The complete Help articles for which I sent copy requests to Sakai Screensteps can be found here:

column2: • I think Reset Selection should display immediately underneath the answer choices (as it does for questions that don't have a Rationale box available), and the Reset Selection option's behavior should be changed to not clear out the Rationale box.  To me, Reset Selection should ONLY impact the selected option, i.e., True, False, or the Multiple Choice option(s) that were previously selected.  This issue needs a separate jira.

• As related to #3 above, if it is not possible to make Reset Selection ignore the rationale box, the error that should be displayed should pop up/appear BEFORE clearing the selection and rationale box, e.g.:

column1: Choosing Reset Selection will also delete the text entered in the Rationale box. Are you sure you want to reset your selection?
And the selection and text box should only be cleared if you select Yes when that warning message pops up. (Obviously the wording would need to be different if Rationale is removed).

column2: • I think the label on the student's text field while taking the assessment should be changed. I propose completely eliminating the word ""Rationale"" from the student view and making the label the following: Explain your answer:

column1:
",126763,5d275d132c5a110c1d476990,"Mon, 25 Feb 2019 13:00:11 -0500","

And I just realized that ""students"" should probably not be a word included in the option label for instructors, since you can use Tests & Quizzes for surveys too... hmm, might have to think more on that.
Maybe something like one of the following?

[SAK-31350] Roster "Last Visit" column shows even if it is turned off in properties,https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/browse/SAK-31350,10057,SAK,Sakai,"

Apparently, even if Last Visit is off in sakai.properties (which it is by default) , the Last Visit column still shows. But that means, no matter how many times a student visits the site, the instructor will see ""None yet"" for the last visit.

I've included a PDF of the discussion from the sakai-dev list .

[SAK-31346] Error when unzipping file if content entity already exists,https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/browse/SAK-31346,10057,SAK,Sakai,"

Sometimes, when unzipping an archive in resources, the content collections and resources are created in an illogical order, causing an IdUsedException to be thrown.
For example, in one file I have a structure like:
It creates the entities in top-down order. When it gets to ""mobile/"" it already exists, therefore the error is thrown.

This patch will get the content entity edit object if IdUsedException is thrown.

[SAK-31342] Private announcements are visible to users who dont have permission to view them (via merging),https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/browse/SAK-31342,10057,SAK,Sakai,"

In case of merged announcements, private announcement is visible to a user who has no access to the site in which announcement is.

1. create site A, add new announcement 'AN1' with access option as 'Only members of this site can see this announcement' . Add another announcement 'AN2' with access option 'This announcement is publicly viewable'.
2. create site B ,add User with 'access' role to this site. Merge announcements from site A to this site.
3. Login as user added in site B and view announcements tool.

'AN1' should only be visible to the members of the site A.

2. create site B ,add User with 'access' role to this site. Merge announcements from site A to this site.

'AN1' should only be visible to the members of the site A.
II) Set announcement.merge.visibility.strict=false (or dont specify this property in the props file) then

1. create site A, add new announcement 'AN1' with access option as 'Only members of this site can see this announcement' . Add another announcement 'AN2' with access option 'This announcement is publicly viewable'.
