[SAK-31341] Add the ability to suppress a tool's title nav from the portal via tool configuration,https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/browse/SAK-31341,10057,SAK,Sakai,"

The output of the tool title nav in the portal is fairly basic and difficult to style individually per tool. This is compounded when using a multi column layout with multiple small widgets on a page and the title is output everywhere.
This feature will add the ability for a tool title to be suppressed per tool placement. This then means that the tool itself can emit its own header.

To use, in the tool registration XML or in a tool placement set `suppressTitle=true` and the title will be suppressed from the output. The tool must then manage it itself.

[SAK-32947] Need to implement restrictions when using Drop Highest / Drop Lowest / Keep Highest,https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/browse/SAK-32947,10057,SAK,Sakai,"

In GBNG, there are currently no restrictions in place re: point values when using Drop Highest / Drop Lowest / Keep Highest.

This means that, currently, you can have items with different total point values being used for these drop/keep calculations. This can therefore lead to incorrect scores being kept/dropped, as the drop/keep rules look to the score received, not the score's percentage. Therefore, with drop lowest, a score of 40/50 will be dropped before a score of 50/200.
To remedy this, we should add limitations in GBNG, similar to those which exist in GB1. These include:

There should be a restriction in Settings, preventing users from using drop highest / drop lowest / keep highest in a category that has items with multiple, different point totals in place. The field for a given category should just be greyed out, with alt text explaining that ""This category contains items with different point totals. To use [x], all items must have the same point total.""

When adding a GB item, if a category with drop highest / drop lowest / keep highest is selected and a point total different than the established point totals for the category has been entered into the ""Points"" field, provide a confirmation dialog upon clicking ""Create"" that warns the user that the established point total will be applied to this item.

The points field should be greyed out. If a different category is selected, the field can become editable.

",,45449,SAK-32947,Need to implement restrictions when using Drop Highest / Drop Lowest / Keep Highest,10012,https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/secure/viewavatar?size=medium&avatarId=10315&avatarType=issuetype,Feature Request,,,,6,https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/images/icons/statuses/closed.png,"The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.",Closed,3,done,green,10000,Fixed,6164df29a707100069fcdfd6,kyleblythe,6164df29a707100069fcdfd6,kyleblythe,"Wed, 8 Jun 2016 09:37:24 -0400","Mon, 14 Aug 2017 08:34:59 -0400",12.0,Gradebook,0,1,Development,customfield_10000,com.atlassian.jira.plugins.jira-development-integration-plugin:devsummarycf,Rank,0|10atps:,customfield_10019,com.pyxis.greenhopper.jira:gh-lexo-rank,Sprint,customfield_10020,com.pyxis.greenhopper.jira:gh-sprint,"Mon, 3 Oct 2016 00:38:46 -0400",,,,,,,[CHART] Date of First Response,customfield_10024,com.atlassian.jira.ext.charting:firstresponsedate,,,,,,12.0,,175528,557058:c7ed084d-c59c-4475-8ab7-81e1908270f0,"Thu, 9 Jun 2016 12:20:00 -0400","

A couple of additional restrictions for feature parity with GB1 in Sakai 10/11, as noted by Molly Kelsey (Notre Dame):
Combinations of Drop Highest / Drop Lowest / Keep Highest:

column2: • If Drop Highest & Keep Highest are implemented at the same time, they must be mutually exclusive. For a given category, only one of these setting can have a non-0 value. Replacing a value with 0 will allow for the other setting to be changed to a non-0 value.

• If Drop Lowest & Keep Highest are implemented at the same time, they must be mutually exclusive. For a given category, only one of these setting can have a non-0 value. Replacing a value with 0 will allow for the other setting to be changed to a non-0 value.

column1:
Drop Highest & Drop Lowest can continue to work together, with each having non-0 numbers in place for a given category.

[SAK-32968] "percentage" mode - category subtotal calc errors,https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/browse/SAK-32968,10057,SAK,Sakai,"

The category subtotal (and possibly course grade? my math skills are not up to the challenge of figuring that out) don't seem to be reflected correctly when in ""Percentage"" mode.
Note: for the following, I'm using categories & weighting.
In the image above, you can see that there are three items with scores and different relative item weights (one worth 300, one worth 100, and one worth 200).
For Julio tester, a cat subtotal score of 31.67% is reported. However, they should have a 53.33%. Maybe I'm mistaken, but I think the calculation for this should be:
Likewise, Taifa tester is reporting a cat subtotal score of 15%. This should be 30%, with the calculation for this being:

( (0 _ 300) + (.75 _ 200) ) / (300 + 200) = .3

[SAK-31338] Unable to copy an announcement that was created by the same thread,https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/browse/SAK-31338,10057,SAK,Sakai,"

We have some custom code that creates an Observer and adds it to the EventTrackingService for copying certain announcements to another site when they are created. In migrating to Sakai 11, this is no longer functioning.
The problem is due to the fix for
<a href=""https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/browse/SAK-28955"" class=""jira-issue-macro-key issue-link""  title=""Announcement email sent immediately without subject or body"" >

, which removes a message from a cached list when it is committed. Later, when we try to copy the newly created message, the message list in cache for the given context is missing the new one and so it cannot be copied.
The fix we'll be testing here is to replace the announcement in the cached list rather than remove it. This doesn't appear to cause a regression in
<a href=""https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/browse/SAK-28955"" class=""jira-issue-macro-key issue-link""  title=""Announcement email sent immediately without subject or body"" >
as far as I can tell. Alternatively the entire list could be removed, forcing a refresh from the DB.

Admittedly a minor issue that may not affect anyone else, but there it is.

",,53801,SAK-31338,Unable to copy an announcement that was created by the same thread,10007,https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/secure/viewavatar?size=medium&avatarId=10303&avatarType=issuetype,Bug,10003,https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/images/icons/priorities/minor.svg,Minor,10000,https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/images/icons/statuses/generic.png,"Issue has been created but has not yet been reviewed and validated, should not be worked on yet (Migrated on 12 Oct 2021 03:05 UTC)",Awaiting Review,2,new,blue-gray,-1,Unresolved,6164d8abc7bea400699b1b9e,Core Team,604a48c6ceccdd006a36931a,curtis van-osch,"Wed, 8 Jun 2016 05:28:35 -0400","Wed, 8 Jun 2016 05:28:35 -0400",10.4,Announcements,0,1,Development,customfield_10000,com.atlassian.jira.plugins.jira-development-integration-plugin:devsummarycf,Rank,0|1095p4:,customfield_10019,com.pyxis.greenhopper.jira:gh-lexo-rank,Sprint,customfield_10020,com.pyxis.greenhopper.jira:gh-sprint,,Message (Internal Services),,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,11.0,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,

Issues which are closed can be reopened.",Closed,3,done,green,10000,Fixed,6164d3a564ff010071b75c26,Charles Hedrick,6164f2eb071a720071a72172,Juan Arcadio Martinez Carceles,"Wed, 8 Jun 2016 00:14:37 -0400","Wed, 18 Apr 2018 03:30:32 -0400",11.0,Lessons,0,3,Development,customfield_10000,com.atlassian.jira.plugins.jira-development-integration-plugin:devsummarycf,Rank,0|1095qg:,customfield_10019,com.pyxis.greenhopper.jira:gh-lexo-rank,Sprint,customfield_10020,com.pyxis.greenhopper.jira:gh-sprint,"Thu, 9 Jun 2016 08:02:36 -0400",,,,,,,Test Plan,customfield_10038,com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.customfieldtypes:textarea,[CHART] Date of First Response,customfield_10024,com.atlassian.jira.ext.charting:firstresponsedate,,,11.0,12.0,74331,6164d3a564ff010071b75c26,"Wed, 8 Jun 2016 04:26:17 -0400","

I'll do that, but this link is normally not needed. It's there just to show what the embedded tool is going to look like. In fact the embedded content doesn't show in that example, so the user would be expected to choose a different alternative. If they accept this one, what's going to go into the page is just what you see there: the link and no actual embedded content.

It may be better not to show the link at all.

",191297,6164d3a564ff010071b75c26,"Thu, 9 Jun 2016 08:03:41 -0400","

The fix is not to show the link. It's misleading, since someone might think if they click it and get the right result, they're OK. In fact since the idea is to embed content, if it doesn't show in embedded form, they need to try the other alternative.

",191305,70121:2bc1ac0d-6e97-45b2-8f53-2c25be8f3f6a,"Mon, 13 Jun 2016 11:33:06 -0400","

What is the expected results of this test? I tested on trunk nightly server on Oracle, didn't see ""test image link"" when I click save (test image Link used to pop out in QA01 server). Screenshot: http://www.evernote.com/shard/s657/sh/08539f43-3bd3-4308-af1b-fbce608df1eb/d8a2dfd6402d230c1b471cbdb37f88e9

","

1. Click on Add Content+
2. Click on Embed content on page.
3. Add a URL. (for example, type www.sakaiproject.org)

6. This link should be opened in a new tab/window.

",Relate,49503,SAK-37627,relates to,10008,19389,LBtestImageLink.png,83355,ug:418d5d1e-4fc1-4b5c-98aa-8c418e826b17,"Wed, 8 Jun 2016 00:14:28 -0400",40519,6164d3a564ff010071b75c26,"Mon, 13 Jun 2016 11:53:12 -0400","

That's the expected result.
When you try to embed a link, we try two approaches, asking the user to pick one.

The first approach uses oembed. This uses a special Internet protocol supported by many sites, that gives you specific embedding code. It's only going to work with video sharing sites that support it. The second approach puts the URL in an IFRAME. That's a generic approach that ought to give you something, but some sites take specific action to prevent you from embedding them in an iframe, and some URLs may have too much advertising and other framing around the actual video for that to be useful.
If one of the approaches doesn't work, you'll likely not see anything. In that case you should try the other approach.
For a lot of sites, quite likely neither approach will work. In that case we have to hope that the site gives you an embed code that you can paste. I support that approach as well.

The link used in the test was www.sakaiproject.org. This is not a video sharing site. It almost certainly won't respond to OEMBED. It should show up in an iframe, though I haven't checked it. So the first alternative should be blank and the second one should show the site in the iframe. Presumably you wouldn't actually try to embed that site. You'd most likely link to it.

<a href=""https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/browse/EVALSYS-641"" class=""jira-issue-macro-key issue-link""  title=""Error when adding an evaluation but not templates available"" >

column2: • You'll have to test this one on the nightly experimental server
• Go into that server, and login as admin
• Add the Evaluation Tool to some site
• Add a template, just fill in the required fields
• Add an evaluation, just add the title and required fields
• On the next page you should have date pickers that work. If you see date pickers than this fix worked!

[SAK-31331] Assessment links in HTML file don't open after getting downloaded,https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/browse/SAK-31331,10057,SAK,Sakai,"

1. Login as Instructor, Select one of course test site, click on Resources.
2. Go to Tests and Quizzes -> Create an assessment -> Publish the assessment
3. Go to resources -> Create a HTML page and add links to the assessment created -> Click on 'Continue'
4. Login as Student, Select the same course test site, click on Resources.
5. Click on the created html file
6. Open the downloaded file and click on the assessment link
Error appears on opening the link instead of the forum

I'll take a look, but if my memory doesn't fail, I think el finder doesn't try to open the link as a web link in a normal browser, it tries to open it with some kind of preview feature it has. I don't know if that behavior can be changed but if not, as the assessment link is not a link to file, it is a link to a servlet that open the assessment, there is not a way to ""preview"" this with the actual elFinder mechanism.
Anyway, as said, I will take a look. But I don't feel that this can be solved in this direction. The solution I can imagine is to find a way to disable the OPEN button in this kind of resources.

I don't have a lot of developing time now, so this will take time for me to be reviewed.

,157996,557058:1126cb77-b601-4bf1-a169-76deaba72266,"Wed, 15 Jun 2016 06:36:12 -0400",

This is because on the larger video files the uploads are chunked. The file fix for this is just to specify to the client that we want to disable chunked uploads.

,191316,557058:1126cb77-b601-4bf1-a169-76deaba72266,"Thu, 16 Jun 2016 04:30:04 -0400","

This was caused by pulling in a newer version of elfinder which is where the support for chunked uploads was introduced. There's a fix in the upstream library for this that should be merged soon: https://github.com/bluejoe2008/elfinder-2.x-servlet/pull/28

","

Check the elfinder functionality in full.

",Depend,62419,SAK-31417,is depended on by,10007,,,,,,191333,557058:7074e357-325c-4f04-880f-321ecd7c7dc5,"Wed, 22 Jun 2016 03:18:26 -0400","

Thanks!

",57551,557058:1126cb77-b601-4bf1-a169-76deaba72266,"Thu, 23 Jun 2016 04:22:27 -0400","

This bug doesn't just affect video upload, it's a problem for any upload over 2MB which is the default chunk size. If we want elfinder to be the default I think this is a blocker as it's rather broken and results in a mess being created the resources when the upload gets chunked.

You may have to put .itemclass at the beginning of your selectors.

will make the background of all divs red. Without the .itemclass the effects aren't what you intend. The extra element will also make it more likely that it will override existing declarations without needing !important, because of the way precedence is determined.
In some cases you may need even more to get greater preference. So you might also want to try

By using an explicit ID, you'll get a fairly high precedence.

",,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,"

1/ set ical.experimental=true in sakai.properties file, login as 'maintainer', visit the Calendar tool in a site, you should see the ""Publish (Public)"" button
2/ set ical.experimental=false in properties file, restart, then visit the Calendar tool in a siteas a maintainer, you should NOT see the ""Publish (Public)"" button
3/ replace 'ical.experimental' with 'ical.public.userdefined.subscribe' and set to true, restart, and, visit the Calendar tool in a siteas a maintainer, you should see the ""Publish (Public)"" button
4/ set ical.public.userdefined.subscribe=false, restart, then visit the Calendar tool in a site as a maintainer, you should NOT see the ""Publish (Public)"" button

5/ remove 'ical.public.userdefined.subscribe' (and double check that there is not still property 'ical.experimental'), restart server, then visit the Calendar tool in a site as a maintainer, you should see the ""Publish (Public)"" button

[SAK-35141] Auto submit job doesn't handle extended due dates,https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/browse/SAK-35141,10057,SAK,Sakai,"

The auto submit batch job doesn't check for extended due dates. So if you give someone an extended due date, and they've started the assessment, it will get auto submitted at the default due date.

",,31948,SAK-35141,Auto submit job doesn't handle extended due dates,10026,https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/secure/viewavatar?size=medium&avatarId=10300&avatarType=issuetype,Sub-task,10000,https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/images/icons/priorities/blocker.svg,Blocker,10025,https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/images/icons/statuses/generic.png,Indicates QA is complete and an issue has been tested and verified (Migrated on 12 Oct 2021 03:05 UTC),Verified,3,done,green,10000,Fixed,70121:ec0fd122-4a2d-4492-a966-78d3f9aa9080,Matthew Jones,6164d3a564ff010071b75c26,Charles Hedrick,"Tue, 7 Jun 2016 05:59:55 -0400","Tue, 17 Apr 2018 04:17:52 -0400",11.1,Tests & Quizzes (Samigo),2,15,Development,customfield_10000,com.atlassian.jira.plugins.jira-development-integration-plugin:devsummarycf,Rank,0|1095uo:,customfield_10019,com.pyxis.greenhopper.jira:gh-lexo-rank,Sprint,customfield_10020,com.pyxis.greenhopper.jira:gh-sprint,"Mon, 13 Feb 2017 03:36:43 -0500",,,,,,,Test Plan,customfield_10038,com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.customfieldtypes:textarea,[CHART] Date of First Response,customfield_10024,com.atlassian.jira.ext.charting:firstresponsedate,40922,SAK-35101,12.0,,107918,557058:7074e357-325c-4f04-880f-321ecd7c7dc5,"Sun, 12 Jun 2016 07:13:15 -0400","

I confirmed this problem on Trunk/master experimental on nightly. In addition to making sure the property is set, samigo.autoSubmit.enabled=true, one also has to run the quartz job manually (or set up a cron) logging in as admin. And also one needs to run auto submit oracle or mysql insert statements? https://github.com/sakaiproject/sakai/tree/master/samigo
Seems like that is what it took (and don't know if this will get overwritten when nightly experimental restarts or not.
You will know the setup is working if you see the auto submit option under Settings (see autosubmit_option.png for screenshot).
1) Set up a simple two question exam as instructor.
2) Choose settings. Set Due date pretty soon (with 5 - 10 minutes ) . Set Late Submissions (aka Retract date) to 5 minutes past the Due Date.
3) Set up an exception for 1 student to have a due date of a day later and late submission 5 minutes passed due date.

4) Take the test as 2 students but don't complete for either of them. 1 of the students must be the one that has the exception of tomorrow. Make sure at least one of the answers is saved, if not both (I just find it interesting to see how an unanswered question is handled.)
5) After the Due date for the class (not the exception) but before the Late Submission / Retract date, run the Auto Submit job as admin.
6) Check as instructor that no exams have been submitted. Works correctly.
7) Wait till after the Late Submission/Retract date. Run the Auto submit job as admin.
8) Check as instructor if any exams have been submitted.
Expected results: The student with the exception should not have had her exam submitted, the student without the exception should have had the exam submitted.
Actual results: Both students had their exam submitted. Incorrect behavior.

In any case, after setup, this is what I did.

",107922,557058:7074e357-325c-4f04-880f-321ecd7c7dc5,"Mon, 13 Jun 2016 07:43:00 -0400","

On the Jira Triage call, we like the idea of making this a blocker with a workaround. The Workaround being to have the exceptions ignored by auto submit.
Ideally, exceptions would work with auto submit based on the exception due date and accept until dates. We will open another ticket to get it fixed ""right"".

This means that a student for whom an instructor makes an exception will not be subject to the auto submit process.

",,23105,SAK-38145,Duplicate use of oracle sequence in Lesson Builder,10007,https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/secure/viewavatar?size=medium&avatarId=10303&avatarType=issuetype,Bug,10002,https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/images/icons/priorities/major.svg,Major,10000,https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/images/icons/statuses/generic.png,"Issue has been created but has not yet been reviewed and validated, should not be worked on yet (Migrated on 12 Oct 2021 03:05 UTC)",Awaiting Review,2,new,blue-gray,-1,Unresolved,557058:93841381-71b1-43f5-8290-4123e1cf2694,Juanjo Meroño,6164f2eb071a720071a72172,Juan Arcadio Martinez Carceles,"Tue, 7 Jun 2016 03:38:25 -0400","Wed, 18 Apr 2018 03:31:04 -0400",11.0,Lessons,0,4,Development,customfield_10000,com.atlassian.jira.plugins.jira-development-integration-plugin:devsummarycf,Rank,0|1095v4:,customfield_10019,com.pyxis.greenhopper.jira:gh-lexo-rank,Sprint,customfield_10020,com.pyxis.greenhopper.jira:gh-sprint,,,,,,,,[CHART] Date of First Response,customfield_10024,com.atlassian.jira.ext.charting:firstresponsedate,,,,,,,,57500,6164d3a564ff010071b75c26,"Tue, 7 Jun 2016 08:30:46 -0400","

It's not clear to me that this is a problem. It's the default behavior for Hibernate. If an Oracle expert from an Oracle institution wants to issue a PR, and verifies that they've tested it, I'll accept it. But I need to make sure that there are no other issues, such as requiring the sequence to be created manually (we normally expect Sakai to self-configure in new installations) or decreasing performance.

Also, we'd need to make sure that there's no possibility that the new sequence numbers might overlap existing ones.

",91200,6164d3a564ff010071b75c26,"Tue, 7 Jun 2016 08:40:53 -0400","

It's valid to use the same sequence for multiple tables. What happens is that there will be holes in the numbering for each table, because there's a single global sequence. At least that's how I read the documentalion, and my oracle test shows those holes. Thus the only disadvantage of using one sequence is that sequence numbers are larger than they otherwise would be, and conceivably we could need to allocate more space to store them.

My suspicion is that the new sequences would need to be created in the conversion script, and it would need to initialize the sequences to be beyond the maximum value of the existing sequence. This appears to be an issue with the patch for https://jira.sakaiproject.org/browse/SAK-30162. It does not seem to check the existing sequence. So I believe new sequence numbers would start at 1, and might overlap existing ones.

",74352,557058:93841381-71b1-43f5-8290-4123e1cf2694,"Tue, 14 Jun 2016 22:48:56 -0400","

I think is not a critical situation but in the future could cause problems, right now in Oracle these tables are sharing HIBERNATE_SEQUENCE:

The solution here is add some oracle script to create 9 sequences initialized with the last number from HIBERNATE_SEQUENCE, and at the same time modify the hbm files to use the concrete sequence for each table.

","Tue, 7 Jun 2016 12:30:46 +0000",Cloners (migrated),27417,SAK-30162,cloned as,10009,,,,,,107932,6164d3a564ff010071b75c26,"Wed, 15 Jun 2016 04:27:03 -0400",

I agree. But I'm not in a position to do Oracle-specific things. If an Oracle site want to create the scripts I'd be happy to accept them. The sample I got didn't initialize the new sequences from the highest existing number.

[SAK-31321] Allow tools to be rendered inline when in a multi column layout,https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/browse/SAK-31321,10057,SAK,Sakai,"

In Sakai 11+, tools can only be rendered inline (ie without iframes) if they are on a page on their own.

The portal creates a special URL directly to the tool /portal/site/SITE_ID/tool/TOOL_ID which treats these tools differently to tools that are on a page with other tools, and tries to render them inline, without an iframe.

When there are multiple tools on a page (which get a URL of the form /portal/site/SITE_ID/page/PAGE_ID), the PageHandler figures out what tools are in each column on that page and renders them within an iframe.

This contributed patch allows compatible tools* to declare that they are able to be rendered inline and gives the portal a final chance to render that tool inline. If it can be rendered inline, its header content will be aggregated into the main HTML <head> section, and its body content emitted in the normal place in the page, otherwise it falls back to an iframe.
This is activated via the tool configuration property:
which can be added to the tool registration XML or overridden as a tool property for each placement.

column2: • Not all tools will be compatible with this property, especially velocity and JSF tools. This property works well for widget based tools written in Wicket and client side applications. Originally written for: https://github.com/steveswinsburg/sakai-widgets

column1:

,91242,557058:718cd3f6-5ff9-42fa-8914-b4224aff1730,"Tue, 21 Jun 2016 06:11:32 -0400","

Steve, I am catching up here. I think this is a pretty bad mistake as constructed. There are several reasons for this. First, this would never work when more than one tool on the page would set this property. While I understand why this works as long as you only inline one tool on a multi-tool page - we have not at all tested the UI / CSS / responsiveness of this scenario.
It does not mean we can't explore this - but it is unsuitable as an 11.x or 11.0 feature as it needs to only be used very sparingly and every multi-tool page combination will need careful testing.
I wonder why the tool cannot function in an iframe - we have two mechanisms for resizing iframes - we added windows.postmessage in Sakai-11 so resizing even works across domains.

The real solution for anything that wants to be inlined in a multi-tool page is to make them JSR-168 portlets. I understand that for large tools with lots of internal hacks / url conventions that converting to JSR-168 is a good bit of work. But that very complexity within the tool that makes it hard to make a JSR-168 portlet is the exact same complexity that makes it worrisome to inline tools on multi-tool pages.

",107949,557058:718cd3f6-5ff9-42fa-8914-b4224aff1730,"Tue, 21 Jun 2016 06:14:48 -0400","

I am not suggesting that we revert this BTW. I am suggesting a bit of caution pushing it backwards. I also suggest that you add code to make sure that when there is more than one tool per page that only one of the tools is allowed to exercise this feature.

You can test just how bad this fails by putting two instances of the roster tool inlined on the same page and try to make them navigate independently.

",158012,557058:5489bdf1-0dcd-4429-8030-f007c405dfd0,"Tue, 21 Jun 2016 06:31:21 -0400","

Charles Severance Resizing iframes on a scroll event is really unpleasant. You get a jerk and then end up at the top after the resize. This really affects infinite scroll stuff like Roster2 - there's no smoothness at all. Two roster tools will cause problems due to the js namspacing - there's one Window.roster object and the two instances will overwrite each other's variables. One of these variables is the current page of members. So, the problem is likely to be that, not the fact that there are two inline tools there. You can test this by putting Clog and Roster together, inline. I'm going to test this myself, just to be sure, but I think you've gone down a blind red herring there.

Why would moving to JSR168 fix any of this? Do they always render in a div, not an iframe?

",57543,557058:718cd3f6-5ff9-42fa-8914-b4224aff1730,"Tue, 21 Jun 2016 06:42:13 -0400",

I also think that this needs one or two sakai.properties variables to control override behavior. Things my go bad and we need a way to broadly override things. And it goes without saying that Roster should learn to behave inside of an iframe.

,107950,557058:5489bdf1-0dcd-4429-8030-f007c405dfd0,"Tue, 21 Jun 2016 06:55:56 -0400","

Go on then, I'm intrigued. How should an infinite scroll tool designed to work with tons of rows behave in an iframe? I've tried resizing the frame on the scroll event and it sucks. You could also just render all of the members if inside an iframe. Thats sucks too, if you have a lot of people. You could just make the roster change its behaviour completely if in an iframe. Show a pager instead and just not bother with the infinite scroll. The best solution of all these, unless someone has a better idea, is to go frameless and let tools grow the actual page.

",158013,557058:5489bdf1-0dcd-4429-8030-f007c405dfd0,"Tue, 21 Jun 2016 06:59:12 -0400","

Regarding the properties: the renderInline is already a property and it can only really be set by admins on a tool placement basis. It's a power feature. If a tool has renderInline in its tool.xml, you can override that in the tool properties.

",174646,557058:718cd3f6-5ff9-42fa-8914-b4224aff1730,"Tue, 21 Jun 2016 11:11:36 -0400","

Infinite scroll usually needs a page that is designed for it. Yes it does not work in an iframe - it it still jumpy when it is ringed with divs top, bottom, left and right. But ah well - if you are going down that path ...

In terms of the property - having a site property or a tool registration property that is on by default does not mean the usage will be ""rare"" or ""for advanced users only"". If folks set up a template site with a multi-tool page with one inline tool - then the number of sites which do this will multiply rapidly. And if things go haywire it is nice to be able to shut them off without a database job or a code patch and recompile but instead a quick property change (even live) pushes them back in iframes. This was how we mitigate risk in the inline code for the past few years and it is a nice safety net if some change in tool code all of a sudden breaks inlining and we need to run for a few days or weeks until we can fix inlining.

In terms of the infinite scroll - I would detect when I was in an iframe and put a ""show more"" button at the bottom instead of infinite scroll - since you are in JavaScript it is an easy thing to do.

Also detecting when you are in an iframe and behaving makes things work better if the tool is used via LTI provider in some other LMS.

",40548,557058:5489bdf1-0dcd-4429-8030-f007c405dfd0,"Tue, 21 Jun 2016 11:26:39 -0400","

Okay, fair comment on the sakai property and the show more button.

However, I think the morpheus portal is perfect for infinite scroll tools - the tools are usually the lowest things on the page so all they'll do is stretch the page down. I can't see how growing a div dynamically is going to somehow screw up a tool rendered in an iframe on the same page. It may hide it as the page grows downwards, but surely that's it? Is it header merging that's the risk?

",,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,57545,557058:718cd3f6-5ff9-42fa-8914-b4224aff1730,"Tue, 21 Jun 2016 11:35:43 -0400","

The risk when there is more than one linlined tool is that the forms will post to one of the tools. And relative links in markup will be served by whichever tool the top URL is all about.

The way to make this a win-win is JSR-168. Then all works as advertised.

",40577,557058:93841381-71b1-43f5-8290-4123e1cf2694,"Wed, 6 Jul 2016 23:03:24 -0400","

I've tested this one and is not working very well. I've tested setting the configuration parameter renderInline to:
sakai.iframe.myworkspace: It raises an error (in the whole page), so you aren't able to set this configuration to true for this tool.
sakai.summary.calendar: It doesn't work the tool still appears inside an iframe.
sakai.synoptic.messagecenter: It doesn't work the tool still appears inside an iframe.
If you click on options inside ""sakai.motd"" portlet the page change to options mode in 2 portlets sakai.motd and sakai.iframe.myworkspace
Then the options mode of the 2 portlets are displayed without iframe, this is very weird because sakai.iframe.myworkspace doesn't have the renderInline configuration set !!

If you click on cancel inside one of the portlets, the mode goes back to ""normal"" in the 2 portlets at the same time, and sakai.iframe.myworkspace is still without iframe so the message is not displayed.
If you click in one announcement the announcement is displayed twice in the sakai.motd and sakai.synoptic.announcement portlets.
The behaviour is pretty similar to Home, lots of weird side effects.
I've moved this to open again because is not working properly.

",124645,557058:718cd3f6-5ff9-42fa-8914-b4224aff1730,"Thu, 7 Jul 2016 03:09:31 -0400","

Thanks. This verifies that this feature is a very dangerous hack. I am not recommending it be backed out - just used with a lot of discretion. The correct course of action is to refactor the roster tool as a JSR-168 portlet. And in truth - what you should really be doing is re-factoring the entire ""home"" page into a single JSR-168 portlet that integrates all of the current frames into a single portlet. That is the right strategy. Then the roster portion of the page could have as much infinite scroll as it liked and you could control the relative layout of the rectangles from within the tool. You are not doing the folks who want these features any favors by pushing such a poor solution.

",40579,557058:c7ed084d-c59c-4475-8ab7-81e1908270f0,"Thu, 7 Jul 2016 15:16:02 -0400","

It was not written for legacy velocity tools. It works perfectly fine for other tools, especially wicket. You will note it is not added to any tools by default.

Refactoring tools into portlets is not going to happen, I have 4 other ones that this works on perfectly fine, we should we able to render tools inline without completely rewriting them. They are all wicket tools too so there is no way to refactor to a portlet.
About to head off on a holiday, we can resume this discussion later.

It works.

",57577,557058:c7ed084d-c59c-4475-8ab7-81e1908270f0,"Thu, 7 Jul 2016 15:16:26 -0400","

Also note it is about to go into production, verification that it works perfectly fine in the right tools.

",74405,557058:93841381-71b1-43f5-8290-4123e1cf2694,"Thu, 7 Jul 2016 21:52:38 -0400","

It is not working for sakai.synoptic.messagecenter (jsf tool), so I guess it's only working for wicket tools, sorry if I misunderstood the description of this jira that says: ""This contributed patch allows any tool to declare that it is able to be rendered inline""

The description also talk about fallback into an iframe in case the tool can´t be rendered inline, so I guess the right behaviour here is not render inline any tool that it's not going to work properly. In my use case none of the tools that I've configured to be inline should be rendered inside an iframe.

",107996,557058:c7ed084d-c59c-4475-8ab7-81e1908270f0,"Wed, 13 Jul 2016 01:38:15 -0400","

I also consider JSF tools to be legacy.
I have updated the description from any to compatible.

This property is not added to any tools by default. It has to be explicitly enabled either by a developer in the tool registration file, or a system administrator in a specific tool placement. It can't just be flipped on for all tools via sakai.properties. It was specifically made this way so that a conscious decision is made to enable it for a specific tool placement. I would not recommend enabling it for JSF or Velocity based tools. You could try these four: https://github.com/steveswinsburg/sakai-widgets

",40706,557058:7074e357-325c-4f04-880f-321ecd7c7dc5,"Thu, 15 Sep 2016 10:18:55 -0400","

I did create a two column page with the roster in one and calendar in the other. Worked fine. Busy (three little digi-squares animated) and more students showing up as I scroll down.

I also tested putting another tool below Roster, the Announcements tool. That works but I guess it is a bad idea because you have to keep scrolling till all the students are displayed to get to Announcements. So, kind of weird.

[SAK-31315] Backport Database changes from SAK-31184,https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/browse/SAK-31315,10057,SAK,Sakai,"

This ticket is to backport ONLY the database changes from
<a href=""https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/browse/SAK-31184"" class=""jira-issue-macro-key issue-link""  title=""Improvements to the Feedback Tool"" >
<a href=""https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/browse/SAK-31184"" class=""jira-issue-macro-key issue-link""  title=""Improvements to the Feedback Tool"" >

increases the constraints used on the database side. Oracle tables do not allow for in-table modifications of constraints, so a conversion would be necessary. Backporting these database changes now (before the release of the feedback tool) negates the need for a conversion in the future (simplifying the upgrade process).

Note: Any servers running 11.x will need to handle the conversion manually; the easiest way is to delete the sakai_feedback table and let it re-create with auto-ddl.

[SAK-37210] Samigo main menu markup tweaks for Morpheus,https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/browse/SAK-37210,10057,SAK,Sakai,"

As a follow up to
<a href=""https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/browse/SAK-37218"" class=""jira-issue-macro-key issue-link""  title=""Let Morpheus control the navIntraTool styles"" >

, this patch adjusts the markup on the Question Pools and Event Log pages. The markup is inconsistent on these two pages, resulting in less space between the Assessments and Question Pools tab in the main navigation.

Markup adjustment is necessary as the current Morpheus styles rely on whitespace in the markup to achieve the spacing between tabs (the <li> tags are declared inline-block).

[SAK-37218] Let Morpheus control the navIntraTool styles,https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/browse/SAK-37218,10057,SAK,Sakai,"

tool_sam.css has some styles intended to override how Morpheus styles the navIntraTool bar. Morpheus also has samigo-namespaced styles that override what tool_sam.css has done. While in the past this may have been needed, the end result today is that the tabs are spaced too far apart and the padding is wrong.

This PR removes those styles and allows the main Morpheus navIntraTool styles to apply. This lets the Samigo tabs look pretty much the same as the tabs in other tools.

[SAK-36455] Timed assessment can be cheated by leaving and re entering before auto-submit,https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/browse/SAK-36455,10057,SAK,Sakai,"

When taking a timed assessment (for example 1 min) if the user abandons the exam a few seconds before the bar is over (10-5 secs) and then re-enters to it, the bar will display ""Time is up"" but still allow the student to continue and submit with no time limit.

Pull request: Github - 2755

[SAK-31308] Powered by Sakai link opens in same window as application,https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/browse/SAK-31308,10057,SAK,Sakai,"

The ""Powered by Sakai"" link in the footer appears to be intended to open in a new tab, but doesn't.
Potentially a big deal because if one is in the middle of an activity in Sakai and one clicks the link, you are taken completely away from what you are doing.
1) Start any activity in Sakai (Assignment, Test, etc)
2) Go to the footer and click ""Powered by Sakai""
Expected result - Sakai Project website opens in a different tab.

Making it a blocker priority because it seems like it could have a big negative impact and should be a simple fix.

[SAK-32884] Course Grade overrides - show overridden course grades as bold and display re-mapped percentage score,https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/browse/SAK-32884,10057,SAK,Sakai,"

When a course grade gets overridden, format the displayed course grade as bold to make it easier to see overridden grades while scanning through the spreadsheet.

Additionally, let's have the percentage that is displayed for a course grade reflect the grade scale's percentage mapping (e.g., B (85%) ). Showing the original percentage next to an overridden letter grade might get confusing.

[SAK-31306] Add more static references for getting to js webjars,https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/browse/SAK-31306,10057,SAK,Sakai,"

This probably isn't a blocker, but it feel like it would be really nice to get into 11.0 and would make a lot of things easier. Basically we've got this pattern that I didn't know about with editor-tool (/sakai-editor/editor-launch.js) that you can call and it gets you the most recent version of the editor.
Says which version of the editor is installed 2 things that would be nice.
1) A way to register any javascript that's installed from a webjar, not just editors.
2) A way to define an override version of the file so it could be upgraded and maintained externally.

I think the generic case of webjar registry could be patterned off this editor registery but should be separate.

This sounds more about using the webjars-locator https://github.com/webjars/webjars-locator maybe even via requirejs

",141749,70121:ec0fd122-4a2d-4492-a966-78d3f9aa9080,"Tue, 14 Feb 2017 10:44:52 -0500",

I'm lowering the priority because I really can't figure out a great way of doing this across the entire platform easily since we have so many template engines. I feel like it would have to be something like a filter that does complete replacement?

,"Tue, 16 Jan 2018 07:55:26 +0000",Relate,,,,10008,,,,,,158420,70121:ec0fd122-4a2d-4492-a966-78d3f9aa9080,"Tue, 14 Feb 2017 10:49:50 -0500","

Perhaps maven filtering could be used during the build? https://damienfremont.com/2015/10/08/webjars-use-dynamic-urls-for-your-dependencies-vs-versionning-hell/

I think if the property was distinct enough this might work pretty good. We'd just need to move all of these into master.

",191732,70121:ec0fd122-4a2d-4492-a966-78d3f9aa9080,"Tue, 14 Feb 2017 11:40:39 -0500","

I think that maven idea could work, but I wonder if this isn't more about cleaning up a lot of these libraries now that they should only really need to be loaded once in portal anyway. I don't have too much problem if only portal loads them. I think this is more of an issue for jquery and jquery-ui. (And the other jquery libraries).

I think for 12 we'll want to upgrade jquery since we're way out of date.

Hi @steveswinsburg, @anishdoshi. I hit this error and didn't realise there was bug already created and assigned. If it's useful, here's my patch: https://github.com/sakaiproject/sakai/compare/master...payten:percent-concurrent-error

I think it was due to extra digits when the oldGrade was converted to oldGradeAdjusted - I was seeing 55.5 become 5.55000000005. When this fails to match the storedGrade of 5.55 we get the concurrent error.

[SAK-31303] Re-add letter grading option to gradebook,https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/browse/SAK-31303,10057,SAK,Sakai,"

So gradebook has an undocumented property to support entering letter grades. This was added way back in 2.5 in https://jira.sakaiproject.org/browse/SAK-9465
However the option to actually set this grade type was removed as part of
<a href=""https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/browse/SAK-19964"" class=""jira-issue-macro-key issue-link""  title=""Gradebook drop highest and/or lowest or keep highest score for a student"" >
. I don't believe this was intentional, and adding it back in gets it all to work again.

Even though GB1 is deprecated, I think keeping this correct is probably a good idea, especially since GB2 supports it and if https://github.com/sakaiproject/sakai/issues/2730 is resolved.

[SAK-33100] Gradebook: Add "Letter grade" grade entry type,https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/browse/SAK-33100,10057,SAK,Sakai,"

So back from 2.5-2.9, gradebook 1 supported letter grading. [1]

What this essentially did when the property gradebook_enable_letter_grade=true was enabled was took the letter you entered, mapped against the course grade options and saved it as a numeric value. However it displayed in the UI as letter grade. A commit on
<a href=""https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/browse/SAK-19964"" class=""jira-issue-macro-key issue-link""  title=""Gradebook drop highest and/or lowest or keep highest score for a student"" >

looks like it inadvertently removed the option for setting letter grades, but adding that line back in gets it all working again. Gradebook2 also supported the letter grade style gradebook, probably inspired by this.

It seems like most of the code is in edu-services so it could be something that could get going again, though maybe in GB2 it wouldn't even need a separate type as an option, just if a user puts a letter in there A, B+, to convert it to the appropriate point value?

[2] https://jira.sakaiproject.org/browse/GRBK-1152

",,32235,SAK-33100,"Gradebook: Add ""Letter grade"" grade entry type",10012,https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/secure/viewavatar?size=medium&avatarId=10315&avatarType=issuetype,Feature Request,10002,https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/images/icons/priorities/major.svg,Major,1,https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/images/icons/statuses/open.png,The issue is open and ready for the assignee to start work on it.,Open,2,new,blue-gray,-1,Unresolved,-1,Unassigned,70121:ec0fd122-4a2d-4492-a966-78d3f9aa9080,Matthew Jones,"Thu, 2 Jun 2016 07:51:50 -0400","Fri, 7 Dec 2018 06:35:08 -0500",12.0,Gradebook,2,5,Development,customfield_10000,com.atlassian.jira.plugins.jira-development-integration-plugin:devsummarycf,Rank,0|10ate8:,customfield_10019,com.pyxis.greenhopper.jira:gh-lexo-rank,Sprint,customfield_10020,com.pyxis.greenhopper.jira:gh-sprint,,,,,,,,[CHART] Date of First Response,customfield_10024,com.atlassian.jira.ext.charting:firstresponsedate,,,,,,,,58409,6164eaefbfa2c1006b186ab8,"Thu, 7 Jul 2016 17:35:19 -0400","

Matthew Jones Hello Matthew. We will be dropping GB2 altogether at the Univ. soon enough, so I started working in getting NG to use Letters again. As you said, most of the changes had to be made on the service (edu-service) rather than the tool, although the latter did indeed get additions here and there mostly for formatting and display.

One of the main issues I found, is that the gradebook-service (lgpm.getGrade) was NOT using the currently selected grading schema, but was DB querying the default, every single time it was invoked. This was causing NG using two different criterias!

I just wanted to share with what I have so far, which as per our instructional designers specifications, seems to be on track based on faculty requirements. I would really appreciate if can point me to any other contribution on this topic. I couldn't find much except for this issue.
Here is a small video demo and the code

Thanks.

Met at Apereo conference. Jolie Tingen do you have more details on how this should be implemented? How the math will get done (middle of the letter range, etc)?

",59298,557058:28026415-aa37-4afe-90ce-f986ae44e5d8,"Thu, 14 Jun 2018 15:20:36 -0400","

I recall that another platform had this feature. It would rely on a table in a settings area that defined the numeric value for a given letter grade. If a letter grade was assigned, the system would use this numeric value to make the calculations. (Faculty would sometimes be confused by the final calculation value since some assumed an A would equal 100 and not 97 or something.)
If this is a feature people actively want, I wonder if in Gradebook > Settings > Grading Schema > an additional column called ""Assigned Value"" or ""Calculated Value"" or something could exist.
If you go with a middle or average value, be careful on the ""F.""

",159787,557058:652d59a6-8d32-486e-8682-fa97a1afe06f,"Thu, 28 Jun 2018 05:17:02 -0400","

As of 12.2, the Assignments tool supports Letter Grading. But of course, you can't send the grade back to GBNG because GBNG does not yet support the Letter Grading style.

",92116,6164daf399b4b8006a0ac333,"Wed, 3 Aug 2016 22:00:40 -0400","

I imported two new items. I then changed the name of one of them to be the same as an existing item. I'm able to continue through the workflow until I hit Finish on this page, which is where I get the exception:

So, I guess I could import a whole bunch of items and one of them has the same name as something already imported, I'll get that error but I won't know which one has the problem. Would it be possible to serve that error at the point at which the users hits next in the workflow?
I did notice something else here. If I import two new items and I give them the same name, the system will allow me to hit finish without an error:

It looks like only one of the items gets imported though. I've also tried making them different point, and still only one of them will get imported. So maybe we want another check at the end of the process to see if we have the same name appearing twice in this final list before import.

","Thu, 4 Aug 2016 02:00:40 +0000",,,,,,,,,,,108827,557058:c7ed084d-c59c-4475-8ab7-81e1908270f0,"Thu, 4 Aug 2016 01:39:00 -0400","

The title check is only done when the item is actually created, as it uses the GbService. It could certainly be changed to be earlier and check if the item exists with that name, before creating.

The second is because it ignores dupes right at the beginning. I agree and think that it should chuck the file out at that point instead of silently ignoring.

[SAK-38448] Files without content or without information,https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/browse/SAK-38448,10057,SAK,Sakai,"

1. Upload a file.
3. Move file into folder. (File at this point isn't accessible)
4. Copy file out of folder. (File at this point appears corrupted in the UI)

column2: • Out of folder: a file without information (name, creator, date, size,...), but if you click on it you get the content of the file.
• Into the folder: a file without content, the information is on the screen, but if you click on it the file is not found.

column1:
If in step #4 you ""move"" the file it works because it appears as if the file never moved in step #3

[SAK-37204] Replace strange empty tables on student view with clear messages,https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/browse/SAK-37204,10057,SAK,Sakai,"

Will also include markup and styling improvements for the page.

[SAK-31296] Error Adding participants after cancel button,https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/browse/SAK-31296,10057,SAK,Sakai,"

If cancel Add Participants in Site Info tool and come back to Add Participants you gets the next log error:

15-Oct-2019 06:43:50.006 ERROR [http-nio-20019-exec-29] org.sakaiproject.site.tool.helper.participant.impl.SiteAddParticipantHandler.getAllowNonOfficialAccount Could not get site and thus, site properties.

column2: • In Site Info tool try to add a participant clicking in Add Participants. Next, don't add any user, click Cancel instead.
• Click Add Participant again. See the console.

column1:
This is because when clicking Cancel button it is executed the reset method that set site to null. Next time the user clicks Add participant site is null and the log error is shown.

[SAK-38470] Errors setting public view on collection/folder,https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/browse/SAK-38470,10057,SAK,Sakai,"

I believe I'm seeing errors with using the method
setPublicAccess on a collection after the change on
<a href=""https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/browse/SAK-29402"" class=""jira-issue-macro-key issue-link""  title=""Role-based access to Resources"" >
. It's just not doing anything for me.

In 11 this old calls a new method addRoleAccess which overrides most of the old method previous in setPublicAccess and I believe the logic here is inconsistent with the previous behavior. I have a fix that appears to work with the old behavior and passes the current tests, just working on a new test as I don't see one for this method.

Matthew Jones, this seems somewhat similar to an issue we're seeing at Western currently, where once a file or folder has been set to 'Public', deselecting the checkbox to revoke public access seemingly does nothing; the form is submitted, no errors are generated, no exceptions are in the logs and the setting reverts to 'Public'. However, I'm not able to reproduce this on any of the nightlies (11, 12 or 13).

I've looked at the code, and every piece I think is related looks identical to what's in 13.x, and seems to be doing what it should be. I've also stepped through the the code I've identified as related to ensure that there are no exceptions being swallowed; which there aren't (at least in the places I'm looking). I'm just wondering if this seems familiar to you, and if you remember what the ""fix"" you had for this was?

[SAK-34298] Create a more efficient/safer way of deleting submissions from published,https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/browse/SAK-34298,10057,SAK,Sakai,"

The feature added in
<a href=""https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/browse/SAK-37261"" class=""jira-issue-macro-key issue-link""  title=""Delete test submission attempt feature"" >

allows you to delete a submission, but you have to click on each individually, wait for the page to refresh and click again. This can be really time consuming in a class with a lot of students or submissions. I think this really should be a checkbox field that allows for multiple deletions (with the same confirmation) rather than one at a time.

",74839,5d275d132c5a110c1d476990,"Tue, 7 Mar 2017 03:59:57 -0500","

At UVa (we're still on Sakai 10 at this time), we've seen a sudden uptick in instructors accidentally deleting published assessments with submissions (several in the last two weeks, whereas before we didn't seem to have this problem but once every several months). This has necessitated several restores from our developers. Fortunately, when an assessment is deleted in Sakai 10, the submissions are NOT removed from the DB, and it's relatively easy for developers to restore them. However, with the development in
<a href=""https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/browse/SAK-34247"" class=""jira-issue-macro-key issue-link""  title=""Can't delete a published assessment in Samigo with submissions."" >
and possibly here, there's an added layer of ease in accidental deletion, and it looks like it may be difficult or impossible to restore accidentally deleted tests.
I think the whole function of removing submissions needs to be rethought to not be an obvious hole for instructors to fall into.

Note also that instructors/TAs can submit an assessment by using View Site As... Student. Because the instructor submissions never appear in the Scores screen, and the delete submission function does appear in the Scores screen, if the only submission belongs to an instructor, the ""0 submissions"" assessment cannot be deleted at all. (
<a href=""https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/browse/SAK-34112"" class=""jira-issue-macro-key issue-link""  title=""Can't delete an assessment with no visible submissions"" >

Really, what's needed is a soft delete function for all assessments with submissions (flip the database flag that makes them invisible and no longer affecting students' grades, but let the instructor restore them easily for a limited time). This would fix the problems associated with accidental deletion.

[SAK-37276] Show scoring option to student if they have been allowed retakes,https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/browse/SAK-37276,10057,SAK,Sakai,"

If a quiz allows multiple submissions, when the student views the recorded score they will see the scoring option (highest, latest, average) next to their score.

However, if the quiz only allows one submission but the student has been granted a retake, they don't see this information. This PR modifies the student view to show the scoring option in this scenario.

[SAK-31292] LTI portlet does not receive the window.postmessage properly,https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/browse/SAK-31292,10057,SAK,Sakai,

[SAK-38040] upload ZIP file always going to end of page, won't work if no . in name,https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/browse/SAK-38040,10057,SAK,Sakai,"

Two issues in upload ZIP file:

column2: • it always goes at the end of the page
• if there isn't a dot in the file name it fails

column1: The original code tries to remove .zip from the end of the name, but fails if there's no period.

The fix will be slightly different for 11 and 12. 12 now asks the user to supply a name for items like this. Thus I'm just going to use the name as is. In 11 I'm going to leave the code that tries to remove the extension, but I'm going to verify that there actually is an extension before removing it.

The other option would be just to move the 12 code into 11. I thought it was too much like a new feature, but maintaining two different sets of code is turning out to be more dangerous than accepting a fairly safe new feature.

if i try to upload the attached zip file I get
Unable to add resource: java.lang.StringIndexOutOfBoundsException: String index out of range: -1

",124819,6164d3a564ff010071b75c26,"Thu, 13 Oct 2016 06:45:18 -0400",

I'm not seeing that. Could you give the actual backtrace?

,174854,6164d3a564ff010071b75c26,"Thu, 13 Oct 2016 10:01:38 -0400","

OK, the problem occurs if the zip file doesn't have an extension. I ended up copying kernel code, and it has a bug. The simplest solution is actually going to be to add .zip to the zip file name if it isn't there already. I can't just fix my calculation, since mine has to match the one in the kernel. If the kernel code is changed, I'll have to change mine also. I think. (I'll check

The problem is that the kernel Api to extract a zip archive takes the archive name but doesn't return the name of the collection where it decided to put the files. What it does is remove .zip from the zip file and use that as the collection name. It can't just use the supplied name, since that would result in putting a collection on top of a file.
This was written during a period when I couldn't get kernel changes made very easily.

What should happen in my view is that the kernel function to extract a zip archive should return either a collection or a collection id of the place it put the files. Until then I'm going to fix Lessons to add .zip if there's no extension.

","Thu, 13 Oct 2016 06:09:04 +0000",,,,,,29229,examplezip,497,ug:329a6498-8cd1-4162-9c2e-c10d85755fe4,"Thu, 13 Oct 2016 02:09:23 -0400",40755,6164d3a564ff010071b75c26,"Thu, 13 Oct 2016 10:06:37 -0400","

Ugh. I can do that if the user uploads a file. However if they pick an existing zip file, and it doesn't have an extension, the only way I can fix it would be the rename it or copy it. I think that's sufficiently unexpected that I can't fix that case. It's probably safest to give an error. I can fix the upload case.

",91445,6164d3a564ff010071b75c26,"Thu, 13 Oct 2016 13:03:40 -0400","

OK, I fixed it to the extent that I can. This will go into 11.3 but not 11.2.
Note that loading a zip file from resources could never have worked. I've fixed it, and also fixed some error handling.

It did previously work in the usual case: uploading a file with an extension. So I don't think this is a blocker. But it took much of the day to try all the cases and fix weird things.

",108155,6164d3a564ff010071b75c26,"Thu, 13 Oct 2016 13:09:41 -0400","

Testing this involves lots of combinations:
zip file with index.html should result in creating a collection with lessons pointing to index.html
zip file without index.html or any other indexy file will create the collection but generate a lessons error and not add an item in lessons
a file ending in .zip should always work
a file with no . in it should work when uploaded but not when selected from resources. the uploaded copy will have .zip added to it

[SAK-38123] LTI iframe popup ends up with horizontal scrollbar,https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/browse/SAK-38123,10057,SAK,Sakai,

If you go into lessons -> Add External Tool -> Manage or Install Tools the modal dialog will end up with a horizontal scroll bar and the iframe width will be 104% as shown in the attached screen shot. The problem is that the frame height resize is not working properly because there is no post message listener in the BltiPicker code so the frame has the wrong height and ends up with a vertical scrollbar and the addition of the vertical scrollbar means the iframe is too wide so you get a horizontal scrollbar. The solution is to support the post message to resize the frame vertically and so you get zero scrollbars.

[SAK-37234] improve usability of question pool interfaces,https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/browse/SAK-37234,10057,SAK,Sakai,"

This PR makes the following improvements related the user interfaces around question pools

column2: • Action buttons are disabled until a selection is made in scenarios that require the user to select a pool or question before continuing. This avoids annoying validation messages or other unexpected behaviour that can occur if the user fails to make a selection
• Adds progress indicator ""spinners"" to several action buttons to clearly indicate to the user that their request is being processed
• Automatically selects a default radio button in the Move interface, following the established pattern that radio buttons always have a selection, and avoiding opportunity for user error
• Reduces javascript duplication by moving common logic into functions

column1:
Also fixes a null pointer exception that can arise in QuestionPoolBean.

I would actually consider most of these bug fixes. There is an NPE fix included, and not selecting a pool can lead to unexpected and confusing behaviour, like getting trapped in a different interface than the one you expected to end up in.

","

column2: • Go through the various pages related to question pools, including copying from a question pool to a quiz, the copy/move/share features of the main question pool interface, and the transfer ownership feature. For cases where a pool or question must be selected before continuing, confirm that the action button is enabled if and only if one or more selections have been made.
• For Move Pool feature, confirm that one of the radio buttons is selected by default when the page loads.

[SAK-31291] Section-aware permissions in resources tool have a different behavior than other tools,https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/browse/SAK-31291,10057,SAK,Sakai,"

Section-aware permissions in resources tool have a different behavior than other tools (Announcements, Assignment, Calendar, etc,..) and it could causes some problems.
In resources you could create resources in a section where you don't belong. In other tools, when you add an item to a group, only the groups where you belong are listed.
As a result of this, the creator of a resource couldn't access to it.
I think that you should be able to create resources only in the groups where you are member, as other tools do.
2. Create a site with the sections: Discussion 1 and Discussion 2.
3. Go to resources tool in the new site.
5. Grant Create resources permission for site to TA role.*
7. Go to resources tool in the created site.
8. You can create a new folder to all site and to any group, even you don't belong to it!!!
9. Create a new folder displayed to Discussion 2 (ta1 is not a member of this group).
10. You can see this folder (by the moment...).
14. You cannot access to the folder.

* To reproduce with files instead of folders, in step 5 you should grant Edit own resources permission for Site to TA role.

Conversion scripts are easy to modify. The navigation really should be dynamic and show that link only if dashboard is placed. But which dashboard would it link to? The one in the users My Workspace or the one in the site.
The src of the link is just

So I don't even think it worked and linked correctly to go anywhere other than the top of the page, for it to work, it would have needed to be a direct tool URL if dashboard was available.

",107891,557058:93841381-71b1-43f5-8290-4123e1cf2694,"Wed, 1 Jun 2016 21:59:21 -0400","

Yes, the link in the user menu is not really a big issue because it works, it's just a matter of naming.
But I guess we must remove the inserts to avoid add the Dashboard tool to the left side menu, because the tool is no longer available in 11.x
Anyway this will only affects sakai's clean installations (auto.ddl=true), so nobody that migrates from other sakai's version will have Dashboard on the left side menu, only nightly servers

Please turn it into major if you think this is not a blocker issue.

",157957,70121:ec0fd122-4a2d-4492-a966-78d3f9aa9080,"Thu, 2 Jun 2016 06:59:48 -0400","

I don't think it makes sense to have the link in the menu at all, it just goes to the top level of the page, and there's lots of other ways to get there. It might not be the dashboard or the overview so I think the link was wrong in the first place and would need some work, so I just removed it.

","

column2: • Test plan for this is pretty easy

• Click on profile and verify the links there are correct and dashboard isn't in the link menu

This is the only picker with a dialog. The simplest solution is not to load the Lessons css for this page. It doesn't seem to change anything significant.

but that's mot the big problem. The big problem is that the picker doesn't pass the addBefore parameter, so the tool goes in the wrong place. I'm looking at that now.

",141271,557058:718cd3f6-5ff9-42fa-8914-b4224aff1730,"Wed, 1 Jun 2016 06:18:14 -0400",

I am happy with any solution that fixes the UI. Adding the addbefore parameter will be a bit tricky because it needs to be remembered through things like several redirects and ContentItem selection. But the good news is that there is a clean round trip path that can retain data throughout the entire path. If I know what the addbefore parameter was and how it worked - I could make sure it fully roundtrips.

,157953,6164d3a564ff010071b75c26,"Wed, 1 Jun 2016 06:25:48 -0400","

I have just done it for the simple case. You'll have to make sure it works for ContentITems, etc.

In Sakai 11, tools are normally added in the middle of the page, not at the end. When you click on +, the popup with a list of tools will call the producer with an argument addBefore=NN, where NN is the itemId before (or in one case after) which the new item should be added. You'll need to preserve that throughout all the trips so that the final call to addBlti in SimplePageBean has the parameter. Note that NN can be negative or blank.

[SAK-31281] Some months display incorrectly in List of Events view,https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/browse/SAK-31281,10057,SAK,Sakai,"

When viewing the schedule as ""List of events"", some months in the Date column are displaying as the next month. For example, if you create a new calendar event for Jun 1, it will display as Jul 1.
The issue is appearing for events created in the following months: Feb, Apr, Jun, Sep, Nov.

column2: • In 10 or 11 nightly server, go to a site and create a new Schedule event for June 22.
• Change schedule view to ""List of Events"" and set filter for month of June.
• The newly created event will display as Jul 22.

,57902,557058:40f25311-6221-42fb-9556-54716dbfb90c,"Tue, 31 Jan 2017 11:04:12 -0500","

This also seems to affect the display of the Calendar By Year. The correct dates are shown within the weeks for each month, but the same month name discrepancy appears.

Note that the affected months are those with fewer than 31 days. It's like someone decided to calculate for the name of the month by first calculating the ""31st"" day of each month instead of the 1st or something bizarre like that.

","Sun, 12 Jun 2016 20:09:24 +0000",Relate,53546,SAK-29497,relates to,10008,41986,SakaiCalendarByYearBuggedMonthNames.PNG,48858,ug:02f6d084-bd34-4e95-8bcf-1c973b790acc,"Tue, 31 Jan 2017 11:03:25 -0500",175025,557058:1fab5062-c88f-4d13-b5c9-a1e08a1b6779,"Wed, 1 Feb 2017 07:12:13 -0500","

I believe this problem only happens when you view the ""year view"" or ""list view"" when the current day is the 30 or 31st of the month. We ran into this problem yesterday on 1/31, but we don't see it today on 2/1
And it looks like the code that's causing it is in

explains that setting the calendar object's month with calendar.set(f,value) only sets the month but not the day, so later when getTime() is called, it seems as though it uses the current day of the month, so e.g. if the calendar's month is set to February, but current day is Jan 31, when getTime() is called, March 3 is returned.
I'll be patching this in our 10.7 instance with

which sets the day of the month to the 1st so that getTime() returns the correct time.

",124997,6164ee5907ac3c0068731cbb,"Fri, 3 Feb 2017 03:52:54 -0500",

Thanks for this Austin. Would this patch work in 11.x? One of our users just reported this and it would be great to tell them a fix is forthcoming.

,57913,557058:1fab5062-c88f-4d13-b5c9-a1e08a1b6779,"Fri, 3 Feb 2017 07:50:37 -0500","

The code in 11.x looks the same, so I'd think the patch I mentioned above would work there too (although I have not tested in 11.x yet).

Note that this fix is tricky to test because the problem only happens if you are viewing the calendar when the actual date is near the end of the month e.g. the 31st and the next month is a 30 day or less month. For example, if you had viewed the calendar on Jan 31, you would see February appear as March 03. So when I tested on my local machine as well as our test server, but the actual date was already Feb. 2, I set the system time back to Jan. 31.

The version of commons-math that Sakai is using (2.2) was released in 2011, and the newer version (3.x) is something we should update to but many there's many new classes that replace the existing ones like:
Broke up bloated ""MathUtils"" class into ""MathArrays"", ""Precision"", ""ArithmeticUtils"" classes. Fixes MATH-689.

I don't know what version to target this for and it's not as easy as switching the dependencies but it would be nice to update.

",57682,557058:7074e357-325c-4f04-880f-321ecd7c7dc5,"Wed, 7 Sep 2016 04:34:02 -0400",

Assigning to myself for QA testing.

,108092,557058:7074e357-325c-4f04-880f-321ecd7c7dc5,"Wed, 7 Sep 2016 09:06:04 -0400","

I tested on https://trunk-oracle.nightly.sakaiproject.org/portal and setting this to Verified.

I believe the default is 2 decimal places, so that is what I used. I used points to decimals for some of the answers, like 8.42, 5.3, and 6.5 . I used ""right minus wrong"" so that it would take a portion of those values , to more decimal places. and I used weighting. I created two exams and created two categories with one exam in each category. I weighted one as 60% and the other as 40%.

The calculations all came out right to me, EXCEPT that the one question that was 5.3 points, right - wrong multiple choice, I intentionally got 4 right minus 1 wrong for 3 out of 4, which calculates to 3.975 . That should round to 3.98 but instead shows 3.97. But what is weird is that the total adding up all the answers on the exam did round up the .975 to .98. That doesn't seem like a good thing because if you add up the scores for the exam by eyeball it looks like the student was granted an extra .01 (.98 instead of .97). But the alternative way to look at it is that the question should have shown 3.98.
I was able to reproduce the behavior in Sakai 11 branch nightly mysql and therefore there is no regression.
I'm wondering if you agree this is not desirable behavior, what the behavior should be, and if we need a Jira for it?

1.- Create a site and add roster2 on it.
2.- Enter as admin and go to ""Sites""
3.- Search the site you've created and click on it.
5.- Use something with + as the new site id, for example, ""test+""
6.- Now got to the new site and click on roster.

You won't be able to see pictures, all images will be broken.

",75914,557058:93841381-71b1-43f5-8290-4123e1cf2694,"Mon, 19 Mar 2018 23:55:14 -0400","

I think is weird using to different ways to sort, one in the ""More Sites Tab"" that honors ""portal.term.order"" property or ""courseManagementService.getAcademicSessions()"" and the hidden sites is just grouping by the site type in the backend and then reordering in the front end without criteria.

The backend is using ""isCourseType"" method to determine if some site is a course site, but only in one place, not during the sort phase or in the frontend that ""course"".equals is used without any other criteria.

To fix this issue we probably need to refactor the User Prefs Tool to be consistent with More Sites Tab.

[SAK-36726] The author is removed when creating or modifying templates,https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/browse/SAK-36726,10057,SAK,Sakai,"

I think this is related with SAM-2535, but If we ignore any author set by the user, why don't we just remove the author box? If the user can set the author
in the template but we don't allow him, he will think it is an error.

[SAK-35013] Autosubmit job probably doesn't take into account extended due date,https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/browse/SAK-35013,10057,SAK,Sakai,"

Just looking at the code when the autosubmit job runs in quartz it will run autoSubmitAssessments in AssessmentGradingFacadeQueries.java
<a href=""https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/browse/SAK-34955"" class=""jira-issue-macro-key issue-link""  title=""Allow different delivery settings for specific sections, groups, and individuals"" >
for the extended due dates metadata. This will very likely result in any students having their due dates extended still having their submissions auto submitted when this job runs.

It seems like it's going to be semi-complicated to fix this unless a method like assessment.getDueDate is fixed to also return the extended due date or there's a new api method that returns the real effective due date for a student. (Which I don't see existing)

I haven't tested this yet so please close if it's a non issue but I don't want to forget about it.

",,58067,SAK-35013,Autosubmit job probably doesn't take into account extended due date,10026,https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/secure/viewavatar?size=medium&avatarId=10300&avatarType=issuetype,Sub-task,10001,https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/images/icons/priorities/critical.svg,Critical,6,https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/images/icons/statuses/closed.png,"The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct.
