[SAK-32937] Additional Export Options (to match those available in the "Course Grades" screen of GB1),https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/browse/SAK-32937,10057,SAK,Sakai,"

When exporting the GB on the Import / Export screen, provide a text link below the ""Download"" button entitled ""Advanced Options."" Selecting this will open a lightbox window that allows users to customize what is included in the export, and select a .pdf export format. The defaults (""Student Name,"" Student ID,"" ""Gradebook Item Scores"" and ""Gradebook Item Comments"") will be selected and appear at the top. Additional options will be available below, and will include:
(Note re: Points - we may want to restrict the ability to export Total Points if categories & weighting are enabled)
When any of these options are selected/de-selected and modified from the default, text should be highlighted informing the user that this export can not be imported back into the Gradebook.

PRIORITY: High

",,58333,SAK-32937,"Additional Export Options (to match those available in the ""Course Grades"" screen of GB1)",10012,https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/secure/viewavatar?size=medium&avatarId=10315&avatarType=issuetype,Feature Request,,,,6,https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/images/icons/statuses/closed.png,"The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.",Closed,3,done,green,10000,Fixed,6164df29a707100069fcdfd6,kyleblythe,6164df29a707100069fcdfd6,kyleblythe,"Fri, 27 May 2016 09:43:38 -0400","Fri, 16 Nov 2018 10:18:52 -0500",12.0,Gradebook,0,5,Development,customfield_10000,com.atlassian.jira.plugins.jira-development-integration-plugin:devsummarycf,Rank,0|10at4g:,customfield_10019,com.pyxis.greenhopper.jira:gh-lexo-rank,Sprint,customfield_10020,com.pyxis.greenhopper.jira:gh-sprint,"Mon, 3 Oct 2016 00:38:46 -0400",,,,,,,[CHART] Date of First Response,customfield_10024,com.atlassian.jira.ext.charting:firstresponsedate,,,,,,12.0,,192185,6164f785048360006aab8244,"Sun, 5 Jun 2016 14:58:40 -0400","

Hi @steveswinsburg. I've starting looking into this one and have the form ready to go and just looking into the PDF and Excel format generation. The old Gradebook uses the org.sakaiproject.jsf.spreadsheet.SpreadsheetUtil. Should I use the same? Or are there preferred/newer/nicer ways that I should be investigating?

It seems we omitting Excel export support. Which might make things easier as we can probably serialise the CSVWriter to PDF a little easier... I'll investigate.. but let me know if you know any tricks!

",41417,6164f785048360006aab8244,"Sun, 5 Jun 2016 17:51:40 -0400","

It seems like the JSF SpreadsheetUtil has some smarts for breaking a very wide table into multiple tables so they render nicely as a PDF. I'm also questioning the usefulness of the PDF export. Notwithstanding it could be a bit of work make it render nicely if we have to reimplement the CSV-to-PDF transform. @steveswinsburg, has this been done elsewhere in the app?

",75265,6164f785048360006aab8244,"Mon, 6 Jun 2016 13:16:03 -0400","

Great, thanks @steveswinsburg. I'll omit PDF and look to add Excel. That makes good sense to me!

That said... As Excel can handle CSV just as well as a vanilla Excel spreadsheet, is there a need to support an xls export?

","Sun, 5 Jun 2016 18:58:40 +0000",Relate,,,,10008,,,,,,92114,6164f785048360006aab8244,"Tue, 7 Jun 2016 15:14:30 -0400",

Hi @kyleblythe. The advanced options are ready for testing now. I'm yet to implement PDF or XLS export though... maybe they're not required?

,108826,6164df29a707100069fcdfd6,"Thu, 9 Jun 2016 05:40:12 -0400","

This is looking really great, @payten! Thanks for the work on this. So, re: the PDF export option...I'm inclined to agree with your and Former user 's opinions. That said, PDF export is an option in GB1, so I'm not sure how we feel about leaving an existing option out of GBNG. What do you think, jeffpasch ?
So a few issues/add'l notes I've found with the advanced export:

column2: • Currently, clicking the ""Advanced options"" link opens a hidden collapsed menu above. I get why this is the case, as it positions the ""Download"" button below. It seems a little unintuitive, however (especially because you then have to click ""Advanced options"" again to close the menu, and it's located below the menu you're trying to close).

column1: I'm wondering if we want to either have these advanced options open in a lightbox window with their own ""Download"" button at the bottom of the window, or if we want to disable the default ""Download"" button when ""Advanced options"" is selected, and instead have a separate ""Download"" button become visible/active within the accordion menu. That way, the accordion menu could open below the link, which seems more intuitive.

column2: • Right now, regardless of whether any ""Advanced options"" are selected, the whole ""Export"" process remains visible on all screens in the Import/Export process:

column1: This should be hidden once you click the ""Continue"" button on the first screen to import a spreadsheet.

column2: • Lastly, is there a way to have the import recognize when there are any columns from the ""Advanced options"" export? Ideally, I think we'd like to actively prevent the import process from taking place if any columns outside of the standard export are in place.

column1:
",125494,6164daf399b4b8006a0ac333,"Thu, 9 Jun 2016 06:09:10 -0400","

Yup, I think we could leave out the export to PDF, since it can be done in Excel. And we can leave out the XLS option as well.

We can discuss the ""advanced options"" stuff more today.

",142217,6164f785048360006aab8244,"Thu, 9 Jun 2016 12:42:32 -0400","

Improvements:

column2: • [x] open in a modal with a new download button in the modal
• [x] button in modal is labelled ""Download Custom Export""
• [x] original button downloads normal export and label ""Export Gradebook""
• can we detect when a custom export has been imported?? and throw an error?
• [x] YES: by prefixing all custom export columns with a # these columns can be ignored by the importer
• [x] Create a new issue for detecting this on the import-side of things
• [x] Export shouldn't be showing on every step of the import wizard.. fail.

column1:
",158873,6164df29a707100069fcdfd6,"Thu, 16 Jun 2016 10:01:13 -0400","

Very nice, Payten Giles - this is working great

So, one quick thing. The custom export should probably, by default, have only the options that are in the regular export checked by default. Currently, ""Course grade"" is selected by default, but that should probably be an opt-in selection like the other custom export options that aren't in the standard export.

[SAK-31272] Tweak background/text coloring for system confirmation messages,https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/browse/SAK-31272,10057,SAK,Sakai,"

To make this easier to read, as well as consistent with the styling for info/warning messages, we recommend using the following background coloring from bootstrap:

[SAK-37205] Improve Samigo Author Page,https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/browse/SAK-37205,10057,SAK,Sakai,"

Currently within Samigo there has recently (
<a href=""https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/browse/SAK-34927"" class=""jira-issue-macro-key issue-link""  title=""Upgrade the JSF to 1.2 version"" >
) been created a second authorIndex.jsp page titled authorIndex_noHeader.jsp.
This was done because JSP complains (and breaks) when you include a page which has <f:view> within another <f:view>, specifically within mainIndex.jsp.

This is a relatively new change which has resulted in two files for the same page which must both be maintained. This results in twice the work to add new features / fix bugs and increases the odds of discrepancies. Currently a number of discrepancies exist:
This is a terrible practice and there is no reason to make samigo worse.

This change takes authorIndex.jsp renames it to authorIndex_content.jsp, creates authorIndex_container.jsp (modeled after mainIndex.jsp) which just includes authorIndex_content.jsp, and removes authorIndex_noHeader.jsp. All outcomes which pointed to authorIndex.jsp now point to authorIndex_container.jsp. The mainIndex.jsp page now includes the authorIndex_content.jsp.

This was a change from 11 that I hadn't really intended to go into 10, though there are benefits from doing so. This problem is really from 11, but we hadn't seen it in testing yet. I've fix it in 10, 11 and 12 (the same way). I also added a couple of other changes from 11 related to this that hadn't made it into 10. They're fairly minor, but could result in access control not working for Youtube and maybe other multimedia formats.
Testing should check that youtube works, both with newly added items and with old items from 10 before these patches were made.

They should also check for group access restrictions on youtube videos.

Tested on nightly trunk server. Build Info:

[SAK-39119] Realm cache is out of sync after create sites in cluster environment.,https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/browse/SAK-39119,10057,SAK,Sakai,"

Here is the use case for this issue. Let's say we have 2 sakai instances sak1 and sak2 and you are trying to create a new course site. After you create the site only the owner is enrolled on it (you have to wait the refresh), so the cache contains only one member.
The create operation is done in sak1, so the instance launch the event to notify the change. This event causes that the cache in sak1 is removed but also is launched in sak2 to remove the cache also.
Now sak1 runs the completeGet (the user clicks in the brand new site). The realm is not chached so, the run goes through the ""else"":
In that point the refresh is added to the queue, but the execution continues and ends adding the owner to the cache in this line:
Now sak1 has the realm cached again with only the owner but refresh is in the queue to update.
Let's say that sak2 do the same, so both instances has the realm cached with only one member and also in the queue to update.

Now the sak2 instance runs the refresh task, so it compares the provided users with the sakai database users and do the update. Because these two collections are different the cache will be removed in instance sak2, and everything looks right in sak2.

Now sak1 instance runs the refresh task, it compares again the provided user with the sakai database, but in this case boths collections are the same (sak2 already update the sakai database) !! So the result is that the cache is not removed in sak1 instance and you still having only one member in your site. You'll have to wait until caché expires in sak1 to see the members of the site (10 minutes or more).

",,53818,SAK-39119,Realm cache is out of sync after create sites in cluster environment.,10007,https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/secure/viewavatar?size=medium&avatarId=10303&avatarType=issuetype,Bug,10000,https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/images/icons/priorities/blocker.svg,Blocker,10025,https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/images/icons/statuses/generic.png,Indicates QA is complete and an issue has been tested and verified (Migrated on 12 Oct 2021 03:05 UTC),Verified,3,done,green,10000,Fixed,557058:d4bf1967-6188-4b29-bf4a-95cf874b4a08,Earle Nietzel,557058:93841381-71b1-43f5-8290-4123e1cf2694,Juanjo Meroño,"Thu, 26 May 2016 01:11:24 -0400","Wed, 25 Apr 2018 11:19:54 -0400",11.0,Kernel,0,2,Development,customfield_10000,com.atlassian.jira.plugins.jira-development-integration-plugin:devsummarycf,Rank,0|1092m8:,customfield_10019,com.pyxis.greenhopper.jira:gh-lexo-rank,Sprint,customfield_10020,com.pyxis.greenhopper.jira:gh-sprint,"Wed, 1 Jun 2016 01:05:28 -0400",,,,,,,[CHART] Date of First Response,customfield_10024,com.atlassian.jira.ext.charting:firstresponsedate,[CHART] Time in Status,customfield_10025,com.atlassian.jira.ext.charting:timeinstatus,,,11.0,,57470,557058:93841381-71b1-43f5-8290-4123e1cf2694,"Thu, 26 May 2016 01:14:45 -0400","

My solution for this problem is add more validations in the refresh task. Not only check if provider user's collection is equivalent to sakai database user's collection, also check if cache user's collection is equivalent to provider user's collection.

",91173,557058:d4bf1967-6188-4b29-bf4a-95cf874b4a08,"Fri, 27 May 2016 11:17:18 -0400",

So this is a cache invalidation issue leading to inconsistency in a cache on another node. When sak2 ran the refresh task and updated the its local cache with the change it should notify the other nodes at the cache needs to be invalidated as well.

,124544,557058:93841381-71b1-43f5-8290-4123e1cf2694,"Fri, 27 May 2016 21:41:52 -0400","

Yes, I guess sending an event to invalidate cache will make things become consistent.

[SAK-32796] Table caption,https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/browse/SAK-32796,10057,SAK,Sakai,"

Please add a short table caption, with advice for instructors using alternative navigation like a keyboard http://webaim.org/techniques/tables/data#caption
Very brief advice on how to access the context menus and perhaps about the search functionality would help.

In the past Sakai has had issues with overly verbose table summaries (Professional accessibility report on Sakai 2.9 https://confluence.sakaiproject.org/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=86769783 ). Brevity is important.

Label: GradebookNG

[SAK-32879] accesskeys,https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/browse/SAK-32879,10057,SAK,Sakai,"

Great work on the accessibility. Can I convince you to add a few accesskeys to the instructor view http://webaim.org/techniques/keyboard/accesskey ?
In a two item course with 100 students, it would be 400 tabs to move top to bottom students' row with the keyboard.
An accesskey or simple key command for jumping lines would be a big help! BUT, searching might be an equally appealing solution.

The existing <accesskey> to jump to content makes an OK ""jump to top"" command, and it's easy to have too many commands, but maybe a jump to search accesskey or simple key command would also help?

,175521,6164f785048360006aab8244,"Wed, 24 Aug 2016 16:11:15 -0400","

Hi @mclare, while testing accesskeys in GradebookNG I've noticed a few new accesskey attributes pop up in 11.x and it seems that some of those within a tool conflict with those defined in the outer portal e.g. accesskey=""c"" is used to jump to content in the portal and to also cancel a form in some tools. The issue being we can't be sure a browser or screenreader will support duplicate accesskeys.

The f access key for this issue still seems to be unique! However, I'm looking to add a few more accesskeys to GradebookNG to improve keyboard navigation and want to be sure I don't introduce any conflicts (or bump into any future portal accesskeys!). Are there any policies or guidelines for adding accesskeys to Sakai tools? Or is it just best to double check against those in portal at the time and go from there? Thanks!

",192183,6164e3db99b4b8006a0b1bf2,"Wed, 24 Aug 2016 17:27:25 -0400","

Hi Payten Giles
We certainly don't want conflicts! What is GradebookNG using C for? I'm not familiar with GradebookNG's use.

Thanks

",,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,GBNGImportIssue,GradebookNG,,,,merged_11x,,,,,,,,,,,,41415,6164f785048360006aab8244,"Wed, 24 Aug 2016 20:01:17 -0400","

GradebookNG doesn't use 'c'. I was thinking of adding 'g' for the *g*rades table so you can easily jump to the table from the student *f*ilter and elsewhere.

Forums, Gradebook Classic and Podcasts all have instances of accesskey='c'.

",58405,6164e3db99b4b8006a0b1bf2,"Sat, 27 Aug 2016 03:36:18 -0400","

Thanks, I'll take a look when I have access to a full computer later today.

Those tools shouldn't use c as it will be a conflict with ""jump to continent"". Here's the list of other global accesskeys in Sakai if it helps. https://sakai.screenstepslive.com/s/sakai_help/m/50750/l/463927-accessibility-information G should be fine, but access keys have a history of unfortunate conflicts in edge cases (like maybe ""find again"").

",,,,,75262,6164f785048360006aab8244,"Sat, 27 Aug 2016 22:39:06 -0400",

Ah true. Perhaps T for table would be better? That doesn't seem to conflict with anything in the portal either. Thanks for the help/doco!

1. Enter as instructor
6. Fill in the other mandatory data for the meeting

[SAK-38248] accessibility changes,https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/browse/SAK-38248,10057,SAK,Sakai,"

Two things worry me about the accessibility of the current code:

column2: • The edit buttons are read before the content. This goes back to when it was a table with edit buttons on the left. At this point they are displayed on the right. I think from an accessibility point of view it probably makes sense to read it after the content as well. I'm also wondering whether we'd be better to show the icons as a small toolbar.
• Some screen readers try to read generated content. I think we should explicitly make the icons not visible. The items of which they are part should be read with titles.

column1:
",,31965,SAK-38248,accessibility changes,10007,https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/secure/viewavatar?size=medium&avatarId=10303&avatarType=issuetype,Bug,10002,https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/images/icons/priorities/major.svg,Major,5,https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/images/icons/statuses/resolved.png,"A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.",Resolved,3,done,green,10000,Fixed,6164d3a564ff010071b75c26,Charles Hedrick,6164d3a564ff010071b75c26,Charles Hedrick,"Tue, 24 May 2016 07:51:32 -0400","Wed, 18 Apr 2018 03:31:18 -0400",11.0,Lessons,0,1,Development,customfield_10000,com.atlassian.jira.plugins.jira-development-integration-plugin:devsummarycf,Rank,0|1092iw:,customfield_10019,com.pyxis.greenhopper.jira:gh-lexo-rank,Sprint,customfield_10020,com.pyxis.greenhopper.jira:gh-sprint,"Tue, 24 May 2016 08:46:30 -0400",,,,,,,[CHART] Date of First Response,customfield_10024,com.atlassian.jira.ext.charting:firstresponsedate,[CHART] Time in Status,customfield_10025,com.atlassian.jira.ext.charting:timeinstatus,,,11.2,12.0,40464,6164d3a564ff010071b75c26,"Tue, 24 May 2016 08:49:55 -0400","

The only QA you can do without a screen reader is to make sure there's no visible change.

column2: • make sure all font awesome icons are hidden with aria-hidden=""true"". They should all be within <A> elements that have titles.

• the edit icons have displayed at the end of the line throughout version 11. However they were textually at the beginning, with position=absolute. this patch moves them to the end, so that they will be announced after the body. With 3 or 4 icons I think it would be annoying to have them at the beginning.
• put the edit icons inside a DIV with role=""toolbar."" I'm trying to make it easier to skip them all at once

column1:

Adding a front end version for plain text of the characters counter

,40463,6164eaefbfa2c1006b186ab8,"Tue, 24 May 2016 05:01:54 -0400","

There are a couple of things in this patch: the JSF, might be a good time to update to 2 if possible to add more functionalities. The javascript, all the finds are constant time since they traverse the DOM on fixed elements. This is necessary in case many questions are in the same page, so the trigger is self contained.

",124534,557058:7074e357-325c-4f04-880f-321ecd7c7dc5,"Wed, 25 May 2016 06:28:51 -0400",

Please submit your patch as a pull request. thanks!

,"Wed, 25 May 2016 10:28:51 +0000",Depend,,,,10007,25938,char_count_mixed.png,46787,ug:2b4fe5c1-d1cb-4315-9058-3fdc1712a18e,"Tue, 24 May 2016 04:56:16 -0400",191257,6164eaefbfa2c1006b186ab8,"Wed, 25 May 2016 09:55:47 -0400","

Thank you Neal Caidin , pull request: SAM-2892

",74306,557058:d4bf1967-6188-4b29-bf4a-95cf874b4a08,"Wed, 1 Jun 2016 04:55:35 -0400","

If there is additional functionality needed like count characters, would it make sense for the user to switch to the rich text editor?

",107889,6164eaefbfa2c1006b186ab8,"Wed, 1 Jun 2016 05:55:14 -0400","

Hello Earle Nietzel , I am not sure I fully understand your question.... If the only functionality they need is counting characters on plain text, that would be enough... if they need rich text capabilities, of course they would need to switch to the rich text editor. It is just as it was in sakai 10 but now, counting characters does not submit the form to the backend, causing the time to get scrambled up.

",174581,557058:d4bf1967-6188-4b29-bf4a-95cf874b4a08,"Wed, 1 Jun 2016 06:54:21 -0400","

Hi Fernando,
I understand your issue, I am merely suggesting that if this functionality already exists in the rich text editor (RTE), so as you stated if they needed it they should just switch.

If we add this feature to the plain text whats to prevent someone from adding another feature that is already included in the RTE. Also by adding a duplicate feature it now has to be maintained, and increases code debt.
Again I am not objecting to adding this functionality, but rather am promoting a discussion about its legitimacy since this feature already exists.

Maybe there is a larger question in all of this, Does samigo need 2 editors?

",191270,6164eaefbfa2c1006b186ab8,"Wed, 1 Jun 2016 07:00:36 -0400","

Earle Nietzel I absolutely agree . This contribution is based on feedback coming from faculty who uses the feature without enabling the rich editor which also counts HTML elements, hence it is not as accurate as the plain text one. The overhead of the HTML chars counted in ckeditor shouldn't be an issue when the limit is high enough.

",,,40753,SAK-36356,depends on,,,,,,,,,,,22686,char_count_plain.png,10589,ug:2b4fe5c1-d1cb-4315-9058-3fdc1712a18e,"Tue, 24 May 2016 04:56:16 -0400",41892,ckeditor_chars_counter.png,27495,ug:2b4fe5c1-d1cb-4315-9058-3fdc1712a18e,"Mon, 6 Jun 2016 05:50:45 -0400",,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,40483,557058:d4bf1967-6188-4b29-bf4a-95cf874b4a08,"Wed, 1 Jun 2016 07:07:06 -0400","

Maybe if we used a more capable ckeditor plugin that could count html chars, spaces, etc

also shows maximum allowed chars as well.

",57480,557058:d4bf1967-6188-4b29-bf4a-95cf874b4a08,"Wed, 1 Jun 2016 07:10:35 -0400","

So if the primary reason is to indicate how many chars the database will allow then maybe it should show how many are remaining i.e. 1322 / 4000.

I still prefer the single RTE solution as the ui indicates!

",,,,,74307,557058:7074e357-325c-4f04-880f-321ecd7c7dc5,"Wed, 1 Jun 2016 07:20:35 -0400",

Samigo is already complex enough (too complex!). A redundant feature doesn't make sense to me for just a little extra convenience. 2 cents.

,91179,6164eaefbfa2c1006b186ab8,"Wed, 1 Jun 2016 07:55:03 -0400","

Neal Caidin Earle Nietzel sounds good. I hope we could do that integration soon enough. Can we mark this one as closed? after that i will close the PR.

",157967,6164eaefbfa2c1006b186ab8,"Mon, 6 Jun 2016 04:57:33 -0400","

Hello Neal Caidin - I closed the PR. Have a nice day.

",40498,557058:7074e357-325c-4f04-880f-321ecd7c7dc5,"Mon, 6 Jun 2016 05:46:30 -0400","

Thanks Fernando.

Do we need a new Jira to turn on this feature in the CK editor in Samigo?

[SAK-31252] Roster always shows profile picture when you search for users.,https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/browse/SAK-31252,10057,SAK,Sakai,"

Even if you see the official photo in the unfiltered list (because is selected), you will see the profile picture if you type for any user in the input and click find.
1.- Enter as instructor and upload an image to your profile.
2.- Create a site and go to roster.
3.- The default option is ""Official Photo"" so you won't see any image (right!!).
4.- Type the name instructor in the input to search users, and select it.

You will see the instructor and the profile picture you've uploaded before, but you must see the official photo.

[SAK-31251] postem: No error messages displayed in Post 'Em.,https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/browse/SAK-31251,10057,SAK,Sakai,"

Issue: Post 'Em is supposed to give alerts when one of the following actions is taken:

column2: • Trying to upload a file that is not .csv file type. You should get an alert, ""Alert: The file [filename] that you uploaded is not a valid file type. Please make sure your file is saved as a *.csv file and try again.""

• Trying to upload a file with a username of a student not in the site. You should get an alert, ""Alert: The following usernames are not associated with participants in this site: [usernames listed] To continue, you must first add these participants to the site or remove the participants from the file.""
• Clicking Post before selecting a file to upload. You should get an alert, ""Alert: Please choose a file to post.""

column1: In Sakai 11, none of these produces an error message for the user. The screen just refreshes. If a file with an incorrect mimetype or a csv file with an incorrect user listed was selected, its filename continues to display on the screen after it refreshes.
Steps to reproduce issue 1 (selecting file that is not .csv):

column2: • Click Choose a CSV file or URL from Resources.
• Click Browse and select a file from your computer that is a different format than CSV (e.g. an image or .doc file).
• The page reloads, there is no error message indicating that you are trying to upload an incorrect file type:

• This is a regression from 10. In 10, you get an error message indicating, ""Alert: The file [filename] that you uploaded is not a valid file type. Please make sure your file is saved as a *.csv file and try again.""

column1: Steps to reproduce issue 2 (selecting file that has incorrect students listed):

column2: • Create a CSV file with some students listed who are not members of the site.
• Click Choose a CSV file or URL from Resources.
• Click Browse and select the file you created in step 1.
• The page reloads, there is no error message indicating that you are trying to upload a file with students not in the site:

• This is a regression from 10. In 10, you get an error message indicating, ""Alert: The following usernames are not associated with participants in this site: [usernames listed] To continue, you must first add these participants to the site or remove the participants from the file. ""

column1: Steps to reproduce issue 3 (clicking Post with no file selected): (This issue is on
<a href=""https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/browse/SAK-31784"" class=""jira-issue-macro-key issue-link""  title=""No error message displayed when missing file on Postem"" >

column2: • You should get an error message: ""Alert: Please choose a file to post."" but you don't.

column1:

,91361,557058:3f0964c4-a9d3-4cc7-9473-78b4f46c68ad,"Wed, 24 Aug 2016 11:02:40 -0400","

Western is nearly finished QA'ing our LTI integration against our fork of Sakai 10.3 before our local deployment next week, and then we'll begin contributing to 11.x and master. This is gonna take some strategy as we've done quite a bit of work on this over the past few months. Merging back to Sakai 10 would be the last step, but since Turnitin has pushed their Sakai API cutoff date back, it's a question if there are institutions that would like to use Turnitin that cannot upgrade to 11 in time.

<a href=""https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/browse/SAK-39967"" class=""jira-issue-macro-key issue-link""  title=""Turnitin Core API Sakai integration"" >

and no longer done. Please re-open if this isn't the case.

",126371,557058:0910e6ab-003c-48c8-bd65-286aa735ab6c,"Mon, 28 May 2018 04:26:57 -0400","

Yes, this year, I have been in discussion with Turnitin's Integrations teams and have learned that they are working on updates to their integrations. While speaking with them, both parties have decided that the LTI implementation of Turnitin in Sakai's Assignments will no longer be required when their new offerings are available in Sakai in the next year or two - Bryan Holladay is working on the replacement implementation for Sakai's Assignments and Content Review, as you mentioned, in
<a href=""https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/browse/SAK-39967"" class=""jira-issue-macro-key issue-link""  title=""Turnitin Core API Sakai integration"" >
. Turnitin has confirmed that they will keep their Legacy API available until the new offerings are available.

We have decided that instead of having Sakai schools switch from using the Legacy API to using the LTI implementation and then switch again to the new offering in a year or two, it will be less disruptive for schools to switch their Turnitin implementation once to the new offering when it is ready.
With this new plan, Western has ceased work on porting our Turnitin LTI implementation of Content Review to Sakai Master, as it will no longer be needed by the Sakai community.

For other Sakai schools using Turnitin in Sakai's Assignments tool, my advice is to continue to use the current Turnitin Legacy API until Turnitin's new Content Review implementation in Assignments is available. Turnitin has informed me that their LTI connection is still available to link to Turnitin as an external tool using BasicLTI (separate of Sakai's Assignments).

[SAK-31245] Long instructor comments from Assignments don't display well in student Gradebook view,https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/browse/SAK-31245,10057,SAK,Sakai,"

When an instructor writes long comments (I have seen 10+ paragraphs) in Assignments for an assignment that is linked to the Gradebook, all the comment text is displayed in a narrow column. This means that the height of that row in the student's gradebook view has to be as tall as needed to accommodate the feedback. Since the Gradebook also can't propery handle the rich text comments from Assignments, the feedback as it appears to students in the Gradebook can become a giant blob of text without even paragraph breaks.
We have had instructors complain that it makes their carefully written and formatted feedback in Assignments seem unprofessional when view by students in the Gradebook.

At the very least it would be good in the students' view of the Gradebook to add a CSS max-height of a few hundred pixels and overflow:auto in the comment table cell so that the individual comments could be scrolled through if they get long. This would keep each row from exploding to be thousands of pixels tall.

",,31959,SAK-31245,Long instructor comments from Assignments don't display well in student Gradebook view,10007,https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/secure/viewavatar?size=medium&avatarId=10303&avatarType=issuetype,Bug,10002,https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/images/icons/priorities/major.svg,Major,5,https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/images/icons/statuses/resolved.png,"A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. [SAK-38852] Connection leaks lead to SQLTransientConnectionException using Oracle & Terracotta,https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/browse/SAK-38852,10057,SAK,Sakai,"

Oracle DB: 12.1.0.2
Two Sakai11 Tomcat servers w/Terracotta enabled (only session replication):
Note: There are other servers connected to this database, but only the terracotta enabled servers experience this issue.
HikariCP Configuration (note: pool size is 25, & leakDetectionThreshold is 30000):

2016-05-20 15:42:37,301 DEBUG localhost-startStop-1 com.zaxxer.hikari.HikariConfig - dataSourceProperties............{password=<masked>, prepStmtCacheSqlLimit=2048, useServerPrepStmts=true, cachePrepStmts=true, prepStmtCacheSize=250}
<pre>2016-05-20 15:45:22,049  WARN sakai housekeeper com.zaxxer.hikari.pool.ProxyLeakTask - Connection leak detection triggered for oracle.jdbc.driver.T4CConnection@54c58c2b, stack trace follows
these mount up until we get an SQLTransientConnectionException:

<pre>2016-05-20 15:47:17,428  WARN org.sakaiproject.event.impl.ClusterEventTracking$$EnhancerBySpringCGLIB$$d42ec2bd org.sakaiproject.event.impl.ClusterEventTracking - org.sakaiproject.event.impl.ClusterEventTracking$$EnhancerBySpringCGLIB$$d42ec2bd@5dbc423.writeBatchEvents: java.sql.SQLTransientConnectionException: sakai - Connection is not available, request timed out after 30001ms.
java.sql.SQLTransientConnectionException: sakai - Connection is not available, request timed out after 30001ms.
I've attached the full catalina.out (yes, I know that the DB is mal-configured). I've also attached the YourKit snapshot taken of this session.
Please let me know if there is anything else you need.

I made a post on the HikariCP google group about this.

",,,,,40489,557058:d4bf1967-6188-4b29-bf4a-95cf874b4a08,"Thu, 2 Jun 2016 11:49:29 -0400","
<a href=""https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/browse/SAK-39076"" class=""jira-issue-macro-key issue-link""  title=""ClusterEventTracking gets hung up when an error occurs"" >
didn't change any of the connection logic so I would expect to see the same issue.
<a href=""https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/browse/SAK-39076"" class=""jira-issue-macro-key issue-link""  title=""ClusterEventTracking gets hung up when an error occurs"" >

is a new Thread is launched every time so the calls to ThreadLocalManager operate on a new thread vs an eternal one. As long as the connection is being cleaned up, which it looks that way, it should be fine.

",74314,557058:d4bf1967-6188-4b29-bf4a-95cf874b4a08,"Thu, 2 Jun 2016 12:05:03 -0400","

So was just looking at your logs, I did notice that there are other places other than the writeBatchEvents where the exception is thrown.
The exceptions are occurring when you can no longer get a connection... Which when you have a thread that does db writes every 5 seconds its probably going to affect this logic a lot!

Its very possible that ClusterEventTracking has nothing to do with the root cause here and its just stumbling because every 5 seconds it wants to do some work.

",107895,557058:d4bf1967-6188-4b29-bf4a-95cf874b4a08,"Thu, 2 Jun 2016 12:33:37 -0400","

Maybe try setting HikariCP back to version 2.4.3 see this issue.
If that doesn't help I would try turning on autoCommit just to see if it helps with anything?

DBCP had this option called enableAutocommitOnReturn that was on by default so every time a connection was returned commit was called.

",191278,557058:1126cb77-b601-4bf1-a169-76deaba72266,"Thu, 2 Jun 2016 23:24:00 -0400","

Connection behaviour of methods:
dbWriteCount(String sql, Object[] fields, String lastField, Connection callerConnection, int failQuiet)

column2: • Passed connection - no commit/rollback, no pool return
• Threadlocal connection - no commit/rollback, no pool return

column1: dbInsert(Connection callerConnection, String sql, Object[] fields, String autoColumn, InputStream last, int lastLength)

column2: • Threadlocal connection - no commit/rollback, no pool return

column1: dbRead(Connection callerConn, String sql, Object[] fields, SqlReader reader)

column2: • Passed connection - no commit, no pool return
• Threadlocal connection - no commit, no pool return
• Borrowed connection - commit (if m_commitAfterRead set), pool return

column1:
Just for reference at the moment.

",,,,,,,,,157960,557058:484caead-d9ac-463d-bf51-f7c22821a458,"Fri, 3 Jun 2016 06:05:35 -0400","

I'm leaving this ticket open as the issue still persists, but it was occurring because the caches where not being set up correctly (they where being enabled when they should not have been). I opened
<a href=""https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/browse/SAK-39894"" class=""jira-issue-macro-key issue-link""  title=""Improve ClusterEventTracking cache setup"" >
When the ClusterEventTracking.eventsCache & ClusterEventTracking.eventsLastCache are enabled, a connection leak is still present:
<pre>2016-06-03 10:58:17,101  WARN sakai housekeeper com.zaxxer.hikari.pool.ProxyLeakTask - Connection leak detection triggered for oracle.jdbc.driver.T4CConnection@6aee9b74, stack trace follows

",74478,557058:1126cb77-b601-4bf1-a169-76deaba72266,"Fri, 19 Aug 2016 02:32:46 -0400","

I'm still looking into this but we have just had a whole load of nodes lose all their database connections. Well what looks to have happened is that the ClusterEventTracking has taken all of them which has left no connections left for responding to actual user requests, the cluster event service then itself looks to get stuck while it tries to acquire another connection.
This was just a GC root because that thread happened to be obtaining a connection at that point. I've enabled leakDetectionThreshold but so far it hasn't happened again.

I'm still looking into this at the moment but thought I'd get the discussion going. We don't have any of the clustered session stuff active and we're on MySQL.

",174780,70121:ec0fd122-4a2d-4492-a966-78d3f9aa9080,"Wed, 31 Aug 2016 12:57:05 -0400","

This library seems like it might be pretty cool too. Gives you more pool monitoring and lets you dynamically resize.

https://github.com/vladmihalcea/flexy-pool

",174788,557058:1126cb77-b601-4bf1-a169-76deaba72266,"Wed, 7 Sep 2016 00:58:14 -0400","

You can dynamically size the pool using JMX with HikariCP and also see how the pool is currently doing (idle conncetions).

https://github.com/brettwooldridge/HikariCP/wiki/MBean-(JMX)-Monitoring-and-Management

",158149,557058:48227012-f9a6-40a4-97e6-94c8ef57f33e,"Wed, 7 Sep 2016 05:59:02 -0400","

I just attached my JMX-monitoring of TotalConnections ...... This is on a busy instance with a fair bit of batch processing (e.g., Sakora). I see peaks going up to 30

",40850,600b14afe64c95006fef06cb,"Fri, 9 Dec 2016 06:04:06 -0500","

We are having an issue similar to the one described in this jira. We are running Sakai 11.2 with Oracle with no Terracotta stuff enabled.

We are experiencing intermittent pool exhaustion. Our three sakai servers exhaust all their connections at the same time in about one minute. Then everything get back to normal by itself. This is causing a service interruption of about 3 minutes 1 or 2 times per week. It's not a peak load issue since it may happens at times where the load is small (late at night on a saturday...)

",57836,70121:ec0fd122-4a2d-4492-a966-78d3f9aa9080,"Fri, 9 Dec 2016 06:32:05 -0500","

The last comment on list from Leonardo was
""We have not been experiencing these ""SQLTransientConnectionException""s on Oracle 12c with the default pool size of 10, we currently have 2.1k sessions across 6 instances and 1 DB.
I would like to point everyone to the following HikariCP document> https://github.com/brettwooldridge/HikariCP/wiki/About-Pool-Sizing""
You can try to increase the max pool size and see what happens. I believe you can do this via JMX too as described here

I feel like this is either a non-issue or documentation issue. It really seems like it's more about being more proactive about monitoring your instances and adjusting when necessary. And it seems to be an issue only affecting Oracle.

The newest hikaricp (2.5.1) will be included in 11.3, you may want to try that one along with this parameter.

",74705,557058:d083b1a2-05d0-42f2-a6cc-6f872b5fa30f,"Sun, 8 Jan 2017 21:19:48 -0500","

I saw this on mysql 5.7 with hikaricp 2.5.1, with a max pool size of 10 (the default, which should really be changed).

",175004,600b14afe64c95006fef06cb,"Thu, 19 Jan 2017 05:20:18 -0500","

Finally, we solved the issue that I described on december 9th by increasing the minimumIdle parameter (our maximumPoolSize was already much higher than the default 10). We also increased the connectionTimeout from 30 seconds to 90 seconds. For our Sakai installation (11.2 with Oracle) Hikari seems to react better with a certain number of connections permanently available in the pool. Even if they are sitting idle most of the time.

",74758,557058:7074e357-325c-4f04-880f-321ecd7c7dc5,"Fri, 3 Feb 2017 03:23:43 -0500","

Hi philippe rancourt (I'm technically ignorant) but is this a local configuration issue or a Sakai bug? Thanks.

",108331,600b14afe64c95006fef06cb,"Fri, 3 Feb 2017 03:45:08 -0500","

I would say this is a configuration issue that could be very specific to our sakai installation. IMO, we can close this jira.

",158394,557058:484caead-d9ac-463d-bf51-f7c22821a458,"Tue, 7 Feb 2017 04:40:33 -0500","

I would like to point out that the initial configuration for this ticket involved the use of terracotta caching servers. philippe rancourt's experience did not use terracotta caching servers.

[SAK-31242] Gradebook: Newly created item assigned to a category with keep/drop options enabled will automatically update its point value without warning,https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/browse/SAK-31242,10057,SAK,Sakai,"

When creating a gradebook item, if a point value is entered and the item is assigned to a category in which keep/drop options are enabled, and in which the other items have a different point value, the page refreshes and the point value of the new item is changed to match that of the other items with no warning or notification message.

Expected and desirable behavior would be to display the notification message ""Item value will change in order to support the drop highest, drop lowest, or keep highest setting,"" which appears when an existing item is edited and placed within a category in which keep/drop options are enabled.

column2: • Access the Gradebook tool in a test site (requires categories with keep/drop options enabled)
• Create a new gradebook item, and enter a point value different from the point value of the other items in a category
• Note that the page refreshes and the point value of the item changes without any warning

column2: • Add a GB item to it (e.g., worth 10 pts)
• Create a quiz in Samigo with a DIFFERENT point value (e.g., 20 pts) as the item above.
• In quiz settings, send grade to GB.
• In Assignments, create an assignment with a third point value (e.g., 30 pts).
• Go to GB and try to move the quiz and assignment into the drop lowest category.
• You should get an error and be prevented from moving them.

[SAK-31241] Gradebook Classic - Grader role sees unassigned category only,https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/browse/SAK-31241,10057,SAK,Sakai,"

When a grader, who has been given either View or Grade capability for All Categories, clicks a student's name from the All Grades screen, the only category displayed is Unassigned.

Attached are three screen shots, one showing the rule that has been created for the grader, one showing the Gradebook Items page as seen by the grader to display all available categories and the last one to show what the grader sees when clicking a student's name from the All Grades page.
Working in a site with Teaching Assistant added . . .

column2: • As the instructor, setup the Gradebook with Categories and Weighting enabled.
• Add several items to each of the categories.
• Add items and do not assign them to a category.
• On the Permission Settings page in Gradebook, select a grader (Teaching Assistant) to edit.
• Select either View _or _Grade in the first drop down.
• Leave_ All Categories_ and All Sections/Groups in remaining drop downs.
• Log in as Teaching Assistant in the site.
• Go to Gradebook Items page and verify that access is available to each category and each item within the category.
• Click one of the student's names. Teaching Assistant only has access to Unassigned category and item(s) added to that category.

[SAK-31238] Gradebook Classic - Discrepancy between grades that are struck out on All Grades page and Gradebook Item Summay Page,https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/browse/SAK-31238,10057,SAK,Sakai,"

There is a discrepancy between the Gradebook Item Summary page for an item and the All Grades page. The grade that is struck through for a student when any of the drop/keep options has been enabled for a category is different between the two pages.

Attached are two screenshots, one showing what is displayed on the Gradebook Item Summary page for an item (DH #1) and what is being displayed on the All Grades page. Notice that on the Gradebook Item Summary _page for DH #1, no grades are struck through for a student. Compare that to the _All Grades page where the DH #1 column shows all students' grades struck through. This occurs in each of the drop/keep options.

column2: • As an Instructor, click the Gradebook Setup tab in Gradebook.
• Create three categories (one for Drop Highest, one for Drop Lowest and one for Keep Highest) and assign them weights that total 100%
• Select all three drop/keep options (Enable Drop Highest, Enable Drop Lowest and Enable Keep Highest)

column1: #Enter a 1 for Drop Highest, 1 for Drop Lowest and 2 for Keep Highest.

column2: • Return to Gradebook Items page and create 3 gradebook items for each category, including each item in the course grade calculation.
• Grade each item by entering the same grade, student by student. For example, Student01 gets a 10 for every item and Student02 gets a 9, Student03 gets an 8, etc.
• After grades have been entered, click the title of an item and notice which student's grade is struck through.
• Click the All Grades tab and notice that the grade struck out under the item column does NOT match the grade that was struck out on the Gradebook Summary page for the same item.

column1:

Issues which are closed can be reopened.",Closed,3,done,green,10000,Fixed,557058:d4bf1967-6188-4b29-bf4a-95cf874b4a08,Earle Nietzel,557058:d4bf1967-6188-4b29-bf4a-95cf874b4a08,Earle Nietzel,"Thu, 19 May 2016 13:30:14 -0400","Wed, 25 Apr 2018 11:19:45 -0400",10.6,Kernel,0,3,Development,customfield_10000,com.atlassian.jira.plugins.jira-development-integration-plugin:devsummarycf,Rank,0|1092c8:,customfield_10019,com.pyxis.greenhopper.jira:gh-lexo-rank,Sprint,customfield_10020,com.pyxis.greenhopper.jira:gh-sprint,"Fri, 20 May 2016 11:39:30 -0400",,,,,,,[CHART] Date of First Response,customfield_10024,com.atlassian.jira.ext.charting:firstresponsedate,[CHART] Time in Status,customfield_10025,com.atlassian.jira.ext.charting:timeinstatus,,,10.8 [Tentative],11.2,157926,557058:d4bf1967-6188-4b29-bf4a-95cf874b4a08,"Thu, 19 May 2016 13:33:58 -0400",

The approach here was to have the thread managed by the ScheduledExecutorService (SES) instead of using an eternal thread. The SES will launch a new thread at scheduled intervals (5 secs default) to process any events. If the thread unexpectedly ends for any reason a new thread will start.

[SAK-31233] Filtering by a custom role could cause HTTP 500 error,https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/browse/SAK-31233,10057,SAK,Sakai,"

Hi @kyleblythe. I think this one is an O/S and browser configuration issue.
For OSX, Firefox honours the operating system keyboard configuration. This can be changed via System Preferences > Keyboard and then by selecting All Controls option below:

For other operating systems, Firefox has an option which allows users to include/exclude links from the tab flow - this can be found by navigating to about:config and changing the accessibility.tabfocus entry to 7.

It's certainly a little obscure, but I like to assume that keyboard savvy Firefox users would have this all sorted out. It's worth noting that a Firefox user would not be able to navigate through the standard Sakai page and navigation links using the tab key without modifying their configuration.

We have proposed a tweak to the morpheus ""okcolor"" styling for the ""messageSuccess"" class to bring these confirmations in line with the info boxes/bootstrap in general.
Since we've got these confirmation messages reflecting the messageSuccess class, we can go ahead and close out this ticket.

[SAK-37463] Allow users to personalize text in lessons,https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/browse/SAK-37463,10057,SAK,Sakai,"

This patch allows users to insert

into text that they've added to lessons to display the current user's name. This just simply does a find and replace on the text when it is being displayed so it can be formatted any way normal text can be.
Here is a link to a video (without sound) that demos this feature.

A patch has been attached to this ticket and a pull request can be made if there is interest.

[SAK-38296] Add ability to expand and collapse sections,https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/browse/SAK-38296,10057,SAK,Sakai,"

This patch adds the ability for a user to add a header to a section of a Lessons page. If a header is added the user can make the section expandable and collapsible when the header is clicked. There is also an option to have the section start closed.

I've attached a patch to this ticket, but I can make a pull request if there is interest.

The more I read up on it the more I think I'm going to have to replace the use of before and after. It's too questionable for screen readers.

,"Tue, 24 May 2016 08:57:41 +0000",Relate,,,,10008,25932,editexpandcollapse.png,3375180,ug:067fb937-3894-482b-a0bc-c628fe0fef66,"Wed, 18 May 2016 05:41:52 -0400",124533,6164d3a564ff010071b75c26,"Wed, 25 May 2016 05:28:43 -0400","

UI changes:

column2: • collapse all is now a link to the left of print view. Using a big blue button made the page too cluttered and took up vertical space. I'm not really happy with using links for those, but the standard buttons are too big and too visible. The first thing your eye goes to on the page shouldn't be those buttons.

• I'm using toggle-up and toggle-down. the problem is that I was using collapse for combining adjacent sections. The other thing I considered was using fa-exchange for combining sections and collapse / expand for your tool. My UI guy slightly preferred toggle-up and down

• I'm concerned that it's not all that visible that there's more content there if the section is collapsed. The difference between toggle-up or toggle-down (or expand and compress) isn't that visible, particularly with them float right. The options I considered were adding [collapsed] after the title or using an icon. My UI guy suggested fa-bars as something he's seen elsewhere.

• Screen readers won't see the icons. They will see either ""click to expand"" or ""click to collapse"" after the header. Screen readers ignore CSS opacity and position, so it will just seem like it's at the end of the header.

[SAK-31226] Re-Certify Sakai 11 as LTI 2.0,https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/browse/SAK-31226,10057,SAK,Sakai,"

We are in a strange place between LTI 2.0 and LTI 2.1. The LTI 2.1 spec and certification is evolving while the LTI 2.0 spec is solid. The Sakai 11 code is a hybrid between LTI 2.0 and LTI 2.1. Somethings which are done to pass the LTI 2.1 certification (currently) break the older LTI 2.0 certification.

Sakai-11 needs to ship with solid LTI 2.0 certification while not removing all of the (almost done) LTI 2.1 code. This JIRA will (under control of a property) back off some of the LTI 2.1 changes that break LTI 2.0 certification. The default for the property will be to support LTI 2.0 - for those testing LTI 2.1 certification, they will need to add a property to switch on the LTI 2.1 that is not upwards compatible with LTI 2.0.

Hopefully the details in the LTI 2.1 certification can work out so that the same code certifies with both.

",,27525,SAK-31226,Re-Certify Sakai 11 as LTI 2.0,10007,https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/secure/viewavatar?size=medium&avatarId=10303&avatarType=issuetype,Bug,10000,https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/images/icons/priorities/blocker.svg,Blocker,10025,https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/images/icons/statuses/generic.png,Indicates QA is complete and an issue has been tested and verified (Migrated on 12 Oct 2021 03:05 UTC),Verified,3,done,green,10000,Fixed,557058:718cd3f6-5ff9-42fa-8914-b4224aff1730,Charles Severance,557058:718cd3f6-5ff9-42fa-8914-b4224aff1730,Charles Severance,"Tue, 17 May 2016 10:40:42 -0400","Mon, 6 Jun 2016 07:54:34 -0400",11.0,BasicLTI,0,2,Development,customfield_10000,com.atlassian.jira.plugins.jira-development-integration-plugin:devsummarycf,Rank,0|10927k:,customfield_10019,com.pyxis.greenhopper.jira:gh-lexo-rank,Sprint,customfield_10020,com.pyxis.greenhopper.jira:gh-sprint,"Tue, 24 May 2016 07:33:38 -0400",,,,,,,[CHART] Date of First Response,customfield_10024,com.atlassian.jira.ext.charting:firstresponsedate,[CHART] Time in Status,customfield_10025,com.atlassian.jira.ext.charting:timeinstatus,,,11.0,,57483,70121:6370bdf3-5c06-40b8-a5fb-94a75dd136a2,"Thu, 2 Jun 2016 05:44:07 -0400","

[SAK-31223] preselected tools in toolOrder.xml do not take effect,https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/browse/SAK-31223,10057,SAK,Sakai,"

While applying
<a href=""https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/browse/SAK-16600"" class=""jira-issue-macro-key issue-link""  title=""Improve layout/organization of tools in site-info "" >
patch to our installation we found a slight problem:
When specifying a preselected tool in the file toolOrder.xml for example:
We found it to be due to a simple ""copy-paste"" mistake in the source code.
However our copy of the source seemed to be an old branch, therefore, this change might already be integrated in your sakai version.
For more details a patch called SAK-16600-preselection-fix.patch is attached:

[SAK-31220] Add assignmentId to calendar entity provider to allow deeplinking,https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/browse/SAK-31220,10057,SAK,Sakai,"

The calendar has the ability to deeplink to assignments, however the assignmentId is not provided in the calendar event.
This ticket adds the field so that events that are assignment due dates, have the field populated and the deeplinking can be performed.
1. Add some events to a site's calendar.
2. In the same site, add an assignment and link it to the calendar also.

3. Note the site_id and then visit http://YOUR_SAKAI_SERVER/direct/calendar/site/SITE_ID.json and note the assignmentId field is populated for the assignment event.

[SAK-31216] Adding Rubrics to Sakai Samigo and Assignments,https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/browse/SAK-31216,10057,SAK,Sakai,"

Rubrics is a standalone tool which can be used in Samigo, Assignments, or any other tool which wants to implement them.
1. Core Rubrics, provided by the University or institution

3. User own rubrics. These were originally based in either types (1) or (2) and then saved for each user to re-use as templates in different questions/sites. - this can be accessed through ""My Rubrics"" tab.
We have been using them at Rutgers for some time now, and some people finds them useful.
Each rubric can have its rows,columns, content of cells, points and comments customized.

Should a rubric has""weighted"" points, these will be assigned to each item or assignment, allowing the user to fine-adjust said points. For instance, for a given question, a rubric cell grants 70% of total points which will be marked in the assignment/samigo question. Then the grades can adjust this up/down.
3. Student Feedback: after graded, each student can see the highlighted cell category and points granted by the rubric.
For a test case, please see attached pictures.
1) Adding Core Rubric to Samigo's short answer question ( 'adding_ru_short_answer... 'pictures 1 through 6)
2) Adding a custom rubric and saving it as ""My Rubric"" to re-use it later on as a template ('creating_rubric' set of pictures 1 - 5)

Pull request on git to be added soon.

[SAK-31212] Calendar external subscriptions (ics URLs) don't work between sites,https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/browse/SAK-31212,10057,SAK,Sakai,"

Due to the restrictions included in SAK-21718 to prevent infinite loops between subscribed calendars, currently it's not possible to subscribe to a calendar ics URL from another site.
In fact, as the user-agent string is checked, it's not possible subscribing from any Sakai platform which has the same version (i.e: sakai-10.5)
Merging calendars has the big disadvantage that events are only visible for users who have permissions in both merged sites.

My proposal is changing the user-agent string to include the site Id (so subscribing to the calendar of the same site is still prevented) and managing a list of subscribed calendars so circular dependencies are detected too.

",,49471,SAK-31212,Calendar external subscriptions (ics URLs) don't work between sites,10007,https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/secure/viewavatar?size=medium&avatarId=10303&avatarType=issuetype,Bug,10002,https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/images/icons/priorities/major.svg,Major,6,https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/images/icons/statuses/closed.png,"The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.",Closed,3,done,green,10001,Won't Fix,5db0830566a99f0d9c5a0770,Daniel Merino,5db0830566a99f0d9c5a0770,Daniel Merino,"Sun, 15 May 2016 22:39:11 -0400","Wed, 19 Oct 2016 02:49:56 -0400",11.0,Calendar,0,3,Development,customfield_10000,com.atlassian.jira.plugins.jira-development-integration-plugin:devsummarycf,Rank,0|109248:,customfield_10019,com.pyxis.greenhopper.jira:gh-lexo-rank,Sprint,customfield_10020,com.pyxis.greenhopper.jira:gh-sprint,"Wed, 5 Oct 2016 03:05:19 -0400",,,,,,,Test Plan,customfield_10038,com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.customfieldtypes:textarea,[CHART] Date of First Response,customfield_10024,com.atlassian.jira.ext.charting:firstresponsedate,,,,,191265,557058:1126cb77-b601-4bf1-a169-76deaba72266,"Mon, 30 May 2016 23:48:44 -0400",

Why doesn't the Merge functionality in the calendar tool work for you?

,40479,5db0830566a99f0d9c5a0770,"Mon, 30 May 2016 23:57:27 -0400","

The use case is having a calendar in a parent site where teachers can see all events of several children sites, even if they are not member of these sites. This is for having a common calendar of exams, for example.
Merging calendars is not an option because each teacher only see events of their children sites, but not of the others.

Another idea was changing the merge behaviour to allow read permission if the site is a parent, but I took a look on the code and it looked to me that it was a lot harder than fixing subscription to work between sites.

",91174,557058:1126cb77-b601-4bf1-a169-76deaba72266,"Tue, 31 May 2016 00:05:27 -0400",

What about creating a role that can see the calendar?

,"

This issue is very hard to test, because calendars are cached and I haven't found a way to disable cached results other than restarting the server or waiting some indeterminate time.
The main thing to test should be checking that server doesn't run out of memory after restarting due to infinite loop on circular references.
-Create two sites A & B with calendars. Enable the ""subscribe to calendar"" permission if it's needed.
-On site A calendar, click on ""Publish(Private)"" button / ""Generate"" and grab the URL.
-On site A click on ""Merge external calendars"" and subscribe to site A URL. This should not work and should do nothing.
-On site B calendar click on ""Publish(Private)"" button / ""Generate"" and grab the URL.
-On site B calendar click on ""Merge external calendars"" and subscribe to site A URL.
-On site A calendar click on ""Merge external calendars"" and subscribe to site B URL.

-Publish events in both sites and check that are visible in the other site. Have in mind that you will see duplicated events due to the circular reference, but this is a usual behaviour IMHO. If this is not desired, events should be managed too to avoid repetitions.

",Relate,,,,10008,,,,,,107885,5db0830566a99f0d9c5a0770,"Tue, 31 May 2016 00:18:36 -0400","

I don't understand very well your advice.
If I have a site A (parent) and a site B (child) and I merge their calendars, Instructors in A can see events from B only if they are Instructors in B.

Do you mean to add Instructors of site A into site B with a new role different of Instructor?

",141267,557058:1126cb77-b601-4bf1-a169-76deaba72266,"Tue, 31 May 2016 01:05:48 -0400","

Yep, I mean create a role in B that can just view the calendar and then add everyone to the B site in the new role.

",191266,5db0830566a99f0d9c5a0770,"Tue, 31 May 2016 02:24:03 -0400","

Well, thanks, I suppose it could work. Though it would add some complexity to the roster synchronization and I don't know the implications of having a role only with that permission.

Anyway, I think that subscribing a calendar of another site is a pretty common request. I'd rather prefer to fix the issue if it were possible. I hope that there is a safe, non performance killer fix.

The map is what has come to my mind, but if you think that is risky I also though about managing an HttpSession to store the subscribed calendars. What do you think about it?

",157979,557058:1126cb77-b601-4bf1-a169-76deaba72266,"Thu, 9 Jun 2016 06:18:56 -0400","

Doesn't the change in
<a href=""https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/browse/SAK-25260"" class=""jira-issue-macro-key issue-link""  title=""Announcements / merged announcements not available to students"" >

mean that merging would work for you?

",124579,5db0830566a99f0d9c5a0770,"Fri, 10 Jun 2016 00:17:36 -0400","

I understand that the merge feature was modified in Announcements in
<a href=""https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/browse/SAK-25260"" class=""jira-issue-macro-key issue-link""  title=""Announcements / merged announcements not available to students"" >
to work the same way we would like for Calendar.
But I think that it is up to the Teaching and Learning group to discuss about the exact implications of merging tool events from site to site and what visibility should be applied.

The current behaviour in Calendar merge shows events only to users who can see them in both sites, so merging is only a way to unify already visible events in a single view. Currently merging events from a site A into a site B apply access control of site A. Maybe it should apply access control of site B and show events to users of that site.

On the other hand, while Announcements has only merge feature, Calendar has merge and subscribe. Maybe subscribe is the correct way to achieve this and merge can maintain the current behaviour. If my patch looks fine to you, this is what it does, allowing to subscribe calendar between sites.

",,,48974,SAK-25260,is related to,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,"Tue, 31 May 2016 03:48:44 +0000",[CHART] Time in Status,customfield_10025,com.atlassian.jira.ext.charting:timeinstatus,s2u-work,,,,12.0,,,,,,,,,,,,,141299,557058:1126cb77-b601-4bf1-a169-76deaba72266,"Fri, 10 Jun 2016 00:53:28 -0400","

Doh, sorry I got confused between announcements and calendars.
I think Calendar is working correctly in only showing events to people who can see them.

[SAK-31204] Button styling in Assignments tool,https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/browse/SAK-31204,10057,SAK,Sakai,"

Currently, all actionable buttons in the Assignments tool are styled the same, with blue background and white text. This makes it difficult to scan through and identify the primary action (e.g., ""Post"" or ""Submit""), as all of the buttons look the same.

We recommend following the approach used by Google and other apps, wherein the ""primary"" action is styled with a background color, and all other actions (Cancel, Save Draft, navigation between submissions, etc.) be styled in a light grey so as to be less attention-grabbing.

For examples, see the current assignments submission screen and a screenshot of gmail.

",,53773,SAK-31204,Button styling in Assignments tool,10026,https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/secure/viewavatar?size=medium&avatarId=10300&avatarType=issuetype,Sub-task,10002,https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/images/icons/priorities/major.svg,Major,5,https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/images/icons/statuses/resolved.png,"A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. [SAK-33127] XML/XPath library clarification,https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/browse/SAK-33127,10057,SAK,Sakai,"

Currently we depend on all of the following for XML handling:

Can someone clarify for me the need for all 4? Would narrowing to one XPath expression parser and one xml parser be beneficial? If this isn't possible, why?

",,27753,SAK-33127,XML/XPath library clarification,10007,https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/secure/viewavatar?size=medium&avatarId=10303&avatarType=issuetype,Bug,,,,6,https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/images/icons/statuses/closed.png,"The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.",Closed,3,done,green,10002,Non-Issue,-1,Unassigned,557058:14ff04b2-e7df-41c7-9c0f-61514b1706b5,Cannon Palms,"Fri, 13 May 2016 04:14:25 -0400","Mon, 14 Aug 2017 08:45:19 -0400",12.0,Gradebook,0,1,Development,customfield_10000,com.atlassian.jira.plugins.jira-development-integration-plugin:devsummarycf,Rank,0|10asa8:,customfield_10019,com.pyxis.greenhopper.jira:gh-lexo-rank,Sprint,customfield_10020,com.pyxis.greenhopper.jira:gh-sprint,"Mon, 3 Oct 2016 00:35:53 -0400",,,,,,,[CHART] Date of First Response,customfield_10024,com.atlassian.jira.ext.charting:firstresponsedate,,,,,,,,158868,557058:48227012-f9a6-40a4-97e6-94c8ef57f33e,"Fri, 13 May 2016 04:25:15 -0400","

Hi Cannon,

Yes, one parser would absolutely be beneficial. Sakai is a kernel + tools project so tool developers have the freedom to choose their own dependencies. If you were interested in consolidating these parsers, the contribution would definitely be appreciated, reviewed, and merged if solid.

",175517,557058:14ff04b2-e7df-41c7-9c0f-61514b1706b5,"Fri, 13 May 2016 06:05:53 -0400",

I was looking at a potential consolidation job. I have some time this weekend so I'll see what can be done.

,192181,557058:14ff04b2-e7df-41c7-9c0f-61514b1706b5,"Sat, 14 May 2016 10:14:44 -0400","

After some initial investigation, I'd like to create a few utils within the kernel to handle XML operations. Seeing as though hibernate requires dom4j, I think dropping jaxen in favor of dom4j for XPath support would be the best option. Any qualms there?

[SAK-39540] force.url.secure Default Override of 0 Fails,https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/browse/SAK-39540,10057,SAK,Sakai,"

The documentation states the following:
<pre># Force all URLs out of Sakai back to Sakai to be secure, i.e. to use HTTPS, on this port.
# Do not enable if you plan to respond with the same transport as the request.
# Otherwise, the URLs will reflect the attributes of the request URL. (443 | 8443 | or any other port)
# DEFAULT: no secure port or protocol (https) will be used, setting this to 0 will have the same effect as not setting it
When setting force.url.secure to 0, this results in links in the following format:

column2: • Click on a link, and go to null://HOST_ETC

column1: If a system like CAS is used, you are immediately taken to a null:// after logging in with a local account.
However, setting it force.url.secure to blank does have the intended affect. Resolution of this requires either:
// otherwise use the request scheme and port

column3: • Or changing the line here.

column1:
EDIT: Setting force.url.secure to blank does not work in RSF based tools and causes a NumberFormatException in this block of code.

Issues which are closed can be reopened.",Closed,3,done,green,10000,Fixed,6164d523048360006aaa2084,KERNEL TEAM,557058:484caead-d9ac-463d-bf51-f7c22821a458,Leonardo Canessa,"Thu, 12 May 2016 10:25:53 -0400","Wed, 25 Apr 2018 11:34:20 -0400",11.0,Kernel,0,3,11 status,customfield_10122,com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.customfieldtypes:select,Development,,customfield_10000,com.atlassian.jira.plugins.jira-development-integration-plugin:devsummarycf,Rank,customfield_10019,com.pyxis.greenhopper.jira:gh-lexo-rank,"Mon, 13 Jun 2016 11:43:55 -0400",,,,,,0|10920w:,Sprint,customfield_10020,com.pyxis.greenhopper.jira:gh-sprint,Test Plan,customfield_10038,com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.customfieldtypes:textarea,,,11.2,12.0,74260,557058:48227012-f9a6-40a4-97e6-94c8ef57f33e,"Fri, 13 May 2016 06:34:39 -0400","

What is the immediate issue you are trying to solve?

I would support removing this property from Sakai entirely. I don't think it successfully accomplishes its original goal. I believe the right way of telling Sakai that it is running on HTTPS is via conf/server.xml (X-Forwarded-Proto).

",107843,557058:484caead-d9ac-463d-bf51-f7c22821a458,"Fri, 13 May 2016 07:09:45 -0400","

Setup:
When attempting to login with a local account, the form action is set to http://domain. In order to prevent this security risk, we set force.url.secure=443 in our sakai.properties.

As I had no intention of setting up HTTPS on my dev box, I was attempting to override this property in my local.properties; first by setting it to 0, per the documentation (which was wrong as 0 caused Sakai to crap) and then to empty (which did not work in RSF based tools, at least not Site Info: Add Participants).

",124503,557058:48227012-f9a6-40a4-97e6-94c8ef57f33e,"Fri, 13 May 2016 07:14:11 -0400","

Okay your use case makes sense to me. In my experience, force.url.secure does not handle all URL creation. So I abandoned use of it in favor of the load-balancer telling Tomcat what the proper protocol is (X-Forwarded-Proto).

Does anyone else still use force.url.secure? Do you have any cases where you still see a non-HTTPS Sakai link when using force.url.secure=443 ?

",,,,,,,,,,,,141225,557058:cdae778f-fe7d-4a6d-9667-9be789e4fbee,"Fri, 13 May 2016 07:20:24 -0400","

We have this set on all three of our distributed environments at Western, all set to port 443. I don't believe we've seen any instances of non-HTTPS links with this setting. However, I'll ping my team members to see if they've come across this.

",157907,557058:484caead-d9ac-463d-bf51-f7c22821a458,"Fri, 13 May 2016 07:26:19 -0400",

We saw no cases of non-HTTPS links with the property set to 443 in our testing earlier this week.

[SAK-31200] forums open and close dates don't obey time zone,https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/browse/SAK-31200,10057,SAK,Sakai,"

In message center, area, forum and topic have open and close dates. They aren't converted to and from the current time zone.

When you look at the code, note that it's misleading. It reads an ISO dates from the browser. The looks like it's independent of time zone. The problem is that it depends upon the time zone setting of the browser, which we don't want. We want the date the user sees to depend upon their time zone setting in Sakai, not the browser.

In fact, while the ISO date is read, it's processed with a SimpleDateFormat that ignores the time zone. This is misleading, but correct.

[SAK-37275] Samigo 11 - Ordering Parts and Questions,https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/browse/SAK-37275,10057,SAK,Sakai,"

Faculty members at the University have been complaining about how Samigo 11 (which has been in production since Fall 2015 for us) handles ordering.
Every time questions/parts order are updated, changes do not relfect on the UI, numbers overlap onto themselves and get duplicated.

This contribution is to change the sorting mechanics. We have been using this patch since beginnings of Spring 2016 with great results. I will contribute it as a github Pull Request for consideration.

We removed the onchange form submit from the combo boxes of the questions/parts, in order to allow users to order their questions and parts as desired, for then to click on the ""Update Order"" button.
Questions will not overlap anymore. If two question have the same value, they will be either push forth/back respectively. The same applies for parts.

Git pull request: https://github.com/sakaiproject/sakai/pull/2535

[SAK-37330] Bullets do not display in question text,https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/browse/SAK-37330,10057,SAK,Sakai,"

When you create a bulleted (unordered) list in question text (or in answer text), the bullets do not display after the question is saved. Students also do not see the bullets when taking the assessment.
Note: Numbered (ordered) lists do display properly in assessment questions and answers.

column2: • As an instructor, create a new assessment using assessment builder.
• Insert a new question of any type, such as true/false, multiple choice, or short answer/essay.
• Near the ""question text"" area, click the link to show rich-text editor.
• Use ckeditor to create some question text containing a bulleted list. The bullets display fine here in ckeditor.

• Complete any required fields (such as marking correct answer) and save the question. This returns you to the screen that lists all questions on the test. Notice that no bullets are displayed for the question you just created. If you publish the test and take it as a student, you'll see that the bullets do not display to the student either.

column1:

[SAK-33107] GradebookNG doesn't scale grades when point value is changed.,https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/browse/SAK-33107,10057,SAK,Sakai,"

So here is a sample scenario

column2: • I make an assignment in the gradebook to be out of 10 points and enter all the student grades as out of 10 (so Jane gets an 8, Bobby gets a 7, etc)
• later I decide that assignment should actually have been out of 100 points
• when I change the assignment in GB2 to be worth out of 100, GB2 asks me “do you want to scale the grades""
• if I say yes, it will change Jane’s grade to an 80 and Bobby’s to a 70
• if I say no it leaves them as is

column1:
I believe this to be an important feature that should be implemented into GradebookNG.

",,62620,SAK-33107,GradebookNG doesn't scale grades when point value is changed.,10012,https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/secure/viewavatar?size=medium&avatarId=10315&avatarType=issuetype,Feature Request,10000,https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/images/icons/priorities/blocker.svg,Blocker,10025,https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/images/icons/statuses/generic.png,Indicates QA is complete and an issue has been tested and verified (Migrated on 12 Oct 2021 03:05 UTC),Verified,3,done,green,10000,Fixed,557058:c7ed084d-c59c-4475-8ab7-81e1908270f0,Steve Swinsburg,6164f3e464ff010071b8a44d,William Karavites,"Wed, 11 May 2016 08:24:20 -0400","Mon, 24 Jun 2019 10:38:45 -0400",12.0,Gradebook,7,5,12 status,customfield_10046,com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.customfieldtypes:select,Development,,customfield_10000,com.atlassian.jira.plugins.jira-development-integration-plugin:devsummarycf,Rank,customfield_10019,com.pyxis.greenhopper.jira:gh-lexo-rank,"Tue, 16 Oct 2018 15:27:57 -0400",,,,,,0|10as34:,Sprint,customfield_10020,com.pyxis.greenhopper.jira:gh-sprint,[CHART] Date of First Response,customfield_10024,com.atlassian.jira.ext.charting:firstresponsedate,,,12.6,19.0,58401,6164f3e464ff010071b8a44d,"Thu, 12 May 2016 05:24:16 -0400","

[SAK-31191] IMS Content Package Not Imported,https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/browse/SAK-31191,10057,SAK,Sakai,"

The following workflow produces an error.
Navigated to http://www.elml.org/website/en/html/output_cp.html and downloaded the attached Content Package.
1. Login to http://qa01-sakai.marist.edu:8080/portal as admin
2. Upload that package to Admin Resources Public, aka http://qa01-sakai.marist.edu:8080/access/content/public/gitta_ims.zip
3. Create a course site ""Gitta IMS Zip"", add an Instructor and a student.
4. In Admin Workspace, Site Archive tool, choose Site Archive tool, Import.
5. Specify file: http://qa01-sakai.marist.edu:8080/access/content/public/gitta_ims.zip and Site: Gitta IMS Zip""
Alert: import from file http://qa01-sakai.marist.edu:8080/access/content/public/gitta_ims.zip to site Gitta IMS Zip complete.

http://www.screencast.com/t/EJdQfkUpQVl
