[SAK-31189] Peer review: Allow students to regrade during the evaluation period,https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/browse/SAK-31189,10057,SAK,Sakai,"

During the peer review evaluation period, a student can submit an evaluation for a submission.After this has been submitted, there is no way to change the evaluation (as per the attached screenshot).
This is problematic especially in cases when a student may have erroneously graded a submission, and cannot rectify it.

The current workaround would be for the lecturer to remove the erroneous review. Then the student would need to email the lecturer the correct review. Lastly the lecturer would need to go back to the submission and regrade the submission based on the correct review.

Could students be allowed to edit/regrade the evaluations that they submitted?

",,53766,SAK-31189,Peer review: Allow students to regrade during the evaluation period,10012,https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/secure/viewavatar?size=medium&avatarId=10315&avatarType=issuetype,Feature Request,10002,https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/images/icons/priorities/major.svg,Major,5,https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/images/icons/statuses/resolved.png,"A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.",Resolved,3,done,green,10004,Incorporated,6164d8abc7bea400699b1b9e,Core Team,557058:73fbc38e-638f-4912-9e32-74cbd3858727,Sam Lee Pan,"Wed, 11 May 2016 02:59:56 -0400","Mon, 24 May 2021 09:33:55 -0400",11.0,Assignments,1,6,Development,customfield_10000,com.atlassian.jira.plugins.jira-development-integration-plugin:devsummarycf,Rank,0|1091xs:,customfield_10019,com.pyxis.greenhopper.jira:gh-lexo-rank,Sprint,customfield_10020,com.pyxis.greenhopper.jira:gh-sprint,"Mon, 24 May 2021 09:33:36 -0400",,,,,,,[CHART] Date of First Response,customfield_10024,com.atlassian.jira.ext.charting:firstresponsedate,[CHART] Time in Status,customfield_10025,com.atlassian.jira.ext.charting:timeinstatus,,,,,57467,557058:7074e357-325c-4f04-880f-321ecd7c7dc5,"Wed, 25 May 2016 06:02:54 -0400","

I agree it seems like an important issue, but I wonder if this is a feature request rather than a bug?

",91167,557058:73fbc38e-638f-4912-9e32-74cbd3858727,"Wed, 25 May 2016 20:39:43 -0400","

Neal Caidin, Thanks for the feedback. It is more likely a feature request.

",91868,557058:5e9b51e2-3d91-4079-943a-ed719d119ea1,"Wed, 21 Jun 2017 00:20:46 -0400","

on a student's peer review there's a Save and Submit button. I think if a student just hit Save then they could regrade, if they press Submit then the review is final.
Are you asking for there to effectively not be a Submit button - all reviews are modifiable up to the point where the peer review period closes?

I'm not sure about this. If there's an opportunity for a student to save a draft of their comments for editing later, then isnt that sufficient? If not then perhaps we just remove the Submit button - that way all comments / grades are changeable.
If we're going to keep both buttons then the save button could be renamed as ""Save As Draft"" and the submit button at ""Publish"" - this would be more in line with other tools (I think).

","Wed, 25 May 2016 10:02:54 +0000",Incorporate,,,,10006,41866,Submitted evaluations cannot be changed.JPG,24448,ug:6495821f-27a2-474c-9b6d-d2b347ba1f3f,"Wed, 11 May 2016 02:51:34 -0400",141969,557058:5e9b51e2-3d91-4079-943a-ed719d119ea1,"Thu, 22 Jun 2017 02:19:01 -0400",

i'm going to open up this discussion to the Sakai -User mail list

,125272,557058:73fbc38e-638f-4912-9e32-74cbd3858727,"Thu, 13 Jul 2017 07:20:01 -0400","

Thanks Adam Marshall, looking forward to the community's feedback. From T+L perspective I think the reviews should be modifiable up until the peer review period closes, so perhaps just a Save option then.

",108613,557058:5e9b51e2-3d91-4079-943a-ed719d119ea1,"Mon, 17 Jul 2017 06:01:18 -0400","

Christina Schwiebert
We have had some of those instances, and in those cases a separate ""save as draft"" and ""submit/publish"" option would not necessarily solve the problem.

In many cases, the reviewer believed they had everything correct. They would have hit the submit button. Then, 5 seconds later, they realize they uploaded the wrong file - especially in cases where they had to review two or more peers. I believe there needs to be a way for the reviewer to change the reviews up to the peer review due date or the instructor to clear out a review and allow a re-submission from the reviewer.

",175863,70121:67ef3951-7fb4-425d-a32f-b30c34436361,"Fri, 6 Oct 2017 10:28:50 -0400","

This jira was discussed during the Apereo Teaching & Learning Group's jirapalooza on 10/4/17. The group agreed that it would be desirable for students to be able to modify their peer assessments prior to the end of the assessment period, although there may need to be further discussion about when/how long peer assessments may be modified.

[SAK-37410] Lesson Tool - Add Question Function Request,https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/browse/SAK-37410,10057,SAK,Sakai,"

In working with the Add Question function in Lessons, it was discovered that faculty/designers are unable to sync an existing gradebook item to a lesson question. Faculty and Designers are required to follow these steps to sync to the Sakai gradebook:

column2: • In Lessons the user selects the Add Question function
• User adds the question title in the gradebook
• User adds point value to the question

column1: What if the gradebook was created prior to developing a Lesson? As a result of this current flow, there is the possibility that there would be duplicate items in the gradebook.

I am requesting that when using the Add Question function in Lessons, there is a way for faculty and designers to navigate to pre-existing gradebook items. In addition, if the gradebook already exists, there should be a way to select which assignment category this question would fall under (this is only applicable if a category is present in the gradebook).
Attached is an image that helps to visualize the request.

column2: • If the user selects Add to Gradebook, then a new gradebook item will be created once Update Item has been selected.
• If the user selects Add to Gradebook on initial setup, this button should appear transparent and not be clickable the next time the item is edited.
• If the user selects the drop down Select a gradebook item, then display available items in gradebook.
• If the user selects the drop down Select a gradebook item, then the title, points and assignment category should auto-populate.

column1:
",,36444,SAK-37410,Lesson Tool - Add Question Function Request,10012,https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/secure/viewavatar?size=medium&avatarId=10315&avatarType=issuetype,Feature Request,10003,https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/images/icons/priorities/minor.svg,Minor,10000,https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/images/icons/statuses/generic.png,"Issue has been created but has not yet been reviewed and validated, should not be worked on yet (Migrated on 12 Oct 2021 03:05 UTC)",Awaiting Review,2,new,blue-gray,-1,Unresolved,6164d3a564ff010071b75c26,Charles Hedrick,6164e22ac5388b0069db3318,Michael Dillon,"Tue, 10 May 2016 11:50:27 -0400","Wed, 18 Apr 2018 03:24:05 -0400",10.5,Lessons,0,5,Development,customfield_10000,com.atlassian.jira.plugins.jira-development-integration-plugin:devsummarycf,Rank,0|1091ww:,customfield_10019,com.pyxis.greenhopper.jira:gh-lexo-rank,Sprint,customfield_10020,com.pyxis.greenhopper.jira:gh-sprint,,,,,,,,[CHART] Date of First Response,customfield_10024,com.atlassian.jira.ext.charting:firstresponsedate,,,,,,,,40931,557058:8214380d-0bd8-4eec-9d5a-cff0db82aa8e,"Fri, 3 Feb 2017 07:46:52 -0500","

Please don't add this feature! Let's keep the tool simple.
Our new instructors are constantly adding gradebook items for assignments and quizzes, then go to assignments and quizzes, and either
1) Try to add a new gradebook item with the same gradebook item name for the assignments and quizzes (which doesn't work well), or
2) They forget to associate the test/assignment with the gradebook item they created earlier (which causes grades to languish in the tool, never reaching the gradebook).

This tool is working the way tests & quizzes and assignments should always act, as well as the way student content acts-when you create the activity, you generate the gradebook item.

",74759,6164e22ac5388b0069db3318,"Fri, 3 Feb 2017 08:05:34 -0500","

Perhaps our faculty are a little different than your group. Ultimately, we highly encourage faculty to set up the gradebook first so that when they are creating assignments/test & quizzes, they are able to associate with the the item that is pre-existing. Essentially, what this request is asking for is a way to associate knowledge checks to pre-existing gradebook options. This will not add any additional confusion for faculty in theory, it is just adding additional functionality to those who want it. I suppose a way to compromise on this could be to use a ""Basic"" and ""Advanced"" tab so that faculty/designers can chose which method they wish to proceed with. Any thoughts on this Rebekah Roehrs?

",158438,70121:dc225bf0-653d-431b-9fde-49f2103d9461,"Thu, 16 Feb 2017 10:18:29 -0500","

I'll add in my two cents about this feature - we've loved the Question Feature, but the issue we've run into is where the question feature is being used as a required item on a page. If a student doesn't answer or engage with the question at all, there's no way to assign them a zero point valuation. UNLESS you use the ""GIVE ALL NULL ENTRIES a ZERO"" feature of the gradebook. So, in light of Rebekah Roehrs comment, having the function of adding a gradebook item and linking it, WOULD ALLOW instructors to place a zero w/o making the entire gradebook suffer. Thanks!

","Fri, 3 Feb 2017 12:46:52 +0000",,,,,,22671,Add-existing-gradebook-option.jpg,107684,ug:75acc36f-f6fb-4a91-96a0-a34186099ee9,"Tue, 10 May 2016 11:48:18 -0400",175122,557058:f40ed6cf-0104-4dc6-88be-9f2bbc0cae39,"Wed, 15 Mar 2017 04:51:10 -0400","

If we do allow the question grade to be linked to an existing grade item in the gradebook, let's follow the lead of the Assignments tool, which presents the instructor with a dropdown list of existing grade items to link to.

The more like other tools this function is, the more intuitive the function will seem to our users. And this is pretty intuitive.

",41024,557058:8214380d-0bd8-4eec-9d5a-cff0db82aa8e,"Wed, 15 Mar 2017 07:54:23 -0400","

I agree with @Laura Cira (and @Michael Dillon), it makes sense to make the Grading option for this tool the same as Assignments:
1) Do not add assignment to Gradebook,
3) Associate with existing Gradebook item, and provide a drop-down list of available Gradebook items

[SAK-38945] Update hikaricp to 2.4.6,https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/browse/SAK-38945,10057,SAK,Sakai,"

I've seen this issue randomly locally against a MariaDB database, often when I haven't used my local dev for awhile.
<pre>java.sql.SQLTransientConnectionException: sakai - Connection is not available, request timed out after 30001ms
But people are reporting it also against Oracle and MySQL in HikariCP versions 2.4.3 to 2.4.5.

According to the comment here there are stability improvements and improved logging in the latest version. Just changing it locally started it right up where the other version kept hanging on startup for me.

[SAK-31184] Improvements to the Feedback Tool,https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/browse/SAK-31184,10057,SAK,Sakai,"

EDIT: Currently the feedback tool's panels are the content panel, the helpdesk panel, the technical panel, and the suggestions panel. The helpdesk / technical panel are the same form to the same email address. The Suggestions panel is an external link.
The following improvements to the feedback tool are suggested:

column2: • The addition of two hidden optional panels
<li>Icons for each panel are now backed by a bundle (allowing for live configuration of each panel's icon) which ends in ""_no_translate"". Specifically the bundles are:
• Each bundle is the Font Awesome class name to be used
<li>The ability for each panel (except the content panel) to be an email form or a web link

column3: <li>If a panel is an email Form, the ability to have a link in it's instruction

column1: in the apropriate instruction's bundle (that is ask_instruction, for example)

column2: • The ability for the Help Desk to have it's own configured name within the helpdesk_instruction bundle

column3: • Improve spacing between each panel's bullet points
• Link at the bottom of the panel is now centered and forced to the bottom
• Improved alignment of icon to the header text
• Header text now has it's own space (so the explanation of each panel now starts on the same line
• Hide the ""Your email name:"" section if logged in in the email forms

column1: Fully Configured (all panels to emailForms - customs excluded from PR are noted):
The following sakai properties have been added:
# Recipient address that will receive emails from the help panel
# If using an external link, include the https:// portion
# Configure the address to send Suggestions to
# The following three properties allow a panel to be a link
# If the property is TRUE, that panel will have a link to a URL at the bottom
# If the property is FALSE, that panel will link to an email Form
# If true, uses feedback.helpdeskUrl as the link
# If false, uses feedback.helpAddress as email. Also, may use feedback.helpdeskUrl
#   in the instructions of the email form.
# If true, uses feedback.technicalUrl as the link
# If false, uses feedback.technicalAddress for email destination. May use feedback.technicalUrl
#   in the instructions of the email form
# If true, uses feedback.featureSuggestionUrl as the link
# If false, uses feedback.suggestionsAddress as email destination. May use feedback.featureSuggestionUrl
#   in the instructions of the email form
# These are two supplemental panels administrators may use for linking to additional
# If true, the panel will be a link to a url (feedback.supplementalAUrl)
# If false, the panel will be am email form (feedback.supplementalAAddress). May use
#   feedback.supplementalAUrl in the email form instructions.
# If using an external link, include the https:// portion
# If true, the panel will be a link to a url (feedback.supplementalBUrl)
# If false, the panel will be am email form (feedback.supplementalBAddress). May use
#   feedback.supplementalBUrl in the email form instructions
# If using an external link, include the https:// portion
The defaults have been maintained to allow for similar behavior to the current feedback tool.
If you previously had the feedback_tool installed the following MySQL command will need to be run (if you want to move away from the default config):
ALTER TABLE master.sakai_feedback MODIFY COLUMN report_type ENUM('suggestions', 'supplementala', 'supplementalb');

If you are on Oracle, you will need to make a new table with a new check constraint in place and copy the data from sakai_feedback into it.

[SAK-31181] GradebookNG: xmlbeans 2.6.0 & Poi,https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/browse/SAK-31181,10057,SAK,Sakai,"

Changes in V2.6.0 since V2.5.0
Add new xml option CopyUseNewSynchronizationDomain used for copy.
This fixes the scenario when copy and access (ex. selectPath) are used
Entitize \r when not in pretty print, this helps with maintainig \r
Fix validation of integer value containing dot char.
Fix chars in comments to avoid errors in IntelliJ under linux.
Fix for compiling schema that contains complex type with simple
content that has facets defined in the base simple type
Fix for Piccolo lexer when read method returns 0.
Fix to preserve the CDATA bookmarks when copy from one xmlobject to
Fix bug when resizing circular buffer in saver's output stream
Fix for bug when not specifing type for a particle in derived schema
Fixed error messages when contain base and derived type names.
Introducing a default maximum entity replacement limit of 10kb, it can
be controled by using the option XmlOptions.setLoadEntityBytesLimit.
Fixed javadoc for inst2xsd and xsd2inst tools.
Added multiple entry points and refactored code for xsd2inst code.
Add another xpath and xquery interface implementation.
Make bootstrap run twice to avoid GUMP error emails.
Fix for bug XMLBEANS-396: GML 3.1.1 generated code fails to compile.
Fix for bug XMLBEANS-412: Pattern facet regex requires dash - to be
Fix for bug XMLBEANS-414: error cvc-complex-type.2.1: Element 'XXXX'
with empty content type cannot have text or element content.
Decimal precision handling fix in xsd2inst
Option to perform additional, stricter Schema validation checks: XMLBEANS-350
Support for date and time types with hour 24.
DocType fix when root element is changed
""User types"" feature - allows mapping of Schema simple types to custom user Java classes
Nested enumeration type compilation error fix: XMLBEANS-381
Deadlock fix in generated impl setter simple and array
Required attribute fix in streaming validator
Added Schema compilation option to skip errors in case duplicate component declarations are encountered.
Tool to generate XPath for a given cursor position in a document
added more fine-grained control over XML to Java name mapping
Fix for XMLBEANS-309 Warnings on Generated code
Fix for XMLBEANS-361 invalid NaN comparisons
Fix qname marshaling when empty namespace
Improved Saxon support, Saxon 8.8 became the recommended version
Added options to control use of CDATA sections when saving to XML
Added support for QNames in Schema annotations
Added support for new encodings: UTF-16LE, UTF-16BE, CP936/GBK.
Fix: overzealous whitespace cropping after parsing entities like & (XMLBEANS-274)
Fix: selectPath() with setXqueryCurrentNodeVar() option does not work for Saxon (XMLBEANS-276)
Fix: synchronization problem with array setters
Fix: QNameSet generated by QNameSet.forArray(QName[]) can't be unioned with other QNameSets (XMLBEANS-290)
Fix: XQuery gives wrong result with Saxon 8.6.1 (XMLBEANS-275)
Fix: bug during generation of complex types with simple content
Fix: improved error handling during loading of Schema type system

Fix: Remove year zero from GDate, GDateBuilder and XmlCalendar per XMLSchema spec D.3.2

[SAK-36976] Double precision sum trouble leads to wrong score intervals,https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/browse/SAK-36976,10057,SAK,Sakai,"

Steps to reproduce the issue:
1. Import the attached ""Assessment.zip"": The assessment has 4 questions that are worth 1.4, 1.6, 1.8 and 5.2 (they sum 10 points).
3. Submit the assessment several times as diferent students:

column2: • One of the submissions should get an score lower than 10 points.
• All other submissions should get an score of 10 points.

column1: After several submissions, some students will get an score of 10.000001 instead of 10 points. This leads to an extra interval as you can see in this image.

This extra interval appears because some students have got 10.00001 instead of 10 points. The maximum points allowed are 10 points.

[SAK-31178] Messages Tool: Subject of "read" messages remains bold (appearing unread),https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/browse/SAK-31178,10057,SAK,Sakai,"

BUG TYPE:
Subject"" in a message in the Messages tool remains bold when marked as ""read.""

Some professors and staff at our institution have expressed that they can become confused on which messages are read or unread since the subject of the message always remains bold no matter the state of the message. Is there a reason why after reading a message in the Messages tool that the subject remains bold (rather than normal style)?
1. Add ""Messages"" tool to a project or course site.
2. Enroll at least one other user with any role.
4. Send a message to the other user.

5. Log in as other user, go to Received, click the new message to read it, return. You'll see that the ""subject"" remains bold, but the ""Authored by"" and ""Date"" are normal text since it's been read.

Since there isn't a visual indication of ""read"" vs. ""unread"" (iOS Mail app has a blue dot for unread messages, for example), the expectation, similar to how Gmail and other web email services work, is for the subject to mirror the other elements by not being bold when a message is read. (The general thought is to reserve the emphasis for unread messages.)

1.) Is there a reason why the ""subject"" of a message remains bold after a message has been read? Is this a ""standards"" situation where it is inheriting that since it's a link and therefore must be bold?

2.) If subject must remain bold for a specific technical or UX/UI reason, should a visual cue, like a blue dot in Apple Mail, be added to highlight unread messages? Any visual image would have an ALT tag or element for appropriate accessibility reasons. (There is a visual image for ""Already replied,"" so this seems doable.)
3.) If subject can simply be made normal weight (but still blue as hyperlink), this may help address any user confusion.
Feels like a bug to some of our users (forgot to ""un-bold"" the subject or some CSS inheritance issue). Marked this as ""minor,"" since it's not blocking core functionality.

Thank you for your review and consideration.

[SAK-31175] Box Integration,https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/browse/SAK-31175,10057,SAK,Sakai,"

I think it would be cool to see an option to integrate with Box in the resources tool.

Duke, for example, provides all students and faculty with 50 GB of storage on Box. Being able to sync with Box folders or import would make setting up a course really easy. How extensively has this been considered? Creating optional integrations with other cloud-services could be an attractive feature.
The Box API is very straightforward and could possibly be integrated with the cloud-content tool easily.

https://box-content.readme.io/docs/the-box-file-picker

[SAK-31167] Students can't open Assignment link in Announcements in FireFox,https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/browse/SAK-31167,10057,SAK,Sakai,"

After an assignment was created, I could see it listed in Announcements when viewing as a student, and it seemed to have a link. However, when I clicked on it, nothing happened. I tried the same process in Chrome, and I was able to click through and access the assignment.
#As Instructor, create an assignment in a course and have it show in Announcements.
#As a Student enrolled in that same course, using FireFox, go to Announcements and look for the assignment.
#Click on the link to the assignment.

#If nothing happens, you're looking at the same bug as me.

","FireFox (Mac)

[SAK-31164] Allow the Sakai logo to be a link to the !gateway page - configurable by a property,https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/browse/SAK-31164,10057,SAK,Sakai,"

Define a Sakai property ""portal.logo.active"" (set to false by default)
When set to true it would make the Sakai logo clickable and it should take the user to ""/portal"".
This may result in code like the following although you may need to find out exactly how it should be done.

https://trunk-mysql.nightly.sakaiproject.org/portal/

column2: • (AddMeeting.png) - the screen is responsive but there are check boxes and radio buttons that align incorrectly. The scrolling box for the time slot settings is difficult to maneuver
• (CustomTimeslots.png) - this page is not responsive and has some padding issues
• (MeetingsList2.png) - there is an extra space at the top of the list here and in Export Meetings

• (MeetingsSummary.png) - the screen is responsive but having the whole page move in a box is really challenging to navigate. Is there any other way to make this responsive? Same issue with Permissions and Meeting Details

column1: Since there are several important changes in this JIRA i´m going to verify this one and open a new ticket for the issues you reported

column2: • (AddMeeting.png): New JIRA for the checkboxes, radio buttons problem https://jira.sakaiproject.org/browse/SAK-31213

column1: We are not dealing with the slot settings for the moment.

column2: • (CustomTimeslots.png) : New JIRA for this issue https://jira.sakaiproject.org/browse/SAK-31214
• (MeetingsList2.png) : New JIRA for this issue https://jira.sakaiproject.org/browse/SAK-31215
• (MeetingsSummary.png): This screen is displayed in an HTML table so, for the moment, we are not addressing this problem
• (ModifyMeetings2.png): New JIRA for this issue, same as (AddMeeting.png) https://jira.sakaiproject.org/browse/SAK-31213

[SAK-31154] Missing Alt Text for Class Roster Images,https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/browse/SAK-31154,10057,SAK,Sakai,"

In the instructor view, when the side navigation tab labeled 'Roster' is clicked, the instructor can view a list of students in the course, and there is an image associated with each student. All of the student photos are missing alt tags. Right now, the roster picture looks like this
<img class= ""rosterPicture"" src=""/direct/profile/2f407e93-1a0f"" title=""Photo of Dept Admin"">
It should have an alt tag that includes the important information included in the title, so it should look like this

[SAK-32808] TA view - when TA does not have access to view final course grade, do not show green "Update" highlight for course grade and include a lock icon,https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/browse/SAK-32808,10057,SAK,Sakai,"

Currently, when a TA does not have the ability to view the final course grade, a dash appears in the Course Grade column. However, as they enter scores, the Course Grade cell will still highlight green, with the dash persisting.

To prevent confusion, the course grade cells should not flash green when the TA does not have the ability to view the final course grade. Additionally, lock icons should display in all course grade cells.

The popover message could say something along the lines of ""You do not have viewing permissions for the course grade"".

",,36683,SAK-32808,"TA view - when TA does not have access to view final course grade, do not show green ""Update"" highlight for course grade and include a lock icon",10007,https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/secure/viewavatar?size=medium&avatarId=10303&avatarType=issuetype,Bug,,,,6,https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/images/icons/statuses/closed.png,"The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. [SAK-31150] Clicking on full details link for external calendar item in synoptic calendar leads to site unavailable,https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/browse/SAK-31150,10057,SAK,Sakai,"<ol>

column2: • In a site's calendar, subscribe to an institutional calendar via the Merge External Calendars tab (see https://jira.sakaiproject.org/browse/SAK-12852)

column3: • See the calendar.external.subscriptions.* properties in https://qa11-oracle.nightly.sakaiproject.org/sakai/sakai.properties

column2: • From the Home tool in the site, click on the day of an external event in the synoptic calendar
<li>You should see the event, and there should be a link. Visit the link.

column3: • Note: the data provided in https://weblearn.ox.ac.uk/access/content/public/misc/oxdate.ics does not appear to have text for the link, so you will have to use your browser's developer tools to edit the html and provide text for the link. The link appears between ""Academic Calendar -"" and ""(worksite)"".

column4: • Perhaps a separate ticket should be created to put the event's full title in the place of this link if ""event.truncatedDisplayName"" is empty.

column2: • Now there should be a link that says ""Full Details"". Clicking this link will take you to ""Site Unavailable""

column1:

[SAK-31149] Clicking "Add a Category" unnecessarily takes user to top of page,https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/browse/SAK-31149,10057,SAK,Sakai,"

1. Sign in as Instructor and select a site
2. Select the ""Gradebook"" tab on the left hand column
5. Under the list of categories, click ""Add a Category"".

This creates a new category but also takes the user to the top of the page. A person using this button most likely wants to fill out the information for the category after creating a new one, so it is unnecessary and inconvenient to direct the user to the top of the page.

",,,,,"Fri, 6 May 2016 09:23:58 +0000",,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,12.0,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,

[SAK-37453] Restrict editing of Lessons pages and subpages to one person,https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/browse/SAK-37453,10057,SAK,Sakai,"

The problem: At present, anyone with the ""lessons update"" permission can edit any Lessons page or subpage. An unaware author could inadvertently edit something they shouldn't, e.g. on home page Lessons tool.
After some discussion at Oxford, we came up with some more requirements for this 'Owned Pages' Jira.
The suggestion behind the specific solution here is not add or edit Lessons permissions but for the user to remove update permissions and then assign an owner to the relevant Lessons page.
In general this uses as much of Neelam's (the original person who worked on this Jira but isn't anymore) code as possible and Charles's Jira and Github comments.

column2: • We will have a drop down of potential owners (in Settings dialog) (which are people who don't have the Lesson update permissions) (and then there might be many potential owners and we can see how performance/UI issues go and change it if necessary) - you pick an owner and click Save and it saves it.
• If you create a subpage, then the subpage inherits the owner of the parent page regardless of who the creator of the subpage is.

• The owner of the page should be displayed somewhere. Show ""the owner name shown both on the super-page after the title of the subpage and on the page itself. Probably not for students, but at least for the site owner and probably for the page owner."" (from Chuck's github comments).
• If you reuse a page and attach to another owned page, then the owner of the reused page does not change.

• We will say who is in the list above the drop down of owners, .e.g., something like 'Ownership of this page can be assigned to any site participant who do not have the Lessons tool ‘update’ permission” (see “Permissions” link in the “More Tools” menu).'.
• There will be no multiple owners or internal subgroups as possible owners.
• If you can't update the page, because you're not the owner or have the correct rights, you shouldn't get any of the menu tools
• Updating an owner does not affect the owner of any other page. (i.e., no cascading ownerships for either new or existing pages).
• An owner of a page can change the owner of that page or any page because they are the owner.
• Top level pages can have owners as well as subpages.
• The logic for who can edit the page is: you can edit it if you are either the owner or have Lessons update permssions.
• We wouldn't initially provide a method of changing the owner of more than one page at once.

column1:

From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.",Resolved,3,done,green,10000,Fixed,6164f940071a720071a765f3,Nick Wilson,6164f496c669a60069cc6981,Neelam Bhandari,"Thu, 5 May 2016 06:02:12 -0400","Tue, 21 Aug 2018 10:54:29 -0400",11.0,Lessons,1,10,Development,customfield_10000,com.atlassian.jira.plugins.jira-development-integration-plugin:devsummarycf,Rank,0|1091k8:,customfield_10019,com.pyxis.greenhopper.jira:gh-lexo-rank,Sprint,customfield_10020,com.pyxis.greenhopper.jira:gh-sprint,"Thu, 29 Jun 2017 01:05:40 -0400",,,,,,,Test Plan,customfield_10038,com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.customfieldtypes:textarea,[CHART] Date of First Response,customfield_10024,com.atlassian.jira.ext.charting:firstresponsedate,,,12.0,,141192,6164d3a564ff010071b75c26,"Thu, 5 May 2016 07:21:56 -0400","

I don't think you need separate permissions for edit own and delete own. That's built into the concept of owner. It makes no sense for someone to own a page and not be able to edit it. The only thing new you need is the ability to make someone the owner of a page. Note by the way that the permissions model also permits a group to own a page. Then anyone in the group can modify it. Since you can create a group that is defined by members of a role, that would also let a hierarchy of pages by owned by everyone in a role.

",91100,6164f496c669a60069cc6981,"Thu, 5 May 2016 23:14:53 -0400",

Isn't in lessons only student pages have owner and all the other pages(top lessons page &subpages) do not have owner?

,141197,6164d3a564ff010071b75c26,"Fri, 6 May 2016 05:19:59 -0400","

Right. The idea is that you add to the page settings dialog an option to define an owner for the page. The option should allow selection of any user or group in the site. That should do it. You won't need an additional permission edit-own. That's implied by being the owner. As long as they're owner or in the group that is the owner, that does what you need. We might want to add a permission change-owner. I'm not sure whether other institutions would want people to be able to do this. Or it could be enabled in sakai.properties. But I can see uses for it other than yours, so I'm not sure restricting it is necessary.

","

1. Show dropdown and message: As a maintainer on a site, create a Lessons tool, click the Settings cog and check there is a dropdown of owners at the bottom and check that the message above the dropdown says 'Ownership of this page can be assigned to any site participant who does not have the Lessons tool update permission (see Permissions link in the More Tools menu).'

2. Show correct label & initial owner: Label should say ""Set owner to:"". Check the owner dropdown initially shows 'None'. Click Cancel. Open Settings again. Check the owner dropdown still shows 'None' as the owner.

3. Dropdown has correct list: Check the dropdown list contains only those site members who do not have Lessons update permissions, i.e, check that there are no non-site members there, or site members there who have lessons update permissions or who are listed twice and check that every site member who does not have update permissions is listed.

4. Saving an owner: Select one of the members in the list and click Save. Check that the owner you chose is showing in brackets on the super page after the page title. Open Settings dialog again and check that the owner you chose is shown/selected at the top of the dropdown and that the other members who were there are also in the drop down (with 'None' at the bottom of the list).

5. Changing owner: Add a sub page. Select one of the other members in the list as the owner of the subpage and click Save. Check that the owner you chose is showing in brackets on the super page after the page title of the subpage. Open Settings dialog and check that the owner you chose is shown/selected at the top of the dropdown and that the other members who were there are also in the drop down.

6. Unsetting owner: Select 'None' in the list of owners for a subpage and click Save. Open Settings dialog and check that 'None' is shown/selected at the top of the dropdown and that no owner is displayed after the title and that the other members who were there are also in the drop down. Do the same for the top level page.
7. a. Display owner on page after saving: Change the owner on the top level page. Check that the owner you chose is showing in brackets on the super page after the page title.
b. Display owner on page after saving: Unset the owner. Check that the owner is no longer shown.

8. a. Display owners of subpages: (As a site maintainer still), create a top level page owned by owner A and 3 subpages a, b, c, owned by A, B, noone respectively. Go the top level and check you see all the owners of the subpages next to their links and that you cannot see anything next to subpage c with no owner.
b. Display owners of subpages: :Unset the owners for the subpages. Check that the owners are no longer shown in brackets to the right of the subpages. (Put the owners back again.)

9. a. Display owners to correct people: Become user A and go to the top level page and check you can see the owner in brackets displayed in the superpage and owners A and B next to subpage links for a and b (You can see who owner B is because owner A owns the page on which this link is).

b. Become owner B and go to the top level Lesson page and check you cannot see the owner at the top of the superpage and that you can only see owner B next to subpage b. Owners can always see which pages they are owners of, even if they do not own the current page or have update permissions.
10. a. Who can edit a page: As a site maintainer, check that you have the menu bar for the top level page and all 3 subpages a, b and c.
b. Change the owner of the top level page to owner A and become that owner. Check that you have the menu bar for the top level page, and for subpage a but not for subpages b or c.

c. Become owner B and go to the top level Lesson page and check you cannot see the menu bar for the top level page or for subpage a or the unowned page, but that you can for subpage b )whihc is owned by owner B).
d. As the owner of a page, create a subpage and give it no owner and check you do not have the menu bar (because you are not the owner).

11. a. Changing owner (special cases): If a user is made owner and in the meantime stops being a member of the site, then we will still show the owner in the list of owners (at the top) but we won't allow it to save, saying 'XXX cannot be the owner of this page as they are not a member of the site.'

b. If a user is made owner and is still a member of the site but is then given update permissions (e.g., access -> maintainer), then they should still appear in the drop down list and it should be possible to save them as an owner.

c. Using the Lessons structure above, become owner A. Then change the owner to somebody else and you should no longer be able to see the (new) owner displayed on the superpage anymore (because you are not that owner) and you should no longer be able to see the owner of subpage b (as you are not the owner of the top level page anymore).

12. Sub page creation inherits owner: From the top level page, make sure that page has an owner, and create a subpage. Go into that subpage and check the owner is the same owner as that of the top level page.
13. No cascading ownership: Check that updating an owner does not affect the owner of any other page. (i.e., no cascading ownerships for either new or existing pages).
14. Which page have owners: Top level pages can have owners as well as subpages. Add an owner to a top level page as well as an owner to a subpage.
15. Bulk ownership change: We wouldn't initially provide a method of changing the owner of more than one page at once.

16. a. Shared pages: Create a subpage and give it an owner. Then go to another lessons tool and import that page as a Shared Page (Add Subpage → Choose Existing Page). Check that the owner of that shared page has not changed, i.e., that the same onwer shows in both places where the shared page appears.
b. As a non-owner, non-update user of the site, go the place where you imported the shared page. You should not be able to change the owner.
17. Multiple owners: There will be no multiple owners or internal subgroups as possible owners.
18. Student pages: Because the notion of ownership has changed, do some regression on student pages but otherwise student pages have not changed functionally.

19. Click on Permissions at top level of Lessons. Check 1st row label says “Update all pages or items” & second row label says “Read and update own pages or items”. Check “Unless specifically set on a page-by-page basis in Settings, pages are not owned by individual users.” appears before the undo changes button in the blue header.

we will be having an extra new permission ‘can use all tools on my pages’ in the permissions section which will help in the display of all options for the users(tutors) with this permission.
Option in the preferences dialog to change ownership of a page to a user or group.

Thanks Charles for your help.

",40410,6164d3a564ff010071b75c26,"Fri, 6 May 2016 05:44:52 -0400","

that's one possible implementation. Another is to say that if it isn't a student page but has an owner, you can automatically use all tools.

",91106,6164f496c669a60069cc6981,"Fri, 6 May 2016 06:00:19 -0400",

Is there any other way in Lessons to find if a page is a student page? Because I was under this impression that the pages with the owner are student pages

,40411,6164d3a564ff010071b75c26,"Fri, 6 May 2016 06:48:50 -0400","

At the moment code assumes that anything with an owner is a student page. However in most cases that's just fine. Almost all the tests have to do with permissions, and will work fine. The only place we need to differentiate is when deciding whether to show all tools as options.

If that is null, you don't have a student page. You'll need to test carefully, but I think that will work. There are other features associated with student pages, such as the ability to grade them and force comments to be on them. In most cases I think those will be harmless in your situation as they won't show up. However it's possible that the code will give null pointer errors in some places if findStudentPage fails. If you see such a null pointer exception you can probably just make sure that if getStudentPage fails the page is treated as a normal page. It might be worth checking for all calls to findStudentPage rather than waiting for null pointer exceptions to show up.

The other option is to add a boolean to StudentPage indicating whether it's a student page. Then some of the owner != null checks will change to isStudentPage. It's a matter of taste which is better, and maybe a matter of how many places produce null pointers and have to be fixed.

",124481,557058:5e9b51e2-3d91-4079-943a-ed719d119ea1,"Mon, 9 May 2016 00:46:41 -0400","

There needs to be a way to unset an owner, the scenario here is that one may accidentally assign ownership of the wrong page and then need to reverse the modification.

",,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,26056,633-2.png,19319,ug:329a6498-8cd1-4162-9c2e-c10d85755fe4,"Tue, 14 Feb 2017 00:12:29 -0500",26074,RemovePageStackTrace.png,145426,ug:06ab9fd9-cd75-4bd4-8fbe-1f304c81aa70,"Fri, 17 Mar 2017 06:22:55 -0400",,,,,,,"Thu, 5 May 2016 11:21:56 +0000",[CHART] Time in Status,customfield_10025,com.atlassian.jira.ext.charting:timeinstatus,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,124482,6164d3a564ff010071b75c26,"Mon, 9 May 2016 03:05:27 -0400","

I agree. The same dialogue that sets the owner should be able to clear it. The lessons dialogs typically have check or radio controls and then text. I'd have an owner section. Uncheck it to clear the owner. Remember that you'll need two owner options, user and group. Use the standard group code that is used in all the dialogs.

",141205,6164d3a564ff010071b75c26,"Mon, 9 May 2016 04:09:48 -0400","

Note that removing ownership or changing it is more complex than it might sound.

The current code says that if there's an owner for the page, and new subpages get the same owner. So what happens if you add an owner to a page that has existing subpages, or remove an owner from pages with existing subpages?

Do we recursively change the owner for all subpages? This could be dangerous. In some of course designs there are common tutorials that you can refer to from several places. If that's been done, you don't want to change ownership for them. It's even worse if at any point in a set of pages and subpages one points back to the top level. A recursive change could get the whole site.

The safest UI would be that for changing ownership whether adding or removing owner, there's a popup: ""change ownership for this page only or multiple pages?"" If they pick multiple pages you give them the page picker and let them click next to the pages they want to change. For changing an existing owner (either to a new owner or removing ownership) that page picker should probably grey out that pages that don't have the current owner.

",,,,,107880,6164f496c669a60069cc6981,"Thu, 26 May 2016 02:23:09 -0400","

Hi Charles,

Question : dao.findStudentPage(page.getTopParent()) how can this check if a page is a student page? As per the code, all the subpages and student(all subpages) pages shares the same 'topParent' value.
Also if I use 'findStudentPageByPageId' this holds true only for the top StudentPages and not for the sub-pages on this student page.

Should I add a new column 'isStudentPage' in the lesson_builder_pages table?

",124539,6164d3a564ff010071b75c26,"Thu, 26 May 2016 04:18:22 -0400","

StudentPage is a separate object from Page. There's one StudentPage for the whole hierarchy of pages for one student. All the student pages point to the top-level Page with topParent. StudentPage is indexed by the pageId of that top-level Page. StudentPage is used to hold some data that applies to the whole hierarchy.

Logically, all the student pages in a hierarchy should point directly to the StudentPage object. The problem is that the topParent field is a pageId, not the ID of a StudentPage. So instead it points to the top-level Page, and from that you can get the StudentPage.
Your pages won't be student pages, and won't have StudentPage entries. They'll be normal pages with an owner.

Some of this is historical. The whole is of parent really turned out not to make sense, because the pages form a general graph. A page doesn't necessarily have a unique parent. There's code that depends upon whether parent is null, and this code that uses topParent, but mostly the parent and topParent aren't used anymore. I'd reorganize things if it didn't cause so much trouble with existing data.

",157943,6164f496c669a60069cc6981,"Thu, 26 May 2016 04:50:32 -0400","

all the student pages in a hierarchy should point directly to the StudentPage object Absolutely correct, but in the current structure there is no way where we can get all the hierarchy of student pages from a StudentPage object so it makes harder to detect if a page is student page or not.

Solution: I am thinking of adding new column 'isStudentPage' into the table 'lesson_builder_pages' and setting it to 'true' for all the existing rows which has owner values. Adding similar variable into SimplePageImpl.java and for all future student pages in a hierarchy[for a given StudentPage] this will be set to true. This will differentiate our pages from student content as now both will have owner.

",174571,6164d3a564ff010071b75c26,"Thu, 26 May 2016 05:00:58 -0400","

You're not going to be creating student pages. The only student pages are created by existing code. The existing test will work fine for them.

The only issue is that the current code doesn't always distinguish properly between pages with an owner and student pages, because at the moment the only pages with an owern are student pages. You're creating a new category of pages that have owners but aren't student pages. We sometimes test owner == null to see whether it's a student page. In most cases those tests will be fine, because they're checking whether access needs to be checked by owner. That will be true for your pages as well. But in a few places where it actually does need to check whether something is a student page, the test of owner == null will have to be replaced by the test for whether it's a student page.

",,,,,,,,,107881,6164f496c669a60069cc6981,"Thu, 26 May 2016 06:03:04 -0400","

currently the only way to distinguish between a normal page and a student page is to check the 'owner' value and since the new pages will have owner and are not student pages , 'findStudentPage(page.getTopParent())' does not return correct value for a non-student page which has owner and also for subpages in the StudentPage hierarchy.

how do you suggest to find if a page is StudentPage?

",74383,6164f496c669a60069cc6981,"Mon, 27 Jun 2016 02:06:43 -0400","

Hi Charles,

about your suggestion using 'findStudentPage(page.getTopParent())' , so first I need to get the top level StudentPage and then all it's whole hierarchy of pages for that student and then check whether the current page is student page or not?

",158024,6164d3a564ff010071b75c26,"Mon, 27 Jun 2016 03:13:00 -0400","

No, you don't need to look at the whole hierarchy. All student subpages should have top parent pointing to the top of the tree. Hence you just need gettopparent to get the top page in the tree, getstdentpage to see if it is a student page. I think, however, that it's fine to add isStudentPage. There's no reason to have to do potentially two extra database queries when we can add a bit to the page object.

The problem you're going to have is with existing data. Either we need a database conversion script that sets isstudentpage for all pages with owners, or the flag needs to be isNotStudentPage, though you probably want to come up with a better name, maybe isOwnedPage. It would only be set if owner != null. So in StudentPageImpl you could define

Your code would set isOwnedPage at the same time it sets owner. Actually probably in a single method, like setOwnedPage, which has as arguments a userId and a groupId. Note that for group owned pages both are specified. the Userid (which becomes the owner field) is set to be the user that created the page. i.e
There's a field groupOwned, but it isn't actually used, and needn't be set.

But then you have to go through the code to find all of the owner == null tests and figure out which ones should be isStudentPage.

",107984,6164f496c669a60069cc6981,"Thu, 7 Jul 2016 03:00:46 -0400","

Thanks Charles for explaining this, however I feel 'isStudentPage' is better name for the new column because 'isOwnedPage' may be quite confusing for a new person who is trying to understand the structure. Student pages are also kind of owned pages , what do you think?

",57804,6164f940071a720071a765f3,"Mon, 14 Nov 2016 04:44:55 -0500",

I've created another mergable PR for this Jira (the second one in the GitHub list) as the first one was Neelam's (so I can't close it) but she's no longer working on it.

2/ Is it worth adding something to the Permissions page or changing the text. In the following, if taken literally, it says people with access role cannot update pages, but they can they can update their own, so change label to “Update all pages or items”. Also change second label to “Read and update own pages or items”
“Unless specifically set on a page-by-page basis in ‘Settings’ (<span class=”fa-cog-icon”/>) pages are not owned by individual users.”
Put this before the undo changes button.
3/ I create a hierarchy of pages Main > Bert1 (owner: bert) > Bert2 (own: bert) > Harry1 (owner: harry)

When I do an index of pages neither Bert2 nor Harry1 show up. When I do add subpage, add existing, they don’t show up either.

",175090,6164f940071a720071a765f3,"Wed, 22 Feb 2017 00:43:24 -0500",

There was never any mention of what should happen on the Index of Pages page so there is no mention of owners there. We can add it in though - what do other people think?

,91679,6164d3a564ff010071b75c26,"Thu, 23 Feb 2017 03:53:32 -0500","

Index of pages doesn't show student pages, so it wasn't an issue before. It should show them. I think showing the owner makes sense for people with edit rights. I'm not so sure it makes sense for students. I probably wouldn't hold up putting the code in for this feature. I'd encourage putting the code in as soon as it seems to be reasonably complete, without misfeatures or problems. People will no doubt have comments once they try it that they don't have in the abstract.

[SAK-31141] Change Names of My Workspace / Home synoptic tools pages,https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/browse/SAK-31141,10057,SAK,Sakai,"

As a result of feedback gained from UX testing to determine which naming/styling options for My Workspace and the Home synoptic tool page would allow users to accomplish their intended goals as easily and directly as possible, it is recommended that the following changes be made to the names for these two areas:

column2: • Add “Home” text to the right of the house icon in the upper-left of the interface.
• When this new “Home” area (site) is selected, style the house icon + “Home” text as a button and highlight to match the styling used by currently selected sites in the system.
• Use the following Font Awesome icon to represent the “Overview” tool: http://fortawesome.github.io/Font-Awesome/icon/list-ul/

column1: Attached is a mockup of the Sakai interface with these changes represented.
For a recording of the most recent UX Working Group Call, in which the UX testing results were presented, see the following youtube video:

https://youtu.be/Bu_D3ffU8N8

[SAK-34185] Audio counter is jumpy while student reviews their recording before submission,https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/browse/SAK-34185,10057,SAK,Sakai,"

Experienced in Firefox (WIN and IOS) and Safari, Chrome (IOS)
1) As instructor, create a quiz with one Student Audio Response question. Allow 20 seconds of recording.
2) In settings screen, allow student unlimited attempts, and set up dates as needed. Save and Publish.
3) As student, click into quiz and record for 5 seconds. Decide to review your entry before going any further.
4) Click Play button to start the recording over. Listen for 3 or 4 seconds and click Play again.

Once you've attempted to restart the recording, the audio will start again at the beginning, but the timing indicator continues moving - right off the screen. It may even display twice - once, back at 01, and the second continuing well past the time allotment, with the two indicators flashing and bouncing in the interface.

Screenshot of indicator: https://drive.google.com/open?id=0B_eQ_IUpXTc1QWE4aTIyTzk1cWc

The issue isn't merely that it's tedious to click, it's that If there is an event on the calendar outside of the 8AM-5PM time period, the user has no indication of it at all. Only if the user clicks the EARLIER and LATER buttons both does the user see all the events during the week. Rather than making a scroll bar, and a 3x longer calendar, it one might adopt the google calendar approach and show earlier and later events without the full grid (as shown in the attachment above).

[SAK-31139] Move actual Calendar up on screen,https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/browse/SAK-31139,10057,SAK,Sakai,"

Moving the actual calendar grid up towards the top of the page would make it more convenient to use. Right now, any time the view is changed (move forward/backward by week/month, view time earlier/later, create event, etc.) the screen resets to the top of the page. Most of the calendar is no longer visible and the user has to scroll back down to view. This is extremely frustrating if the user has to navigate between a large number of events at different times/days/weeks.

It would be helpful (if possible) to add beside the forum or topic title, whether it was a forum or topic:

Otherwise, instructors will need to create names that reflect whether it is a topic or forum.

If an instructor has a MC/MS question worth x amount of points, if the published assessment is edited and that question is updated to MC/SS, the students scores will be multiplied by the number of correct answers from the original MC/MS question.

Take assessment as student getting all correct

[SAK-31126] Update WebDav instructions - remove notes of using WebDAV on empty sites,https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/browse/SAK-31126,10057,SAK,Sakai,"

I think that this notes can be removed.

Note: There must be at least one object (file, folder etc.) in the course or project resource area before you begin the setup procedure. This procedure needs to be done once for each site before you can use WebDAV to transfer files to and from any one site.
I have never had this kind of problem using WebDAV on sites where resources are empty.

I have been testing long time from Sakai 2.6 with a lot of different clients.

[SAK-31123] Web services - CopySiteContent does not work with EntityTransferrer,https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/browse/SAK-31123,10057,SAK,Sakai,"

Currently, SiteAction code for migrating content between sites works in two different ways: first it migrates content from resources via contentHostingService and later it migrates the rest of the tools that implement EntityTransferrer and EntityTransferrerRefMigrator interfaces, using the methods that each tool provides.
copySiteContent and copySiteContentForTool web services and their linked method transferCopyEntities are obsolete and doesn't support EntityTransferrer methods.
This causes that only Resources content is guaranteed to be migrated. The rest of the tools behaves in a different manner. At least, Lessons and Syllabus does not work with these WS.

SakaiScript.java must update the named methods to use the same code than in SiteAction.

",,27562,SAK-31123,Web services - CopySiteContent does not work with EntityTransferrer,10007,https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/secure/viewavatar?size=medium&avatarId=10303&avatarType=issuetype,Bug,10002,https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/images/icons/priorities/major.svg,Major,6,https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/images/icons/statuses/closed.png,"The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.",Closed,3,done,green,10000,Fixed,5db0830566a99f0d9c5a0770,Daniel Merino,5db0830566a99f0d9c5a0770,Daniel Merino,"Tue, 3 May 2016 00:05:27 -0400","Mon, 20 Jul 2020 00:52:38 -0400",11.0,Web Services,0,6,Development,customfield_10000,com.atlassian.jira.plugins.jira-development-integration-plugin:devsummarycf,Rank,0|1091cg:,customfield_10019,com.pyxis.greenhopper.jira:gh-lexo-rank,Sprint,customfield_10020,com.pyxis.greenhopper.jira:gh-sprint,"Wed, 1 Jun 2016 05:15:24 -0400",,,,,,,Test Plan,customfield_10038,com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.customfieldtypes:textarea,[CHART] Date of First Response,customfield_10024,com.atlassian.jira.ext.charting:firstresponsedate,,,11.1,12.0,174532,5db0830566a99f0d9c5a0770,"Thu, 12 May 2016 22:28:29 -0400","

,"

-Create a site A with several tools that include: content with links to resources in the same site, assignments embedded into lessons pages, uploaded resources and, in general, any tool which implements EntityTransferrer and EntityTransferrerRefMigrator interfaces.
-Create a site B with the same set of tools (as copying content does not create the tools in target site).
-Use a CXF client, like the one attached to this JIRA, to call copySiteContent WS in order to copy site A contents into site B.

-Test that content in site B is correctly copied, including resources, updated links that now points to B's resources and assignments embedded in lessons that points to the migrated assignments in B.

Well, it looks like what's doing the sort here is in QuestionScoreListener and it's not random but it's just sorting each student by PublishedAnswerId.

column5: // The list is sorted by answer id so that it will come back from the student in a
// predictable order. This is also required by the getCalcQResult method.

column1: This is why the order seems unpredictable and also the order in
<a href=""https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/browse/SAK-36731"" class=""jira-issue-macro-key issue-link""  title=""Survey matrix on questions scores page is in (seemingly) random order"" >

In some simple local testing it looks like switching this over to sort by PublishedItemId gets more predictable and correct sorts for everyone and this makes more sense.

,74242,557058:7074e357-325c-4f04-880f-321ecd7c7dc5,"Mon, 9 May 2016 09:05:44 -0400","

Trisha Gordon and Matthew Jones , your comments seem to conflict. If Options and Answer key are shown in Sakai 10 but not Sakai 11 then this sounds like a bug. Unless you are talking about two different things?

","

column2: • Create and publish a test with a Multiple Choice question
• Have a student take and submit the test
• As instructor, go to Published Assessments and click Scores from drop down menu next to test
• Click Questions tab - options and answer key should both be shown.

column1:
",Relate,54070,SAK-36723,relates to,10008,38695,MultChoice.png,60877,ug:56f7cf66-de89-4f1b-b7bd-b9e67abb3c6c,"Mon, 2 May 2016 10:30:09 -0400",174516,557058:c5034e9d-3885-4f9c-b1d1-ae4bd6cdbfce,"Mon, 9 May 2016 11:09:54 -0400","

In Sakai 10, the answer options and key appear on the Questions screen below the question text as shown in this screenshot.

Thus, because this data missing on the Questions screen in Sakai 11 (i just verified this), it is a bug, not a feature request.

",191205,70121:ec0fd122-4a2d-4492-a966-78d3f9aa9080,"Mon, 9 May 2016 11:23:24 -0400","

You're right, I retract my comment and making this a bug again. I attached a side by side. It's no longer displayed. I don't think I'd make this a blocker, but it would be nice to find out what happened to it.

",40418,70121:ec0fd122-4a2d-4492-a966-78d3f9aa9080,"Mon, 9 May 2016 11:30:29 -0400","

It's minor, but for some reason in 11 the text ""Responses"" is hidden too. At least that's still there in the form though, the answer key isn't being printed at all.

",142504,557058:cdae778f-fe7d-4a6d-9667-9be789e4fbee,"Thu, 7 Sep 2017 04:53:31 -0400","

[SAK-36657] Negative Points option does not get counted in score,https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/browse/SAK-36657,10057,SAK,Sakai,"

create a test with at least one
1) Multiple Choice, Single Correct and Enable Negative Points option. Make the points for answering correctly 10, and points deducted if wrong to 2.
2) Add at least one other question of any type which is automatically graded (just to save you some time) and give it 10 points.
4) as student take the test and answer the one with Negative points incorrectly and the other question correctly. Submit.
6) As instructor, check the score for the student.

Result: The points awarded for getting the question wrong is zero instead of -2 , points deducted for getting it wrong.

","Marist QA server, 11 nightly server",36415,SAK-36657,Negative Points option does not get counted in score,10007,https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/secure/viewavatar?size=medium&avatarId=10303&avatarType=issuetype,Bug,10000,https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/images/icons/priorities/blocker.svg,Blocker,10025,https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/images/icons/statuses/generic.png,Indicates QA is complete and an issue has been tested and verified (Migrated on 12 Oct 2021 03:05 UTC),Verified,3,done,green,10000,Fixed,70121:2bc1ac0d-6e97-45b2-8f53-2c25be8f3f6a,Sristi,557058:7074e357-325c-4f04-880f-321ecd7c7dc5,Neal Caidin,"Mon, 2 May 2016 09:53:43 -0400","Tue, 17 Apr 2018 04:38:50 -0400",11.0,Tests & Quizzes (Samigo),1,4,Development,customfield_10000,com.atlassian.jira.plugins.jira-development-integration-plugin:devsummarycf,Rank,0|1091ao:,customfield_10019,com.pyxis.greenhopper.jira:gh-lexo-rank,Sprint,customfield_10020,com.pyxis.greenhopper.jira:gh-sprint,"Fri, 20 May 2016 11:40:36 -0400",,,,,,,[CHART] Date of First Response,customfield_10024,com.atlassian.jira.ext.charting:firstresponsedate,[CHART] Time in Status,customfield_10025,com.atlassian.jira.ext.charting:timeinstatus,,,11.0,12.0,191167,557058:7074e357-325c-4f04-880f-321ecd7c7dc5,"Mon, 2 May 2016 09:55:29 -0400","

So one really interesting thing is if I create a question with a Points deducted value in a system in which it is working, like Sakai 10. Then export as QTI and import into 11 as QTI. The points deducted works on the score.

",40381,557058:7074e357-325c-4f04-880f-321ecd7c7dc5,"Mon, 2 May 2016 17:30:11 -0400","

I can reproduce the problem with Multiple correct, Single Selection on the Marist QA server.

",74238,6164e7b0a707100069fd3655,"Sun, 8 May 2016 23:04:39 -0400","

It fails with 'Single Correct' and 'Multiple Correct, Single Selection'. It works fine with 'Multiple Correct, Multiple Selection'->'All or Nothing'.

",124519,557058:d4bf1967-6188-4b29-bf4a-95cf874b4a08,"Thu, 19 May 2016 05:34:55 -0400","

This ended up being a regression in
<a href=""https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/browse/SAK-34849"" class=""jira-issue-macro-key issue-link""  title=""'Minimum value' option for questions"" >

, the backing bean ""ItemBean"" was forcing a value of 0 which during scoring meant that min points feature is in use and it would override negative points. The solution was that min points should be null by default indicating that it is not used, this allowed the scoring logic to correctly score the questions.

",141238,557058:d4bf1967-6188-4b29-bf4a-95cf874b4a08,"Thu, 19 May 2016 05:37:44 -0400","

This depends on these other issues
<a href=""https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/browse/SAK-36597"" class=""jira-issue-macro-key issue-link""  title=""Cannot add negative points to the 'Multiple Choice' questions"" >
<a href=""https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/browse/SAK-36786"" class=""jira-issue-macro-key issue-link""  title=""Unable to enter negative point value in Multiple Choice"" >

because some additional validation was added as well as the min points validation was updated to allow for blank as an acceptable answer.

",,,40760,SAK-36597,depends on,Relate,26141,SAK-34849,,,relates to,,,,10008,,,,,,,,,,,,,40858,SAK-36786,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,174563,70121:2bc1ac0d-6e97-45b2-8f53-2c25be8f3f6a,"Tue, 24 May 2016 06:25:44 -0400","

Tested on Trunk nightly server

Negative points are being counted now. Snapshot: http://www.evernote.com/shard/s657/sh/9f99d406-bc71-4831-8fa3-deebed9f72aa/f1f338966566365cb2924574333b606c

",141196,557058:7074e357-325c-4f04-880f-321ecd7c7dc5,"Fri, 6 May 2016 03:44:43 -0400","

I appreciate all the details but I think this Jira is too difficult to understand. I think I understand it now.
1) Create a test as instructor. Make a due date for very soon, since you want it to expire.
3) Go to settings and add an Exception to allow a single student to take the test , with dates that are after the expiration date.
4) Log in a student and try to take the test.

Expected result is that student should be able to take the exam but they can't from within the site. When you say they can from within the worksite, does that mean they use the Dashboard tool? (that workaround might not be available for 11.0) .
It sounds like there are other issues besides this one? It might make sense to have separate Jiras for them (until I understand better I'm not sure).

P.S. I couldn't access Evernote from the Google doc at all. It asked me for Evernote login.

",191195,557058:f40ed6cf-0104-4dc6-88be-9f2bbc0cae39,"Fri, 6 May 2016 04:04:46 -0400","

I have updated the Google doc with screen shots from another tool. They should be visible for everyone now.

The only place the student was able to access their quiz (during the exception time frame) was from within the Dashboard/My Workspace area. It did not appear in the Tests & Quizzes screen for them.

","

Steps to reproduce:
1) Create a test as instructor. Make a due date for very soon, since you want it to expire.
3) Go to settings and add an Exception to allow a single student to take the test , with dates that are after the expiration date.

4) Log in a student and try to take the test.

My current theory is that getBasicInfoOfAllPUblished ...

doesn't include the metadata in what it returns. Hence the extended time code, which looks fine, doesn't trigger because it doesn't find the magic metadata.

",191362,6164d3a564ff010071b75c26,"Thu, 7 Jul 2016 14:06:46 -0400","

If I'm right, this could be fixed by using a query that returned the metadata. But there's a good reason that basic info only is returned for that page. What I'm considering is going a separate query, which would have to be written in HQL, to retrieve just the metadata for extended time and for the current users, but for all tests. The result would be put in a hash table indexed by published assessment ID.

Ideally we'd redo this code to use a separate table, but I think an appropriate query on the metadata table can be almost as good.

Firefox 45.0.2",36409,SAK-34445,Reset to Default Grading Logic doesn't reset negative point value to 0,10007,https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/secure/viewavatar?size=medium&avatarId=10303&avatarType=issuetype,Bug,10002,https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/images/icons/priorities/major.svg,Major,1,https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/images/icons/statuses/open.png,The issue is open and ready for the assignee to start work on it.,Open,2,new,blue-gray,-1,Unresolved,6164daac2f6aed00680684e4,SAMIGO TEAM,70121:9335f09f-0d23-4a59-9aac-ba36f9cb223a,Molly Kelsey,"Sat, 30 Apr 2016 12:01:21 -0400","Tue, 17 Apr 2018 04:02:22 -0400",11.0,Tests & Quizzes (Samigo),1,4,Development,customfield_10000,com.atlassian.jira.plugins.jira-development-integration-plugin:devsummarycf,Rank,0|10918g:,customfield_10019,com.pyxis.greenhopper.jira:gh-lexo-rank,Sprint,customfield_10020,com.pyxis.greenhopper.jira:gh-sprint,,,,,,,,[CHART] Date of First Response,customfield_10024,com.atlassian.jira.ext.charting:firstresponsedate,,,,,,,,57408,557058:7074e357-325c-4f04-880f-321ecd7c7dc5,"Fri, 6 May 2016 04:06:55 -0400","

Does it apply the negative point value though? In other words, is this a display error or does it functionally still take off negative points if you get it wrong, when it shouldn't?

(either is a bug, but the latter case sounds like a blocker to me).

",141199,70121:9335f09f-0d23-4a59-9aac-ba36f9cb223a,"Fri, 6 May 2016 05:29:52 -0400","

The student will still be shown that negative points will be used for incorrect answers. I don't think the points are taken off based on result patterns from other negative point testing, but I haven't actually checked this scenario.

",191199,557058:7074e357-325c-4f04-880f-321ecd7c7dc5,"Fri, 6 May 2016 09:43:06 -0400","

Seems like a whole lot of related issues on Negative point option. Linking to one of them.

. In fact, maybe this issue can be closed and be considered as incorporated in

[SAK-31115] elFinder no longer working for browsing My Workspace,https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/browse/SAK-31115,10057,SAK,Sakai,"

If you're in My Workspace and you are in a tool that has the CKEditor, clicking on the Browse Server comes up with the error ""Permission Denied"".

If you're in another site, My Workspace is not selectable from the list. This is a regression from the old picker, and I believe it's likely to be a blocker since many people store resources in ""My Workspace"" that they like to use.

",,27558,SAK-31115,elFinder no longer working for browsing My Workspace,10007,https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/secure/viewavatar?size=medium&avatarId=10303&avatarType=issuetype,Bug,10000,https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/images/icons/priorities/blocker.svg,Blocker,10025,https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/images/icons/statuses/generic.png,Indicates QA is complete and an issue has been tested and verified (Migrated on 12 Oct 2021 03:05 UTC),Verified,3,done,green,10000,Fixed,70121:2bc1ac0d-6e97-45b2-8f53-2c25be8f3f6a,Sristi,70121:ec0fd122-4a2d-4492-a966-78d3f9aa9080,Matthew Jones,"Fri, 29 Apr 2016 11:17:52 -0400","Fri, 17 Jun 2016 05:21:57 -0400",11.0,elFinder,0,5,Development,customfield_10000,com.atlassian.jira.plugins.jira-development-integration-plugin:devsummarycf,Rank,0|109180:,customfield_10019,com.pyxis.greenhopper.jira:gh-lexo-rank,Sprint,customfield_10020,com.pyxis.greenhopper.jira:gh-sprint,"Tue, 24 May 2016 08:11:24 -0400",,,,,,,Test Plan,customfield_10038,com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.customfieldtypes:textarea,[CHART] Date of First Response,customfield_10024,com.atlassian.jira.ext.charting:firstresponsedate,,,11.0,12.0,74229,5eb012f0b882f90bae453e0f,"Thu, 5 May 2016 23:02:58 -0400","

Pull request created.
The workspace problem resides in the getVolumes() method, does not add the user workspace to the list.

The permission problem resides in the collectionId construction, instead of /user/XXXX should be /user/~XXXXX. Personally i suggest to move the the changes from ""build.min.js"" to ""ckeditor.launch.js"", should be something like:

collectionId = collectionId.replace('/user/','/user/~');

",124471,557058:5e9b51e2-3d91-4079-943a-ed719d119ea1,"Fri, 6 May 2016 00:20:51 -0400",

neelam and matthew think it's highly likely that getVolumes() is incorrect and indeed doesnt return my workspace. I have updated the test script to add in this test. Nice spot Matthew

[SAK-31113] "Compare auto-saved content with that loaded from the website" not working,https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/browse/SAK-31113,10057,SAK,Sakai,"

There is currently an issue with the auto-save functionality in CKEditor. To reproduce:
3. When the auto-save browser message appears, click OK.
4. The ""Compare auto-saved content with that loaded from the website"" window will appear.
No preview content, however, will appear in this window, regardless of which radio option is selected.

Selecting ""Yes, load auto-saved content"" works as expected.

[SAK-34144] FIB Ignore spaces option not working 100%,https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/browse/SAK-34144,10057,SAK,Sakai,"
<a href=""https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/browse/SAK-37264"" class=""jira-issue-macro-key issue-link""  title=""Ignore Spaces Option in Fill In The Blank Question Type"" >
added a new feature. But we have found a couple of examples in which it is not behaving as expected.
Two spaces between red and rust and one space between blue and corn. Checked the Ignore spaces checkbox.
As a student I answered redrust and bluecorn. Samigo marked redrust wrong and bluecorn correct. Sam Lee Pan also has an example.
1) Create a Fill in the Blank question type in Samigo
3) At least one of the answer options should include spaces.
4) Use at least two spaces in one of the answers

As a student, take the exam and answer correctly without any spaces. Your answer should be accepted as correct and awarded full point value.

[SAK-36229] Low performance at uploading html5 recorded audio,https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/browse/SAK-36229,10057,SAK,Sakai,"

We have found a very low perfomance at uploading audio files captured with htlm5 recorder, having the save to db disabled. Even without
saving the blob to db the performance was very poor and just an small set of students collapsed the cpu at server.

We observed that after the file was correctly saved at filesystem it took to sakai a lot of time (30secs or more) to acknowledge to user the uploading to fliesystem is done. During that time the cpu load increased a lot without some logical reason as the actual file uploading had finished long ago.

After some investigation to track down the issue, we have found that even without the need of saving the file as blob in db it is processed enterely in a not very efficient way, instead of just getting the size and location.
byte[] mediaByte = getMediaStream(mediaLocation); -> *(problem/improvement needed): read the entire file byte by byte, not needed if no blob is required*
getMediaStream's performance is very low, it tooks abot 30 seconds to put a 30 MB file in the array (a 3min audio file). getMediaStream is called always, even when not saving as blob to db.
Performance at getMediaStream can be easily increased using something like:
array = Files.readAllBytes(new File(file).toPath()) --- from java.nio.file.Files
It could also improved if the file is only enterely read (to array) when save to blob is needed and just getting the size when not from filesystem methods.

The same happens in samigo\samigo-app\src\java\org\sakaiproject\tool\assessment\ui\bean\delivery\DeliveryBean.java

","Issue on server. Tested on Centos 6.7,Tomcat 7.0.62, Oracle Jdk 1.7.0_79-b15 64b",27554,SAK-36229,Low performance at uploading html5 recorded audio,10007,https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/secure/viewavatar?size=medium&avatarId=10303&avatarType=issuetype,Bug,10001,https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/images/icons/priorities/critical.svg,Critical,6,https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/images/icons/statuses/closed.png,"The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Mac /Chrome

",74278,5db0830566a99f0d9c5a0770,"Thu, 19 May 2016 22:12:33 -0400","

The process includes uploading the file and saving it in the server and I think that an usual user can't know when each part starts or finishes.

The patch improves only the part of saving so, yes, results can differ depending on the connection speed. But if you try with the same connection in a server without the patch I think that you should note the time difference with a big file.

","

Create a quizz with an audio question of 180 seconds length.

Record it with the html5 audio recorder and save.

",Relate,,,,10008,,,,,,174555,557058:7074e357-325c-4f04-880f-321ecd7c7dc5,"Fri, 20 May 2016 03:29:32 -0400","

I saved a 3 minute file and it took 33 seconds on the 11 branch Oracle nightly server. And while that is a little faster, I wouldn't necessarily draw any conclusions from one test on each server.

",107867,5db0830566a99f0d9c5a0770,"Mon, 23 May 2016 02:07:28 -0400","

If the file upload is working fine, IMHO this can be set as ""Tested"".

The performance can't be measured properly without access to the server but I think that it's never going to be worse, because the patch mainly removes an extra operation that is not needed.

[SAK-31108] Do not use $ as jQuery if $ is not JQuery,https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/browse/SAK-31108,10057,SAK,Sakai,"

If some tool is loading prototype js library and wants to use other version of jQuery, the portal code doesn't work as expected.
This is running even $ is detected previously as not JQuery. Prototype also uses $ as variable.

Also in this case the jQuery.noConflict could be executed again even there is a second jQuery version, and it was already executed before.

<a href=""https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/browse/SAK-37466"" class=""jira-issue-macro-key issue-link""  title=""Make deleteOrphanPages available via tool API"" >

[SAK-31106] Can Mark same message as read multiple times,https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/browse/SAK-31106,10057,SAK,Sakai,"

Currently when in the message center, the same message can be marked as ""unread"" multiple times consecutively. On the home screen, the message center notification will increment with each marking and will only decrement once for each time the message is marked ""read.""
1) Find a message in any of the messages folders
3) Check the home tab's message notification, it should have properly incremented.
4) Go to the same message and mark as unread again.
5) Return to the home tab and notice that the notification for new mail has incremented again, suggesting an additional email when there is not one.
To undo the process, the message must be marked as read for each time it was marked unread.

Screencast: http://quick.as/VlO7c2rjq
