I intentionally used >. I think the hierarchy of pages within the tool is conceptually different from the hierarchy of tools.

I checked with inspect element in Safari, Chrome, and iE 10. In all, the font and size are identical. They are inherited from body. However the current page name is in bold. I believe what you're seeing is an optical illusion. I checked with the same font in an editor, where I could do more testing. I find that bold looks slightly shorter. But if you put them regular and bold characters next to each other, they seem to me to match in height. I think what's going on is that the bold form is wider, and that thus the ratio of height to width is less. When they're separate, this gives the impression that the height is smaller, even though if you bolded an individual character in the middle of a word you'd find that the x height is actually the same.
You can see the same thing below:

This is a test. This is a test.

",91131,6164d3a564ff010071b75c26,"Fri, 13 May 2016 05:46:59 -0400","

I'm reopening this. The main breadcrumbs have changed to >. But it's a different > than I use. With the main breadcrumbs as /, I think > in lessons makes sense. But it doesn't make sense to have two slightly different >s. So I'm going to fix it.

",174536,6164d3a564ff010071b75c26,"Fri, 13 May 2016 10:41:04 -0400","

OK. I fixed this. I redid the style of the breadcrumbs and return headers to work with Morpheus. There are 6 cases to test:

column2: • click on a resource (e.g. a URL) where you've removed the check for show in new windows. I no longer show the header for that at all, since the title is now at the top.
• do ""add quiz"" and click on ""create new quiz using tests and quizzes"". Look at the return header

column1: In all three cases the bread crumbs should be in the section above the Lessons tool. The 1st and 3rd tests should show a return header, but the header should now display with the normal Morpheus ""instruction"" appearance, rather than the separate Lessons-specific header. The ""return"" instruction should now be an underlined link rather than a button. I think this is a much better appearance.

The 2nd case of a resource shouldn't have a header at all. Actually, the headers are sort of unnecessary in the 1st case as well, since you can return to the lesson using the bread crumbs. But I didn't want to change the UI too much in a way that might confuse existing users.

[SAK-31100] Site Info/Tool Order/Course menu - Instructors can't tell if tools are hidden on course menu,https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/browse/SAK-31100,10057,SAK,Sakai,"

After an instructor hides tools in *Site Info-Tool Order *and saves changes, nothing changes on the course menu to the ""hidden"" tools.

column2: • In the past, the hidden tools were ""grayed out"" and italicized, so the instructor knew at a glance which tools were hidden to students.
• Now an instructor won't know if tools are hidden to students, unless they go to student view, where hidden tools are not visible to the instructor.

From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.",Resolved,3,done,green,10001,Won't Fix,557058:26381954-9854-4801-9b32-e9b1c33fd072,Payten Giles,557058:8214380d-0bd8-4eec-9d5a-cff0db82aa8e,Rebekah Roehrs,"Thu, 28 Apr 2016 08:45:02 -0400","Wed, 6 Dec 2017 12:11:15 -0500",11.0,Site Info,0,3,Development,customfield_10000,com.atlassian.jira.plugins.jira-development-integration-plugin:devsummarycf,Rank,0|109120:,customfield_10019,com.pyxis.greenhopper.jira:gh-lexo-rank,Sprint,customfield_10020,com.pyxis.greenhopper.jira:gh-sprint,"Wed, 6 Dec 2017 12:11:15 -0500",,,,,,,[CHART] Date of First Response,customfield_10024,com.atlassian.jira.ext.charting:firstresponsedate,[CHART] Time in Status,customfield_10025,com.atlassian.jira.ext.charting:timeinstatus,,,,,174528,557058:d1ee4e03-e8fc-4c02-a75c-47793fb920ca,"Thu, 12 May 2016 06:46:18 -0400","

Hi there, Payten. I think we can just add the italics and the eye icon in the left hand menu and leave the lock icon off for now. I'll link the related JIRA here as well.

",107838,557058:8214380d-0bd8-4eec-9d5a-cff0db82aa8e,"Thu, 12 May 2016 07:03:26 -0400","

Here's another Jira reporting the same issue:

https://jira.sakaiproject.org/browse/SAK-30315

",141220,557058:d1ee4e03-e8fc-4c02-a75c-47793fb920ca,"Thu, 12 May 2016 07:16:11 -0400","

Yup. Thanks, Rebekah Roehrs! That's the original feature request for this. I'll relate the JIRAs.

","Thu, 12 May 2016 10:46:18 +0000",Relate,49394,SAK-30315,relates to,10008,22673,HiddenToolsonNightlySakai10 .png,24927,ug:43654dc1-6458-4f7f-9664-cd36b8df2c8c,"Thu, 12 May 2016 07:30:54 -0400",174529,557058:8214380d-0bd8-4eec-9d5a-cff0db82aa8e,"Thu, 12 May 2016 07:29:28 -0400","

Karen McPhaul, my manager found the jira and is busy testing something else.
I wanted to point out that I *don't believe this is a feature request, like the older Jira states!
In 2.9 (which I'm on) and on the 10.0 nightly at https://qa10-mysql.nightly.sakaiproject.org/ which I tested today,

in Site Info, Tool Order, when you hide a tool, it shows up on the course menu with gray and italicized text.

",40431,557058:d1ee4e03-e8fc-4c02-a75c-47793fb920ca,"Thu, 12 May 2016 07:37:41 -0400","

Hi Rebekah Roehrs. The other JIRA is marked as a feature request because it also involves surfacing the eye icon in the left menu, which is new. (The JIRA also introduced the lock icon in the left menu, but we need to push that one off until later.) But yes, I hear your point that the italics and gray styling was there before. So, it's fine that this JIRA is marked as a bug.

",125976,557058:26381954-9854-4801-9b32-e9b1c33fd072,"Wed, 6 Dec 2017 12:11:15 -0500",

This seems to be already fixed in 11.x? Please re-open if I'm missing something.

https://trunk-mysql.nightly.sakaiproject.org/portal/

column2: • the + icon and Other Sites needs padding
• ""Open meeting..."" wraps all the way back to the radio buttons, should wrap to the beginning of the text
• Open meeting, Single slot, and Multiple slot don't need * icons (Available to gets a * because ONE of the options MUST be selected, but not all of them)
• The number of slots setup is inconsistent with other parts of Sakai

column1: Could you be more specific about issue #4?

Thank you!!

",174526,70121:9335f09f-0d23-4a59-9aac-ba36f9cb223a,"Thu, 12 May 2016 05:39:03 -0400","

Alejandro González Jiménez Yes!

For #4, normally, options don't have that blue-ish shading around them. Also, the number of slots/participants have outlines but the time doesn't? The normal setup would be three rows, all with *'s and outlined boxes. The (mins) would go after the box, not in the label.
That -165 was the default time setting when I created the meeting. Is that normal?
But when you create a new meeting the default time slot is 15 min. I could not reproduce this issue.
As for the rest of style issues we will work on them.
Thank you so much for your work!

Molly Kelsey

",91125,70121:9335f09f-0d23-4a59-9aac-ba36f9cb223a,"Thu, 12 May 2016 05:56:46 -0400","

Ahh got it, I changed from 10 and 11 to 11 and 12, didn't realize that was 12 AM. All good.

Thank you!! I'm happy to help, working with you specifically has been great. Being able to go back and forth like this is really helpful.

",91134,70121:9335f09f-0d23-4a59-9aac-ba36f9cb223a,"Sat, 14 May 2016 14:37:39 -0400","

It looks much better but when the screen is small, the ""Open meeting..."" text should wrap, just not behind the radio button (Screenshot.png). Same with ""Discussion 1...""

Also, the slots setup is difficult to use in a small screen. Could the text there wrap instead of scrolling?

",124509,557058:78b1dc1f-217d-4c34-b706-e48190cfc7f6,"Mon, 16 May 2016 00:50:18 -0400","

hi Molly Kelsey

Since there are several important changes in this JIRA i´m going to verify this one and open a new ticket for the checkbox and radio buttons problems.

",157912,557058:78b1dc1f-217d-4c34-b706-e48190cfc7f6,"Mon, 16 May 2016 00:53:04 -0400","

The new JIRA i´ve created https://jira.sakaiproject.org/browse/SAK-31213
As for the slots setup is displayed in an HTML table so that´s why it appears with scroll bars. Eventually we will try to modify this in the future but it´s not a priority right now

The QA Team identified the following UI bugs in this tool:
This is a parent JIRA to track all morpheus-related issues for this tool. Do not submit a PR against this JIRA. Instead:

• In the linked JIRA(s) you create, identify which issues you've fixed using the Issue ID # in the google doc above. e.g., ""Membership-21""

[SAK-31084] "Pick a group" filter next to users in Roster is redundant and not intuitive,https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/browse/SAK-31084,10057,SAK,Sakai,"

The ""pick a group"" dropdown menu next to each participant in the Roster listing seems to do the same thing as the Groups filter at the top of the screen, but it doesn't make sense to have it listed for each user. You aren't assigning them to a group or doing anything to their individual group membership when you select this option, you are just filtering the whole list.

It makes more sense to just show the groups the user belongs to in the Groups column, the way that group membership was displayed in Sakai 10 on the group membership page. When users view the roster list, it is more useful for them to see at a glance the group membership for all participants listed, not a drop-down menu for each person.
In addition, when printed, the print version of the Roster currently shows ""Pick a group"" for each person rather than their group membership.

See attached screen shots for a comparison of the group display in version 10 versus version 11.

",,53776,SAK-31084,"""Pick a group"" filter next to users in Roster is redundant and not intuitive",10007,https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/secure/viewavatar?size=medium&avatarId=10303&avatarType=issuetype,Bug,10002,https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/images/icons/priorities/major.svg,Major,5,https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/images/icons/statuses/resolved.png,"A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. [SAK-31075] No way to export group membership information from Roster,https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/browse/SAK-31075,10057,SAK,Sakai,"

In Sakai 11, it seems that the ""Group Membership"" screen has been removed and combined into the ""Overview"" screen. However, now that this group screen is gone, there is no way to export the group membership for all site participants. (In version 10, there was a export option on the Group Membership page which included membership details.) The export from the Overview screen does not include group membership. It only includes Name, User ID, Email Address, Role.

column2: • note that the export file doesn't have any group data

column1:

[SAK-31073] Gradebook Classic - Gradebook Setup - ability to add Categories or Categories and Weighting information not available.,https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/browse/SAK-31073,10057,SAK,Sakai,"

On the Gradebook Setup page in Gradebook Classic, the ability to add either Categories or Categories & Weighting is not available after selecting either option.

column2: • As an instructor, click the Gradebook Setup tab in the Gradebook tool.
• On the Gradebook Setup page, click in the radio button beside either Categories Only or Categories & Weighting. There is no opportunity to then enter the category/weighting information.
• In order to access the fields for input, you have to click the Save Changes button first and then the necessary fields are available.

column1:
This behavior is different in Sakai 10. After selecting either Categories Only or Categories & Weighting, the fields to enter the category and weighting information appear immediately.

","http://qa01-sakai.marist.edu:8080/portal

The proper way to handle this is to also test for undefined:

The categories appear immediately but after clicking either radio button the screen jumps to the top of the page, forcing the user to scroll back down.

",174488,557058:cdae778f-fe7d-4a6d-9667-9be789e4fbee,"Wed, 4 May 2016 03:38:57 -0400","

Molly Kelsey, the behaviour of jumping to the top of the page has always been there (I just tested on the 10.x nightly instance), and is because the form is submitted on click of any of the radio buttons.

As such, this is not a regression or a bug related to this ticket; it's always been like this.

[SAK-31072] Find a better place for "Show System Alerts",https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/browse/SAK-31072,10057,SAK,Sakai,"

When you hide low level banner alerts the link is in the left side of the top bar, could be placed in the middle and at the very top (without any margin) to be less disruptive.

I know this is a very minor problem because your goal is that the user read the alert, but if you choose low level is because you let users hide them, so I think sounds reasonable.

[SAK-31068] Set Forums to have Own Import As Draft Property,https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/browse/SAK-31068,10057,SAK,Sakai,"

Allow Forums to have it's own sakai.property, msgcntr.forums.import.importAsDraft, which controls the functionality when importing / duplicating and sets the items as draft. Default functionality is for draft mode to be enabled.

So this error as described doesn't affect 10 but it's slightly confusing to me.
If you don't fill in the due date but also check to ""No late submissions accepted after due date"", what should that mean?
The way 10 worked would be like if the labe said

column2: • No, not after due date. However, if due date left empty, late submissions will always be accepted.

column1: Now I'll just have to make that label change and figure out what's going on with the due date. In 11, it looks like after you exit and go back in it looks like it changes the due date to be the same time you started.

You started this assessment on Monday, 2016-May-02 07:47 PM. You will have until Monday, 2016-May-02 07:47 PM""

",40386,70121:9335f09f-0d23-4a59-9aac-ba36f9cb223a,"Tue, 3 May 2016 09:25:43 -0400","

I don't know exactly what it should mean, I was confused by the options. I wanted to have a test without a due date, so I left the due date blank. But then had to pick late submissions settings, either Accept until and No not after due date.

Setting Accept until would keep the student from being able to take the test after that date, so I put not after due date. If there is no due date, this shouldn't be a problem?

","

To Reproduce:

column2: • Set Start date, leave Due date blank, Set not to accept submissions after due date
• Restart the assessment - note time countdown and button changes

column1: <a href=""https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/browse/SAK-34955"" class=""jira-issue-macro-key issue-link""  title=""Allow different delivery settings for specific sections, groups, and individuals"" >

is setting the wrong value for setTimedAssessment on second attempts. This seems to be causing a number of current regressions.

[SAK-37859] Tool link icons in Lessons should match tool icons in course menu,https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/browse/SAK-37859,10057,SAK,Sakai,"

In Lesson Builder, when an instructor adds a link to an Assignment or to a Test/Quiz, the icon that displays beside the link in Lessons does not match the tool's icon on the course menu. These should match to affirm to the user the relationship between Lesson tool links and specific course tools. See attached screenshot.

column2: • Go into Assignments, and create an Assignment.
• Go into Lessons, and choose Add Content > Link to an assignment. Select the assignment to link to and click Use selected item.
• Notice that the icon that appears beside the link you just created is different than the icon that appears in the course menu for the Assignment tool. Same is true for links to Tests or Quizzes.

column1:

[SAK-38483] Swapped User Roles is not session-specific,https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/browse/SAK-38483,10057,SAK,Sakai,"

I just entered access view on my iPhone, and was surprised to see that I was suddenly in access view on my desktop. This is highly unexpected. It could cause serious trouble if multiple people share an account. I also imagine a person entering access view on a machine at in the office, going to another location, and finding that they're stuck in access view there.
When I went into access view on my iPhone and refresh my screen on my desktop:
I think that makes it a blocker. If the banner showed it and you could do exit access, I would still think it's a bug, but not a blocker.

",,45147,SAK-38483,Swapped User Roles is not session-specific,10007,https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/secure/viewavatar?size=medium&avatarId=10303&avatarType=issuetype,Bug,10000,https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/images/icons/priorities/blocker.svg,Blocker,10025,https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/images/icons/statuses/generic.png,Indicates QA is complete and an issue has been tested and verified (Migrated on 12 Oct 2021 03:05 UTC),Verified,3,done,green,10000,Fixed,6164d523048360006aaa2084,KERNEL TEAM,6164d3a564ff010071b75c26,Charles Hedrick,"Wed, 27 Apr 2016 07:37:13 -0400","Wed, 25 Apr 2018 11:18:08 -0400",10.8 [Tentative],Kernel,0,5,Development,customfield_10000,com.atlassian.jira.plugins.jira-development-integration-plugin:devsummarycf,Rank,0|1090tc:,customfield_10019,com.pyxis.greenhopper.jira:gh-lexo-rank,Sprint,customfield_10020,com.pyxis.greenhopper.jira:gh-sprint,"Wed, 1 Jun 2016 11:44:43 -0400",,,,,,,Test Plan,customfield_10038,com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.customfieldtypes:textarea,[CHART] Date of First Response,customfield_10024,com.atlassian.jira.ext.charting:firstresponsedate,,,11.0,,40351,70121:ec0fd122-4a2d-4492-a966-78d3f9aa9080,"Wed, 27 Apr 2016 15:20:27 -0400","

I'm testing this and I'm reproducing it (with just two separate browsers) and it goes all the way back to 10, but it doesn't seem the same there.

In 10, if you are in one site, role swap in one browser then it removes the ability to role swap from the other browser (after a refresh) but all of the tools appear normal, they're not in a role swapped state. You are just unable to use this feature while the ""other"" person is using it.
In 11 & 12, it's the same except for the tools that the browser that role swapped has entered. For this tools, it takes the role swapped permissions for the new browser.
For example on 11, login on two browser

column2: • Go to a course, in browser #1 Click View Site As student
• Go to browser #2 refresh, link to roleswap disappears, but content remains the same (if you were on the home)
• Go to a tool like announcements, in both 10 and 12 you see the instructor view
• In browser #1 go to a tool like announcements, you see the student view
• In browser #2 go to the tool you went to in browser #2, you see the role swapped view

column1:
I'm not too sure what's actually doing this but it is crossing over sessions based on this user id. Blocker, I don't know I kind of agree with you, it is more confusing in 12 I think. I think if there was a visual indicator like you're saying it would be fine, showing that something is going on.

",74174,70121:ec0fd122-4a2d-4492-a966-78d3f9aa9080,"Wed, 27 Apr 2016 15:39:00 -0400","

So it looks like allowAccessSite calls getUserEffectiveRole in SakaiSecurity which is session specific.
But when setUserEffectiveRole is run, it puts some values into the cache in the resetSecurityCache which isn't session specific which is leading this to be a disconnect.

The cache is user/function/realm which isn't session specific. So I'm not really sure the easiest way to fix this? Maybe you could put whether or not the user is role swapped also the cache instead of the session? This seems more reasonable than making the cache session specific to account for account sharing.

",91048,6164d3a564ff010071b75c26,"Wed, 27 Apr 2016 15:45:07 -0400","

Is the cache specific to one tomcat instance? If so, your solution won't work.

","

column2: • Go to the same course as the same user (instructor) in two separate browsers
• In browser #1 Click View Site As student
• Ensure that browser #2 does not enter View Site As student ""mode"" and that the user retains the instructor role in tools.
• For good measure, In browser #1 refresh and ensure that user remains in View Site As student ""mode"" with student permissions in the tools.

column1:
",Relate,28962,SAK-7924,relates to,10008,,,,,,107759,6164d3a564ff010071b75c26,"Wed, 27 Apr 2016 16:03:37 -0400","

I think we should bite the bullet and fix it right. If the role swap is in the session, it's in memory, so it's not expensive to check it. Have the code that reads role / permission from the cache check to see if role is swapped. Then the fake value doesn't have to go into the cache.

I agree that making the security cache session-specific doesn't make sense.

",124421,70121:ec0fd122-4a2d-4492-a966-78d3f9aa9080,"Wed, 27 Apr 2016 16:12:31 -0400","

Yes, currently the cache is specific to a tomcat instance, but the I believe unless you're in a terracotta clustered environment then the session is also local to the instance as well. I've never heard of anyone running setup like this.

But you're right for that to work, you'd need a cluster-wide cache or some other way to indicate to tell that another session from this same user is in a role swapped state. Like something that would get all sessions for a user and iterate through them. I don't see any api call that returns the list of sessions for a specific user, so that might need to be added?

",40361,557058:d4bf1967-6188-4b29-bf4a-95cf874b4a08,"Thu, 28 Apr 2016 06:47:47 -0400","

Yeah I agree here with that adding ""super user"" roles to the cache should be avoided...
<a href=""https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/browse/SAK-30691"" class=""jira-issue-macro-key issue-link""  title="""View Site As" delayed response Sakai 11"" >
you can see its purging entries from the cache but if they were never in the cache to begin with its likely that
<a href=""https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/browse/SAK-30691"" class=""jira-issue-macro-key issue-link""  title="""View Site As" delayed response Sakai 11"" >

would've never happened.

",191153,70121:ec0fd122-4a2d-4492-a966-78d3f9aa9080,"Thu, 28 Apr 2016 07:35:17 -0400","

Were you planning on working on this Charles Hedrick? I can assign to Earle as he said he might have some time.

",40362,6164d3a564ff010071b75c26,"Thu, 28 Apr 2016 07:49:00 -0400",

maybe eventually. I still have a backlog of PR's for lessons.

,62312,SAK-31017,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,"Wed, 27 Apr 2016 19:20:27 +0000",[CHART] Time in Status,customfield_10025,com.atlassian.jira.ext.charting:timeinstatus,,,,,11.0,,,,,,,,,,,,,74188,6164d3a564ff010071b75c26,"Thu, 28 Apr 2016 11:31:15 -0400","

How about this:
In SakaiSecurity, makeCacheKey, we have the userid and realm. If the userID is the current user check whether the role is swapped in the current session. If so, return
That would keep caching separate for normal and swapped roles.

Unfortunately I'm not sure just what forms reference can be.

",157837,6164d3a564ff010071b75c26,"Thu, 28 Apr 2016 12:11:19 -0400","

The following seems to do it. I'm just not sure if it's enough:
@@ -479,6 +479,13 @@ public abstract class SakaiSecurity implements SecurityService, Observer
// NOTE: userId can be null for this, others cannot be
<a href=""https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/browse/SAK-30691"" class=""jira-issue-macro-key issue-link""  title="""View Site As" delayed response Sakai 11"" >

has no relation to this issue as it is just resetting the tools state in the current site and has nothing to do with authz/security.

",57372,6164d3a564ff010071b75c26,"Fri, 29 Apr 2016 10:54:43 -0400",

I'm pretty sure a slightly improved version of my patch will be a complete fix

,57376,6164d3a564ff010071b75c26,"Mon, 2 May 2016 06:54:12 -0400","

the two changes to consider from the code I pasted in:

column2: • when permissions are computed, the realm ID is split on ""/"", and each component is checked against getUserEffectiveRole. I have no idea why that makes sense, but it might be needed here. Look for ""FIXME"" in DbAuthzGroupService.java

• if we support more than one type of role swap, it might be better to use role + separator + userId. The obvious separator is @, but I wasn't sure whether any assumptions are made about how @ is used in the key elsewhere in the code.

column1:
",74200,557058:d4bf1967-6188-4b29-bf4a-95cf874b4a08,"Mon, 2 May 2016 06:56:35 -0400","

View Site As is session based, meaning it stores a key in the session to indicate the user has swapped roles, however the SecurityService was caching authz checks which replace the users real role in the site and thereby changing their role for other sessions on the same tomcat instance. The approach used here is to prevent roleswap authz checks to be cached which eliminates the users swapped role authz from being view by other sessions.

Also the DbAuthzGroupService contains logic for dealing with role swaps which the SecurityService does not so it makes sense for the SecurityService to defer.

",,,,,,,,,91073,6164d3a564ff010071b75c26,"Mon, 2 May 2016 07:00:00 -0400",

What the advantage of not caching over caching separately for swapped roles as in my patch? unlock is done so often that it would seem that caching would make sense.

,107783,557058:d4bf1967-6188-4b29-bf4a-95cf874b4a08,"Mon, 2 May 2016 07:02:14 -0400","

Any caching of role swapped authz checks is going to bleed into other sessions since, I was able to confirm this using 2 or more sessions in the same site while role swapped.

",157851,6164d3a564ff010071b75c26,"Mon, 2 May 2016 08:23:18 -0400","

> Any caching of role swapped authz checks is going to bleed into other sessions since, I was able to confirm this using 2 or more sessions in the same site while role swapped.
Look at my code. The idea is that you use a separate cache key for swapped sessions. The cache key includes userid and realmid. I added a token to the beginning of userid for swapped sessions.

I got the code working and verified that it does handle things right. I'd be willing to produce a PR using a slightly modified version. I'd rather do that than accept a patch that doesn't cache.

",40378,6164d3a564ff010071b75c26,"Mon, 2 May 2016 08:47:43 -0400","

In addition to the code above, we need a change to cacheRealmPermsChanged

}

",141171,557058:d4bf1967-6188-4b29-bf4a-95cf874b4a08,"Mon, 2 May 2016 12:53:38 -0400","

I would rather add the session id to the cache key, as otherwise you will see issues. We are only talking about not caching a single user while they are in ""View Site As"", acceptable IMO.

",174479,6164d3a564ff010071b75c26,"Mon, 2 May 2016 16:23:15 -0400",

adding session ID is fine. I thought you weren't going to cache those entries at all.

,191174,6164d3a564ff010071b75c26,"Tue, 3 May 2016 10:56:44 -0400","

I've generated a PR. It's not pretty, but it makes a reasonable effort to be consistent with DbAuthz and portal. Portal is relevant because there's no point invalidating data for roles that no one can swap to.

I'm reasonably sure that even if there are subtle issues it will only affect swapped users.

[SAK-31062] End time is not updated initially when revising calendar entry,https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/browse/SAK-31062,10057,SAK,Sakai,"

Previously stored ""end time"" is not shown when accessing the screen. Steps to reproduce:
-Add a new event and revise it.
-Or when adding a new event, enter the frequency screen it and go back.

You'll notice the end time appears with default (0) values. If you click on any field on that screen, then it's automatically updated with the correct value. It also works fine if you save it with the wrong value.

[SAK-31056] Audio Recording in CK Editor not Working,https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/browse/SAK-31056,10057,SAK,Sakai,"

As a student/access role, going into the assignment and clicking the Audio Record icon prompts you to record as it should. Once you post your recording, two players appear in the CK Editor labeled as Player 1 of 2 and Player 2 of 2 (Fig. 1). If you were then to attach a file to the assignment you will get an warning that some of the HTML is being blocked AND it deletes Player 1 of 2 (Fig. 2). I cannot confirm if this will have a negative affect when listening to the clip during grading.

Another problem would be if you only recorded an audio file using the record button on the CK Editor, you cannot submit just the audio recording. It appears to think that you have not submitted anything. (Fig 3) If you attempt to submit just the audio one of the players will be deleted again and you still cannot submit.

Lastly, as the instructor. If a student managed to submit an audio recording (ie. including some text in the CK editor) the instructor is not presented with the player. Rather the grading interface only provides the outline of the player . The only workaround for this is to go into the source, find the audio file link and download the file
The only other time I have seen the player work is after successfully submitting it when you are taken to an overview of your submission (as a student/access)

While I only came across this in assignments, this may occur in all tools that use the CK Editor.

","OS X 10.11, Firefox 45.0.2",53764,SAK-31056,Audio Recording in CK Editor not Working,10007,https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/secure/viewavatar?size=medium&avatarId=10303&avatarType=issuetype,Bug,10002,https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/images/icons/priorities/major.svg,Major,5,https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/images/icons/statuses/resolved.png,"A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. [SAK-31055] Cannot remove preconfigured tools on tool selection page in Manage Tools,https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/browse/SAK-31055,10057,SAK,Sakai,"

Preconfigured tools that can have multiple instances (e.g. Lessons, External Tool, News, & Web Content) cannot be removed by clicking the X next to the tool on the ""Course Site Tools"" selection page.

If you choose to remove one of these tools by clicking the X, the tool is NOT deselected in the full list of tools on the page. When removing other tools like Announcements, Assignments, etc. by this method, they are deselected from the full tool list, so you are confident that the tool will NOT show up in the tool list on the confirmation page.
The only way to remove preconfigured tools is to deselect them from the full tool list.

<a href=""https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/browse/SAK-23905"" class=""jira-issue-macro-key issue-link""  title=""New Tool selection page does not remove tools when clicking the red 'x' in list of selected tools"" >
Here's a video demonstrating the issue: http://www.screencast.com/t/n9ARNXKuD

This testing was done on the Nightly 11x Maintenance Branch on Oracle.

[SAK-31054] "Invalid URL" alert appears when adding multiple instances of Web Content tool,https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/browse/SAK-31054,10057,SAK,Sakai,"

The ""Alert: Invalid URL"" message appears when users have not entered any text into the ""Source"" box and they choose to add more instances of the Web Content tool.

The alert appears because it seems to be checking the Source box for the first instance and reads that there's nothing there, so the alert is thrown. This isn't very helpful for users, however, especially if they had selected the option to add 3 instances of the tool and pressed ""Continue"" without providing addresses. The alert stacks on top of itself.

column2: • Select Web Content tool to add and press continue
• In the ""More Web Content Tools?"" section, choose 1 more.

column1: Ideally, the site would recognize that these boxes are simply empty and proceed to add the tools that DO have valid URLs while deleting the empty instances.

Testing was done on Nightly 11x Maintenance Branch on Oracle.

[SAK-31053] on first launch, a pop-up containing the web content link to an external web site is blocked by the browser,https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/browse/SAK-31053,10057,SAK,Sakai,"

All this was done under Chrome and Vivaldi browsers

As user with site.upd (ie Instructor), add web content tool that links to http://www.bbc.co.uk/, when the setup is complete, click on the newly created item in the LHS page menu. A pop up is blocked - do NOT opt to unblock.

This is the same for an Instructor or Student. If an instructor sets up the tool but doesnt click on it and then a students visits the site and clicks, the pop up is blocked. Basically, whoever clicks on the tool first sees a blocked popup, all subsequent visits are without incident.

Basically, the pop-up is blocked fort the first click on the tool and thereafter it's not blocked.

Not to peruse grades (that is a gradebook function). Therefore I would not expect the breadcrumbs to change because the breadcrumbs are pointing to the Forum. The grades may be a different story. I wonder if it should be so easy to change the associated Gradebook item with a Forum? I don't believe it is in the Assignments tool. So the UI seems a little confusing to me.

[SAK-31051] truncated URL String returned in content entity feed for Web Link resources,https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/browse/SAK-31051,10057,SAK,Sakai,"

For URL-type resources with URL String longer than 38 characters, Sakai truncates the URL String to the first 38 characters, appends a date/time stamp to it, and stores an access link in this field instead of the original URL.
The modified URL is returned in ""URL"" field of the content entity feed. An sample value is shown here:

When requested, the above url was handled with AccessServlet, which finds the original URL, but immediately does a redirect to the web page. So this response stream actually contains the web page's content, instead of the web page url String.

The request is to provide the original URL in the entity feed. It could be inside the original ""URL"" attribute, or as a new field like ""original URL"".

[SAK-31049] assignments, gradebook: creating % GB item with relative weight, then associating assignment to it, causes inflated grades,https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/browse/SAK-31049,10057,SAK,Sakai,"

Issue: You can create hugely inflated percentage scores for an assignment as follows. Your site has a Gradebook with grade entry in percentages, and you create a gradebook item with a Gradebook item relative weight (e.g. 5). Create an assignment of the same name with a point grade of 100 and associate it with the gradebook item you just created. Submit the assignment as at least two students. As instructor, give the students different scores (e.g. 80, 90), and release the grades. If you view the Gradebook, you'll see that the students' scores are e.g. 1600%, 1800%.

An instructor apparently discovered this issue a long time ago, but did not report it until now. I've successfully reproduced it in our local 2.9.1 and 10.2 instances, and on nightly2 in both 10.x maintenance branch and 11.

column2: • In Gradebook, go to Gradebook Setup and select Percentages as the Grade Entry option. Save the changes.
• Create a new gradebook item, and enter a Gradebook Item Relative Weight of 5.
• Go to Assignments and create an assignment with the same name as the gradebook item.
<li>Choose the following options for the assignment:

column3: • Under Grading, select Associate with existing Gradebook entry and choose the gradebook item you created with the same name as the assignment.

column1: Additional note: You might need to change the assignment's open date if you're testing before noon.

column2: • Log in as instructor and Grade the assignment. Give each student a different score, e.g. 80 and 90.
• Go to Gradebook. The students' grades for the assignment will be hugely inflated, e.g. 1600%, 1800%.

column1:
Win 7 Firefox 45.0.2",62332,SAK-31049,"assignments, gradebook: creating % GB item with relative weight, then associating assignment to it, causes inflated grades",10007,https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/secure/viewavatar?size=medium&avatarId=10303&avatarType=issuetype,Bug,10001,https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/images/icons/priorities/critical.svg,Critical,1,https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/images/icons/statuses/open.png,The issue is open and ready for the assignee to start work on it.,Open,2,new,blue-gray,-1,Unresolved,6164d8abc7bea400699b1b9e,Core Team,5d275d132c5a110c1d476990,Tiffany Stull,"Tue, 26 Apr 2016 04:56:34 -0400","Wed, 6 Dec 2017 15:27:06 -0500",2.9.1,Assignments,1,11,Development,customfield_10000,com.atlassian.jira.plugins.jira-development-integration-plugin:devsummarycf,Rank,0|1090nk:,customfield_10019,com.pyxis.greenhopper.jira:gh-lexo-rank,Sprint,customfield_10020,com.pyxis.greenhopper.jira:gh-sprint,,Gradebook,Gradebook Classic,,,,,[CHART] Date of First Response,customfield_10024,com.atlassian.jira.ext.charting:firstresponsedate,,,,,,,,191191,70121:24ac83d3-f5a7-4a57-be09-13263a37e0cd,"Thu, 5 May 2016 08:09:25 -0400","

Hi Tiffany Stull, thank you for raising this! This is a longstanding issue, and one that doesn't have a clear resolution.

This potential for grade inflation with associated GB items has been around since at least 2.9 (potentially longer), and is a fundamental part of how associated GB item scoring works. It affects all Gradebooks (1 & 2 & NG). As it has existed for so long, we don't think this is a blocker for 11.
Here is what is happening in this issue:

Regardless of whether ""Points"" or ""Percentage"" is chosen as the GB grade entry type, the value applied to a Gradebook item is its ""point value"" (even if, when ""Percentage"" is chosen, it is called ""Relative item weight""). The issue, however, is that Assignments/Forum entries can be associated with a Gradebook item regardless of their own point values (which perhaps shouldn't be the case).
You can therefore end up with an assignment worth 100 points being associated with a GB item worth 5 points.

Everything in the GB is points-based. When the GB is in ""Percentage"" mode, it is still using points in the back-end, but is then converting them into percentages on the front-end. Scores sent from external tools are also sent over as points, not percentages. Therefore, when a student gets 80/100, it is not a percentage of 80% that is sent to the GB, but rather 80 points.
This is why you can end up with 80/5, hence the 1600%.

This is definitely an annoyance, but not a bug, per se. Modifying this behavior, however, would require changes to the grading model, with dynamic percentages getting sent to the GB, getting converted back into points (say, 4 points out of 5), then re-rendered as a percentage to the user (again providing 80%).

We think this is a nice-to-have feature, but given the fact that it has existed through multiple releases, we don't think it's blocker/critical.

",157888,70121:ec0fd122-4a2d-4492-a966-78d3f9aa9080,"Mon, 9 May 2016 10:42:09 -0400","

Lowering to critical based on the comments from Kyle Blythe

",191289,6164d3a564ff010071b75c26,"Tue, 7 Jun 2016 05:46:37 -0400","

There's another scenario that's more likely:

column2: • Create a GB item with maximum of 10.
• Create an assignment with maximum of 5. Associate it with the existing item.
• Grade an assignment. Give it a score of 5. From the assignment UI it looks like full credit. But in gradebook calculations it's treated as 50%.

column1:
","Thu, 5 May 2016 12:09:25 +0000",Relate,27315,SAK-29205,relates to,10008,19327,inflatedclassavg.png,9623,ug:47795aa8-f2b3-4b1d-bef5-85b7f22bc340,"Tue, 26 Apr 2016 04:54:37 -0400",91203,6164d3a564ff010071b75c26,"Wed, 8 Jun 2016 04:37:25 -0400","

Rutgers has a fix for this. When you link to an existing item, we remove the item and recreate it as an external item with the same name. So it looks to the user like we've linked to the existing item, but it's now external. We'll give you a PR for that. While a more major rewrite is probably needed, that's not possible for 11.0. Our fix has been in production, so I think it's reasonable for 11.0.
We consider this blocker level because it can lead to bad grades in scenarios that are different than the one mentioned by Kyle.

Incidentally, our fix was part of bringing consistency to Assignment and Samigo. We added the ability for Samigo to link to an existing item. We'll also issue a PR for that, though it may be too late for 11.0.

We'd like to see this code abstracted somehow so that we don't need to do it everywhere. At that point I'd use it in Lessons, which currently has several gradebook links but doesn't let you link to existing items.

",124575,70121:24ac83d3-f5a7-4a57-be09-13263a37e0cd,"Wed, 8 Jun 2016 05:22:18 -0400","

Hi Charles Hedrick,

I agree that the scenario you provided can lead to a great deal of confusion, as you end up with two wildly different scores in Assignments and the Gradebook. This is a fundamental issue with associated GB items in Assignments, Forums, etc.

I'm not sure how I feel about this approach, though. Can the instructor still provide scores in the GB, with those scores porting back into Assignments? This is pretty much the sole utility of associated GB items - the ability to grade in both the external tool and the GB. That, and perhaps the ability to use different names for the external tool item/GB item.

If this is not the case, and the externally created GB item ends up not being editable in the GB, then this is just providing instructors with an unnecessary workflow. The additional steps taken to create a GB item, then associate it with the Assignment, are effectively the same as just creating the item in Assignments to begin with. And instructors lose the ability to add grades in both locations.
Long-term, if we want to prevent these score discrepancies from occurring, there either needs to be:

column2: • a change to the grading model that sends percentages to the GB, which can then be converted into the correct point scale, or
• some sort of validation in the external tools that forces the external tool to use the same total point value as the associated GB item.

column1: If this is a blocker, perhaps a good short-term solution is to just provide an info box in the Assignment creation page that appears upon selecting the option to ""Associate with existing Gradebook item"". This could just inform the user that they need to ensure the Assignment's point value matches that of the GB item.

What do you think?

",57504,5d275d132c5a110c1d476990,"Wed, 8 Jun 2016 05:59:04 -0400","

Kyle Blythe, my understanding from

<a href=""https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/browse/SAK-29176"" class=""jira-issue-macro-key issue-link""  title=""Allow samigo when publishing a test, to link it to an existing non-externally maintained gradebook item."" >

was that the feature Charles Hedrick describes would allow the same behavior (from the user's perspective) of currently linking a GB item to an assignment, with the exception that you could only link one assignment/assessment to one GB item. If this is not the case, and the process of making an external item prevents you from editing the grades from the Gradebook, I agree with you, Kyle Blythe; it's not an acceptable handling of the linking issue because many instructors specifically use linking to enter grades for an assignment all on one page, rather than going to each individual student's page in Assignments.

",74333,6164d3a564ff010071b75c26,"Wed, 8 Jun 2016 07:53:54 -0400","

Currently items work differently depending upon whether in Assignments you asked to create a new gradebook item or associate with an existing item.
If you create a new gradebook item, the gradebook shows it as externally maintained. You can only change the grade in Assignments, and the gradebook arithmetic is right.
If you associate an assignment with an existing gradebook item, you can change the score either place. However

column2: • if the point setting isn't the same both places, gradebook calculations are wrong
• If the gradebook is in percent mode, the gradebook handling is completely messed up

column1: It might be useful to do a rewrite to fix these things. But the simplest solution for 11.0 is to make assignments linked to existing items work the same way as assignments linked to new items.

I have a patch so that when you associate an assignment with an existing gradebook item, the maximum points is sent to the gradebook. I would have proposed that patch except that it fails for percent mode. I think it could be fixed for percent mode. But I'm not going to propose this approach because I think it's unexpected to have items behave differently depending upon whether you created a new gradebook item or associated with an existing item. Unexpected behavior is an invitation to errors.

",91205,5d275d132c5a110c1d476990,"Wed, 8 Jun 2016 08:00:49 -0400","

Charles Hedrick I agree that whether you make the assignment associate to a gradebook item or ""add to gradebook"", the behavior should be the same.

That said, we definitely have instructors who would be (justifiably) upset if they could not use whatever method (be it the existing method of ""associate to item"" or some other) to be able to edit the grades within the Gradebook. Because Assignments offers no way to enter all the students' grades for an assignment on the same page, it's extremely frustrating for instructors with large numbers of students to grade in the Assignments tool.

",22817,SAK-29103,36196,SAK-29176,is related to,,,,,,,,,,,22636,inflatedstudentsscores.png,9282,ug:47795aa8-f2b3-4b1d-bef5-85b7f22bc340,"Tue, 26 Apr 2016 04:54:37 -0400",16008,releasedgradesinassignments.png,14251,ug:47795aa8-f2b3-4b1d-bef5-85b7f22bc340,"Tue, 26 Apr 2016 04:54:37 -0400",,,,,,,,,,,#11qatestfest,CoreTeam,62198,SAK-29780,10.2,bcreview,11.0,,,,,,,,,,,124577,70121:24ac83d3-f5a7-4a57-be09-13263a37e0cd,"Wed, 8 Jun 2016 08:28:17 -0400","

Edit: Ah, I posted this without refreshing the screen, and didn't see Tiffany Stull's response.

I agree with Tiffany on this. In my experience, the only reason users take the ""associate with existing Gradebook item"" approach (because it is actually rather inconvenient, and requires several more steps to accomplish than the traditional ""Add item to Gradebook"" item-creation process) is because it allows you to be able to enter/edit grades in either tool. Externally maintained GB items don't offer this ability, with the GB functioning more as a grade repository. If people have a mix of manually created GB items and externally maintained GB items, they associate with existing GB items in order to be able to do all of their grading within the Gradebook.
Without the ability to enter grades in both locations, I'm not sure I understand the utility of having an ""associate with existing Gradebook item"" option at all.

On a related note, I'm not seeing any issue with percent mode grading (at least, not when the assignment's total points and the GB item's ""relative item weight"" match up...as expected, things can get very weird very quickly when these don't match up). If there's an issue around percentage mode, however, perhaps the ability to use percentage mode with associated gb items should be limited?

",157978,5d275d132c5a110c1d476990,"Wed, 8 Jun 2016 08:55:22 -0400","

I'm not sure if there's a way to do it, but would making the Assignments tool recognize when the Gradebook is set in percentages help fix the issue?

When associating a forum/topic to a GB item, I think Forums now detects whether the Gradebook is graded in points or percentages, and will only allow you to select the corresponding option for the associated forum/topic. The Assignments tool ONLY allows point grades to send to GB.

",,,,,174608,6164d3a564ff010071b75c26,"Wed, 8 Jun 2016 09:11:02 -0400","

I just tried some experiments. I'm not sure I understand the behavior.
I tried this with a version of the Assignment code that feeds maxpoints to the Gradebook when you associate an Assignment with an existing item.
I'm finding that percent mode seems to work.

column2: • create a gradebook item with weight of 5
• create an assignment with a maximum point value of 50 and link it to the gradebook item

column1: It shows in gradebook as 100%, which is correct. If you edit the item it shows a weight of 50.
I created a second item, which is not linked, with a weight of 5. I entered a grade of 0.
The average now shows as 90.9%. I believe it's using the 50 as both the maximum point value and the weight.
I think this is unexpected, but it's not unexpected in quite the way I expected.
For the moment I'm not proposing to use the patch that I'm trying out.

I'm going to generate a PR for the Rutgers code. The community can take it or not if they prefer.

",40509,6164d3a564ff010071b75c26,"Wed, 8 Jun 2016 09:15:33 -0400","

Forum lets you choose an existing gb item, and doesn't let you choose a maximum point value. I'm guessing it keeps the value in the gradebook and not locally, in which case this problem doesn't exist. Assignment 2 works the same way. I think the core team believes that's how all the tools should work. Making Assignment work that way for 11.0 is probably not practical.

",175322,557058:7074e357-325c-4f04-880f-321ecd7c7dc5,"Thu, 20 Jul 2017 09:33:31 -0400",

I'm assuming this is still a problem in the new gradebook (gradebookng)?

[SAK-37803] custom css needs to be after tool.css,https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/browse/SAK-37803,10057,SAK,Sakai,

Someone tried changing the color of H4. It didn't work because it was overridden by tool.css. The inline code puts things from <head> before tool.css. So I've moved custom css out of head into body.

[SAK-34170] Multiple Choice Ques: Tab key unselects Correct Answer radio button in Firefox,https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/browse/SAK-34170,10057,SAK,Sakai,"

Using the Tab key on keyboard normally moves from text box to text box, but in Firefox it moves from text box to radio button to text box. If a Correct Answer is selected, using Tab to fill in other answer options removes the Correct Answer selection. The question can be saved (even with no Correct Answer selected) and will be added to the test. In the Questions: Test Title page, the question is shown with D marked as correct.

column2: • Select radio button next to A for Correct Answer
• Use Tab key twice to type in B text box - note A is no longer selected
• Continue using Tab to type in C and D text boxes
• Note question is listed with D as Correct Answer

column1:

",,,,,74232,6164e7b0a707100069fd3655,"Fri, 6 May 2016 04:09:09 -0400","

The main problem in this ticket is that you need to select first the 'Enable negative marking' option for enable the 'Negative point value' field in all cases (Single Correct, Multiple Correct). That's wrong because the 'Enable negative marking' option should only affects to the 'Single correct' questions.
The 'Negative point value' should be enabled when you select the 'Multiple Correct, Single Selection' or 'Multiple Correct, Multiple Selection'->'All or Nothing' options.
I believe there is a big confusion about all the multiple choice options. This is the behaviour that has been working for the last years:
Single Correct (Enable Partial Credit)
Single Correct (Enable Negative Marking)
Single Correct (partial Credit property disabled)
Multiple Correct, Single Selection
Multiple Correct, Multiple Selection->Right Less Wrong
Multiple Correct, Multiple Selection->All or Nothing
- if the property samigo.partialCreditEnabled is enabled, there is 2 suboptions:
* Enable partial credit: This suboption belongs only to 'Single correct' questions. If you select this suboption, the partial credit will only be enabled in the 'Single correct' questions.

* Enable negative marking: This suboption belongs only to 'Single correct' questions. If you select this suboption, the 'Negative point value' field will only be enabled in 'Single correct' questions.
- (if the property samigo.partialCreditEnabled is disabled: 1 suboption)
* Negative point value: This suboption appears under the 'Single Correct' option.
* Negative point value: This suboption appears under the 'Multiple Correct, Single Selection' option.
* Right Less Wrong: This suboption is not compatible with the  'Negative point value' field so the  'Negative point value' should not appear when this suboption is selected.
** 'Negative point value': The 'Negative point value' should appear when the 'All or Nothing' is selected (under the 'All or Nothing' option).
- If the 'minimum score' feature is enabled (property 'samigo.allowMinScore') then 'Negative point value' field should be disabled in all cases or it should not appear.
- The 'Enable partial credit' (property samigo.partialCreditEnabled) only affects to the 'Single Correct' questions.
- The 'Negative point value' from the 'Single Correct' question should be disabled or it should not appear when the 'Enable partial credit' option is selected.
- The 'Enable partial credit' option should not appear and has no effect on any option when you select the 'Multiple Correct, Single Selection' or 'Multiple Correct, Multiple Selection' options.
The only cases where the 'Negative point value' field should be disabled or it should not be displayed are:
<pre>- When 'Multiple Correct, Single Correct' and 'Enable partial credit' options are selected.
- When 'Multiple Correct, Multiple Selection' and 'Right Less Wrong' options are selected.
In each other cases, the 'Negative point value' should be enabled.

",124478,557058:d4bf1967-6188-4b29-bf4a-95cf874b4a08,"Fri, 6 May 2016 09:05:05 -0400",

[SAK-34257] Unable to leave default grading logic settings - Negative Marking is enabled automatically,https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/browse/SAK-34257,10057,SAK,Sakai,"

Multiple Choice questions have radio button options Enable Negative Marking and Enable Partial Credit. Both are left empty by default, so question would be graded using default grading logic. Saving a question without selecting either radio button, and then returning to edit the question shows the Enable Negative Marking radio button selected.

column2: • Fill out required fields, do not enable Negative Marking or Partial Credit
• Click Edit next to the question - note Negative Marking is now enabled

[SAK-36790] Editing Question copied from Question Pool redirects to broken Assessment page,https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/browse/SAK-36790,10057,SAK,Sakai,"

Clicking the Edit link next to a question after copying it from a Question Pool results in an error. The first two times (using Multiple Choice questions), Edit redirected to a broken Assessments page (Broken.png). The third time (Survey Matrix of Choice question) was an Error page, stack trace attached.

• Insert a question: Copy from Question Pool
• Check box next to the question, click Copy

caused by: javax.servlet.ServletException: failed to populateItemBean.\
caused by: java.lang.RuntimeException: failed to populateItemBean.\

[SAK-37023] Edit Question pages are different when accessed from Question Pool tab,https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/browse/SAK-37023,10057,SAK,Sakai,"

The Edit Questions page is formatted differently for questions in a new/existing Assessment than questions created in a Question Pool. There are differences for all question types, attachments are from Multiple Choice. Most changes are Bootstrap formatting/spacing, Feedback (optional) text boxes and metadata
Note: this issue is persistent with ALL question types

• Note spacing differences, Feedback boxes and metadata

From talking to Molly Kelsey , the instructor creates an assessment using a pool of questions. If you add individual feedback or meta data as instructor, and the student goes to take the exam, it keeps them from completing the exam. Therefore I'm making this a blocker.

",191472,70121:ec0fd122-4a2d-4492-a966-78d3f9aa9080,"Mon, 12 Sep 2016 07:15:07 -0400","

Created

<a href=""https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/browse/SAK-36216"" class=""jira-issue-macro-key issue-link""  title=""Adding feedback or metadata to an assessment created from a pool prevents delivery"" >

to capture this comment as it seems like a different issue, dropped the priority of this one since this seems like it's related to formatting in authoring.

",75643,5d275d132c5a110c1d476990,"Fri, 20 Oct 2017 04:45:19 -0400","

Feedback boxes available when authoring a test from scratch include only the Feedback boxes enabled in the Settings screen prior to authoring/editing questions.  If Question-Level, Selection-Level or Both are not selected for Feedback Authoring in Settings > Grading and Feedback, none of these boxes will be available when authoring a test from scratch.  However, they must always be available in a question pool.

The view in the original screenshot is difficult to manage but having only one line is difficult also. For a group with 10 participants, the list is extremely long. If there are 5 or 6 groups and one is large, finding the check box to select a specific smaller group will be very difficult.

I don't see an obvious solution, maybe set to show roughly three names per line? Is there a known average group size? If it was set to display that group size well, the rest would still be better than the current settings. It could help to move the checkboxes to the far left (next to Group Title) so there is no reason to scroll all the way over except to see the members of the longer list.

[SAK-31018] Improve a gradebook service: send the scores from External Tools to Gradebook so that the scores are not released to students by default,https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/browse/SAK-31018,10057,SAK,Sakai,"

Currently there is a gradebook service that allows to send scores from External tools (Assignments, Samigo, Lessons, Forums) to Gradebook. This gradebook service sends the scores so that they are released to students by default.
This gradebook service should be improved by allowing to send the scores from External tools to Gradebook so that the scores are not released to students by default.

This gradebook service is used in Gradebook, Gradebook2 and Gradebook NG.

[SAK-34782] Allow instructors to choose whether the score will be released (in GB) to students or not when they send the scores to the Gradebook,https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/browse/SAK-34782,10057,SAK,Sakai,"

Currently the instructors are able to send the assessment scores to Gradebook so that the scores are released to the students by default.

This behaviour could be improved by adding an assessment configuration option that allows intructors to choose whether the score will be released to students or not when Samigo sends the scores to the Gradebook.
There should be a Sakai property to set the default value of this assessment configuration option. i.e:
samigo.scoresReleasedToGB = false -> By default, the assessment scores will not be released to students when Samigo sends the scores to the Gradebook
This new assessment configuration option should allows to change its value after the assessment scores have already been released to Gradebook.
Send scores to Gradebook immediately, regardless of options below
is not clear enough. Our suggestion is to change text to:
<pre>Send scores to Gradebook immediately, regardless of options below (i.e. If this option is selected the scores will be sent to
Gradebook inmediatly regardless of the instructor has selected ""No Feedback will be displayed to the student"" or other feedback option).

",,58062,SAK-34782,Allow instructors to choose whether the score will be released (in GB) to students or not when they send the scores to the Gradebook,10012,https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/secure/viewavatar?size=medium&avatarId=10315&avatarType=issuetype,Feature Request,10002,https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/images/icons/priorities/major.svg,Major,1,https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/images/icons/statuses/open.png,The issue is open and ready for the assignee to start work on it.,Open,2,new,blue-gray,-1,Unresolved,6164d8abc7bea400699b1b9e,Core Team,6164e7b0a707100069fd3655,Raúl Sánchez Vegas,"Mon, 25 Apr 2016 01:54:07 -0400","Tue, 4 May 2021 06:54:27 -0400",11.0,Tests & Quizzes (Samigo),4,5,11 status,customfield_10122,com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.customfieldtypes:select,Development,,customfield_10000,com.atlassian.jira.plugins.jira-development-integration-plugin:devsummarycf,Rank,customfield_10019,com.pyxis.greenhopper.jira:gh-lexo-rank,,,,,,,0|1090eg:,Sprint,customfield_10020,com.pyxis.greenhopper.jira:gh-sprint,[CHART] Date of First Response,customfield_10024,com.atlassian.jira.ext.charting:firstresponsedate,,,,,107737,557058:f40ed6cf-0104-4dc6-88be-9f2bbc0cae39,"Mon, 25 Apr 2016 06:04:24 -0400","

I think the biggest issue here is whether the scores go immediately to the Gradebook, or whether their arrival there abides by the feedback date selected in the Feedback section. Instructors should have the flexibility to say Yes, send the grades to the gradebook but not right away (as they may need to manually grade some essay questions first).

",174431,6164e7b0a707100069fd3655,"Tue, 26 Apr 2016 00:12:31 -0400","

Hi Laura Cira
I like your proposal: ""Instructors should have the flexibility to say Yes, send the grades to the gradebook but not right away"".

I think there is another big issue which you don't have taken into account: If the instructors want to send the scores right away (as they may want to work with the scores in Gradebook), they don't know that the scores are being visibles by students by default in Gradebook. Samigo should notify them.

There can be instructors that want the scores to be visible by default to students in GB and instructors that don't want the scores to be visibles by default. We believe that the best approach to consider all situations is to add an option to select whether the scores are visibles or not in Gradebook.

",74782,6164ee5907ac3c0068731cbb,"Mon, 13 Feb 2017 08:38:16 -0500",

Triage discussed this and the feature sounds like a good idea.

,,Depend,,,,10007,25887,released or not.png,65162,ug:111fd362-f448-40fc-9d00-e11693157fab,"Mon, 25 Apr 2016 01:53:41 -0400",109319,5d275d132c5a110c1d476990,"Mon, 11 Dec 2017 04:26:46 -0500","

As per Slack discussion with Laura Cira regarding this issue, it might be nice to handle the issue in the following two ways (for #2, I do NOT think the button should be called Release Grades because calling it that would imply release of other feedback within Samigo, while release within Samigo must be controlled manually with selection of multiple settings):

column2: • If feedback is released at a specific date, make the add the GB option also respect that date (and not send grades until then).

• For instructors who do not know in advance when they will want to release grades, and they choose NOT to send grades to GB in Settings, add a Send to Gradebook button on_Total Scores_. This button would do the following when clicked:

column3: • Automatically change the Settings on the published copy of the quiz to Send grades to GB.

column1:
Note: On attempting to click Send to Gradebook, if a GB item already exists with the same title as the quiz, appropriate warning must be displayed to instructor that they will need to change the title of either the assessment or GB item for the score to be sent.  Wording of message can be taken from Settings screen when attempting to publish quiz with that setting if GB item of same title exists.

",142694,5d275d132c5a110c1d476990,"Mon, 11 Dec 2017 04:47:51 -0500","

Another possibility for #2 in my comment above would be to have a button on Total Scores that triggers a Scores/Feedback Release type of pop-up or lightbox screen (if a lightbox, extra care would need to be taken to verify keyboard accessibility).  The effect of this screen would be to modify the Settings in the published copy of the quiz as per the selections you make in it.  For example:

Clicking a Save button on the feedback release pop-up would simply change and save the settings as if the instructor had gone to Settings via the Published Copies tab.

",126555,5d275d132c5a110c1d476990,"Thu, 11 Oct 2018 07:44:50 -0400",

Note that instructors can already release a score from Tests & Quizzes to Gradebook AND make it invisible to students by editing the corresponding Gradebook item and setting it to not be released.

,143258,6164e7b0a707100069fd3655,"Thu, 11 Oct 2018 08:36:36 -0400","

Thanks for your suggestions Tiffany Stull (suggestion1 , suggestion2 ) I believe these new features would improve the UX but they do not address the

<a href=""https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/browse/SAK-34782"" class=""jira-issue-macro-key issue-link""  title=""Allow instructors to choose whether the score will be released (in GB) to students or not when they send the scores to the Gradebook"" >
main issue. These new features could be addressed in a new ticket.

<a href=""https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/browse/SAK-34782"" class=""jira-issue-macro-key issue-link""  title=""Allow instructors to choose whether the score will be released (in GB) to students or not when they send the scores to the Gradebook"" >
1. The students submits an assessment (assessment settings: scores are not released to students. The scores will be sent to Gradebook).
2. The scores are not released to the students in Samigo but they are released in Gradebook because the gradebook scores from the external tools are always visibles to students by default.
3. The instructor does not know that the scores are released to students in the Gradebook tool.

This behaviour could be improved by adding an assessment configuration option (enabled/disabled with a property) that allows to intructors to choose whether the score will be visible (in GB) to students or not when Samigo sends the scores to the Gradebook.

[SAK-33140] Improve a gradebook service: send the scores from External Tools to Gradebook so that the scores are not released to students by default,https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/browse/SAK-33140,10057,SAK,Sakai,"

Enhacement:

Currently there is a gradebook service that allows to send scores from External tools (Assignments, Samigo, Lessons, Forums) to Gradebook. This gradebook service sends the scores so that they are released to students by default.
This gradebook service should be improved by allowing to send the scores from External tools to Gradebook so that the scores are not released to students by default.
This gradebook service is used in Gradebook, Gradebook2 and Gradebook NG.

Related Jiras: GRBK-1453, SAK-31014

o IO-487: Add ValidatingObjectInputStream for controlled deserialization
o IO-471: Support for additional encodings in ReversedLinesFileReader Thanks to Leandro Reis.
o IO-425: Setter method for threshold on ThresholdingOutputStream Thanks to Craig Swank.
o IO-406: Introduce new class AppendableOutputStream Thanks to Niall Pemberton.
o IO-459: Add WindowsLineEndingInputStream and UnixLineEndingInputStream. Thanks to Kristian Rosenvold.
o IO-457: Add a BoundedReader, a wrapper that can be used to constrain access
to an underlying stream when used with mark/reset -
to avoid overflowing the mark limit of the underlying buffer. Thanks to Kristian Rosenvold.
o IO-410: Readfully() That Returns A Byte Array Thanks to Beluga Behr.
o IO-395: Overload IOUtils buffer methods to accept buffer size Thanks to Beluga Behr.
o IO-382: Chunked IO for large arrays.
Added writeChunked(byte[], OutputStream) and writeChunked(char[] Writer)
o IO-233: Add Methods for Buffering Streams/Writers To IOUtils
Added overloaded buffer() methods - see also IO-330
o IO-330: IOUtils#toBufferedOutputStream/toBufferedWriter to conditionally wrap the output
Added overloaded buffer() methods - see also IO-233
o IO-381: Add FileUtils.copyInputStreamToFile API with option to leave the source open.
See copyInputStreamToFile(final InputStream source, final File destination, boolean closeSource)
o IO-379: CharSequenceInputStream - add tests for available()
Fix code so it really does reflect a minimum available.
o IO-341: A constant for holding the BOM character (U+FEFF)
o IO-359: Add IOUtils.skip and skipFully(ReadableByteChannel, long). Thanks to yukoba.
o IO-358: Add IOUtils.read and readFully(ReadableByteChannel, ByteBuffer buffer). Thanks to yukoba.
o IO-353: Add API IOUtils.copy(InputStream, OutputStream, int) Thanks to ggregory.
o IO-349: Add API with array offset and length argument to FileUtils.writeByteArrayToFile. Thanks to scop.
o IO-348: Missing information in IllegalArgumentException thrown by org.apache.commons.io.FileUtils#validateListFilesParameters. Thanks to plcstpierre.
o IO-345: Supply a hook method allowing Tailer actively determining stop condition. Thanks to mkresse.
o IO-437: Make IOUtils.EOF public and reuse it in various classes.
o IO-446: adds an endOfFileReached method to the TailerListener Thanks to Jeffrey Barrus.
o IO-484: FilenameUtils should handle embedded null bytes Thanks to Philippe Arteau.
o IO-481: Changed/Corrected algorithm for waitFor
o IO-428: BOMInputStream.skip returns wrong count if stream contains no BOM Thanks to Stefan Gmeiner.
o IO-488: FileUtils.waitFor(...) swallows thread interrupted status Thanks to Björn Buchner.
o IO-452: Support for symlinks with missing target. Added support for JDK7 symlink features when present Thanks to David Standish.
o IO-453: Regression in FileUtils.readFileToString from 2.0.1 Thanks to Steven Christou.
o IO-451: ant test fails - resources missing from test classpath Thanks to David Standish.
o IO-435: Document that FileUtils.deleteDirectory, directoryContains and cleanDirectory
may throw an IllegalArgumentException in case the passed directory does not
exist or is not a directory. Thanks to Dominik Stadler.
o IO-424: Javadoc fixes, mostly to appease 1.8.0 Thanks to Ville Skyttä.
o IO-389: FileUtils.sizeOfDirectory can throw IllegalArgumentException Thanks to Austin Doupnik.
Ensure that recursive calls all use BigInteger
o IO-385: FileUtils.doCopyFile can potentially loop for ever
Exit loop if no data to copy
o IO-383: FileUtils.doCopyFile caches the file size; needs to be documented
Added Javadoc; show file lengths in exception message
o IO-380: FileUtils.copyInputStreamToFile should document it closes the input source Thanks to claudio_ch.
o IO-279: Tailer erroneously considers file as new.
Fix to use file.lastModified() rather than System.currentTimeMillis()
o IO-356: CharSequenceInputStream#reset() behaves incorrectly in case when buffer size is not dividable by data size.
Fix code so skip relates to the encoded bytes; reset now re-encodes the data up to the point of the mark
o IO-368: ClassLoaderObjectInputStream does not handle primitive typed members
o IO-314: Deprecate all methods that use the default encoding
o IO-338: When a file is rotated, finish reading previous file prior to starting new one
o IO-354: Commons IO Tailer does not respect UTF-8 Charset.
o IO-323: What should happen in FileUtils.sizeOf[Directory] when an overflow takes place?
o IO-372: FileUtils.moveDirectory can produce misleading error message on failiure
o IO-362: IOUtils.contentEquals* methods returns false if input1 == input2, should return true. Thanks to mmadson, ggregory.
o IO-357: [Tailer] InterruptedException while the thread is sleeping is silently ignored Thanks to mortenh.
o IO-352: Spelling fixes. Thanks to scop.
o IO-436: Improper JavaDoc comment for FilenameUtils.indexOfExtension. Thanks to christoph.schneegans.
o IO-433: Converted all testcases to JUnit 4
o IO-466: Added testcase to show this was fixed with IO-423
o IO-479: Correct exception message in FileUtils.getFile(File, String...) Thanks to Zhouce Chen.
o IO-465: Update to JUnit 4.12 Thanks to based2.
o IO-462: IOExceptionWithCause no longer needed
o IO-422: Deprecate Charsets Charset constants in favor of Java 7's java.nio.charset.StandardCharsets
o IO-239: Convert IOCase to a Java 1.5+ Enumeration
o IO-328: getPrefixLength returns null if filename has leading slashes
Javadoc: add examples to show correct behaviour; add unit tests
o IO-299: FileUtils.listFilesAndDirs includes original dir in results even when it doesn't match filter
Javadoc: clarify that original dir is included in the results
o IO-375: FilenameUtils.splitOnTokens(String text) check for '**' could be simplified
o IO-374: WildcardFileFilter ctors should not use null to mean IOCase.SENSITIVE when delegating to other ctors
Source compatible: No, see the rare case in https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/IO-318.
Semantic compatible: No, see the rare case in https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/IO-318.
Commons IO 2.4 requires JDK 1.6 or later.
Commons IO 2.3 requires JDK 1.6 or later.
Commons IO 2.2 requires JDK 1.5 or later.

Commons IO 1.4 requires JDK 1.3 or later.

[SAK-31012] The popup message appears after you click on "Don't show me this again",https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/browse/SAK-31012,10057,SAK,Sakai,"

To reproduce this issue you need to:
1.- Create a popup message for a user.
2.- Login as the user (you will see the popup) and click ""Remind me later""
3.- Wait for 24 hours to see the reminder (you can reduce this time with the sakai property ""pasystem.popup.temporary-timeout-ms"" set to 60000 to just wait one minute.
4.- Login again and you will see the message, then click ""Don't show me this again""

5.- Logout and login again and you will see the popup (WRONG !!), if you click ""Don't show me this again"" you will see 400 error in the developer console trying to POST to: http://<sakai>/direct/pasystem/popupAcknowledge

The error is because is trying to add another permanent dismiss for the same user and message in the database. I think this problem could be solved if you remove any temporary dismiss if the user add a permanent dismiss, right now you are able to have both temporary and permanent dismiss form the same popup and the query here:

Select the popup even you have a permanent dismiss added for it.

I'm not sure I understand what you mean. Does this help?

column2: • Click underlined + icon (floats text 'Add new item at bottom of this column')
• Click the X at the top right of the menu
• Click the + icon in line with the text item (floats text 'Add new item above this one')
• Click the X at the top right of the menu
• Click the underlined + icon (floats text 'Add new item at bottom of this column')
• Click 'Add column break above' - column is created

[SAK-30974] start date and end date modal overlap,https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/browse/SAK-30974,10057,SAK,Sakai,"

system allows the start date and end date modals to be open at the same time. when they are, they overlap.
Also, if you click just to open the end date modal, it coves up the start date, which is not good. as a short term fix perhaps we do the following:
1. open the modals BELOW the top bar that contains the ""click to add start date"" and ""click to add end date"" buttons, so they don't cover up any dates

2. don't allow the start date and end date modals to be open at the same time.

","master - oracle

,111224,5a4541e51f38335849c45db9,"Tue, 10 Nov 2020 05:55:45 -0500","

Brian Jones just tested on 21.x. Results:

column2: • The Add Web Links Now button is disabled by default

• If you have a title entered, the Add Web Links Now button is enabled with a valid URL, but after it's enabled you can delete as much of the URL as you like and publish anyway – it won't become disabled because the link is no longer valid
• No error messages are shown for attempting to add an invalid URL – I can publish and then they open with the blank page/random URL combo from the ticket description
• With multiple URLs, each URL has to be validated before the button is enabled, but some dead sites (http://go) are accepted

column1:

,94573,557058:cdae778f-fe7d-4a6d-9667-9be789e4fbee,"Mon, 4 Jan 2021 04:07:24 -0500","

Molly Kelsey, any updates here?

","

NOTE: if sakai.property content.url.rightsdialog is true (default), the copyright status will be present on the form and is required. This field is buried within the ""Add details for this item"" panel. If you click the button with this property enabled and without selecting a copyright status, an error message is presented but you may not be aware of where the copyright status field is located.

column2: • do not provide any values for anything
<li>verify ""Add Web Links Now"" is not enabled

column3: • FAIL: button is enabled, no validation, no error message, ""link"" is created with some random name like ""__________________20200214165155""
• URL must include protocol to be considered valid (ex. https:// or http://)

column2: • try to provide invalid input for the URL:

column3: • one with a valid url but no name
• one with a name but no url
• one with a name but an invalid url
• one with both a name and a valid url
• use your browser's inspect element to view the HTML for the button, remove the ""disabled"" attribute; click the button
• PASS: validation error messages are presented indicating URL(s) is invalid, and required fields

",178153,557058:849fa1ca-6dd1-4ea7-8207-c5fa2d6fb94a,"Fri, 7 May 2021 07:38:13 -0400","
