From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.",Resolved,3,done,green,10001,Won't Fix,557058:b7f26689-4872-49f3-9655-910bea8a4c71,Bernardo Garcia Vila,557058:b7f26689-4872-49f3-9655-910bea8a4c71,Bernardo Garcia Vila,"Wed, 13 Apr 2016 02:01:07 -0400","Tue, 30 Aug 2016 04:42:06 -0400",,BasicLTI,0,2,Development,customfield_10000,com.atlassian.jira.plugins.jira-development-integration-plugin:devsummarycf,Rank,0|108yps:,customfield_10019,com.pyxis.greenhopper.jira:gh-lexo-rank,Sprint,customfield_10020,com.pyxis.greenhopper.jira:gh-sprint,"Tue, 30 Aug 2016 04:42:06 -0400",,,,,,,[CHART] Date of First Response,customfield_10024,com.atlassian.jira.ext.charting:firstresponsedate,[CHART] Time in Status,customfield_10025,com.atlassian.jira.ext.charting:timeinstatus,,,,,174379,557058:718cd3f6-5ff9-42fa-8914-b4224aff1730,"Wed, 13 Apr 2016 02:15:30 -0400",

I am happy to support this - let me know how I can help.

,191069,557058:b7f26689-4872-49f3-9655-910bea8a4c71,"Wed, 13 Apr 2016 02:25:31 -0400","

Thanks Chuck. I'm going to do a PR soon, but before I'd like to ask you about one of the changes you made here:

The cleanupProperties methods and its call inside the signProperties were removed, not sure why, but we're getting Oauth signature errors if they're absent. I initially planned to bring them back (together with the validPropertyNames array on BasicLTIConstants), but you might have a better idea.

Thanks again.

",40280,557058:718cd3f6-5ff9-42fa-8914-b4224aff1730,"Wed, 13 Apr 2016 02:35:45 -0400",

Interesting - cleanupProperties is there to pass IMS Certification so it needs to work. Skimming the patch it seems that all your new properties are custom_ - so that is cool and cleanupProperies should leave those alone. So lets figure that out.

,"Wed, 13 Apr 2016 06:15:30 +0000",Depend,,,,10007,,,,,,57276,557058:b7f26689-4872-49f3-9655-910bea8a4c71,"Wed, 13 Apr 2016 02:45:57 -0400","

We actually need to override RESOURCE_LINK_ID, RESOURCE_LINK_TITLE and RESOURCE_LINK_DESCRIPTION too

",74099,557058:718cd3f6-5ff9-42fa-8914-b4224aff1730,"Wed, 13 Apr 2016 03:23:16 -0400",

Is there anywhere I can become familiar with the interaction - some API documentation - just so I can read up and understand more quickly?

,90975,557058:b7f26689-4872-49f3-9655-910bea8a4c71,"Wed, 13 Apr 2016 03:41:13 -0400","

I don't think the documentation that's available right now will help you at all, as this is a pretty specific problem. Not sure which patches are you browsing, but I can point you to the places related with this issue. In fact, the BasicLTI changes we included are not for these kind of calls, so the problem is not in there. Basically we need to make an initial LTI call when a TII assignment is created and from that point on we will access it from a LTI tool we will create. The signature problem we face (if we skip the cleanUpProperties method) is on that first creation call, which is made from the Content Review Implementation (TurnitinLTIUtil class).

An example call with all the params might help you?

",40286,557058:b7f26689-4872-49f3-9655-910bea8a4c71,"Thu, 14 Apr 2016 03:18:28 -0400","

I got it! Quick explanation: on that initial call we're using the site's short description as the context_label param. If it's null, then it gives the signature error. I can easily solve it for that field and probably should check that all the params have value, but shouldn't it also be checked inside the signProperties BasicLTI method like it used to?

",158136,557058:cdae778f-fe7d-4a6d-9667-9be789e4fbee,"Tue, 30 Aug 2016 04:42:06 -0400","

I've confirmed that we already have this code in sakaicontrib/sakai-turnitin. Also, one of my colleagues is working on removing this code, as it's a bit of a hack. He will be submitting a PR to sakaicontrib/sakai-turnitin for this work in the near future.

column2: • Create a test user with an email address.
• Using Site Info ""Add Participant"" add the user using both their username and email address at the same time.
• The Add Participant wizard always thinks they are different users and should warn that they are the same user.

[SAK-30777] More Sites: Morpheus courses column does not include course-like site types,https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/browse/SAK-30777,10057,SAK,Sakai,"

Sakai allows in sakai.properties to configure new site types ""course-like"", so it is possible to have several types that are treated like courses inside Sakai.

However, the new columns in More Sites added by Morpheus only include ""course"" sites, leaving in this case ""course_asig"" sites in the right column duplicating the term.

[SAK-36827] Samigo is delivering scores of "0" instead of null values for ungraded students to GBNG,https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/browse/SAK-36827,10057,SAK,Sakai,"

Other tools that automatically deliver items to the GB (e.g., Assignments, Lessons, etc.) contain ""null"" values when students do not have grades. This is important from the GB's perspective, as final grades do not reflect these null values (therefore showing an accurate representation of students' grades throughout the semester, when they have not received scores for some GB items).
Samigo, however, is delivering scores of ""0"" for all students when no grades have been entered yet (image attached).

Related GBNG git issue: https://github.com/sakaiproject/sakai/issues/2075

",,23039,SAK-36827,"Samigo is delivering scores of ""0"" instead of null values for ungraded students to GBNG",10007,https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/secure/viewavatar?size=medium&avatarId=10303&avatarType=issuetype,Bug,10001,https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/images/icons/priorities/critical.svg,Critical,5,https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/images/icons/statuses/resolved.png,"A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. Kyle Blythe Samigo does this in Sakai 10 with GB2 as well. Students see an automatic ""0"" upon submission of their test (if the grades are being sent to the GB) even if there is no feedback date indicated (because the setting to send to gradebook expressly states ""regardless of options below."" Ouch!)
It's a source of much concern for students to immediately see this 0 when in reality their test has not been manually graded yet!

If someone would fix this, it would make thousands of students breathe a huge sigh of relief.

I can not reproduce this problem on 11.x nightly QA server (oracle edition). It looks like null values are represented in the gradebook (GradebookNG).
1) Create a one question test and have it expire soon. Give it 10 points for correct answer.
2) Have at least 3 students in the course site (in this case, I had many more than that).
3) Take as one student and answer correct, and a second student and answer incorrect.
6) Push grades to gradebook in Settings.
Student who answered correctly got a 10. Student who answered incorrectly got a 0. All other students appear to have null (no grade).

To me it looks fine.

",174822,557058:f40ed6cf-0104-4dc6-88be-9f2bbc0cae39,"Mon, 26 Sep 2016 06:05:42 -0400","

This still looks like an issue. Tested this morning in QA11 nightly (mysql) with GBNG. Here's how you replicate:
1. Create a one question essay quiz. Make it worth 10 points.
2. Expiration does not matter. But adjust settings to send grades to GB.
3. Take quiz as student. Submit for grading.

Samigo automatically sends a grade of ""0"" to the Gradebook for a student the second they click ""Submit for Grading."" Of course, the student has not been graded for their essay yet, and as such should not have a ""0"" in the GB, which artificially lowers their course grade. This grade will change once the instructor enters the actual earned grade for the student, but until then, there's a lot of communication that has to happen between instructors and students to calm their concerns!

Allong those same lines - and even more confusing to students -, an artificially low grade is sent over when the quiz has some auto-graded questions (like multiple choice and T/F) as well as an essay question that needs an instructor's grade input. So Samigo auto-grades the questions it can, and sends the results of that grade to the gradebook. However, of course, the real score has to include the instructor's grade entry for the essay, which won't happen immediately. .

",40724,557058:f40ed6cf-0104-4dc6-88be-9f2bbc0cae39,"Mon, 26 Sep 2016 06:13:31 -0400","

Screen shot for zero that comes into gradebook for an essay-based quiz that hasn't been graded yet, Should be a null, not a zero.

",57717,557058:7074e357-325c-4f04-880f-321ecd7c7dc5,"Mon, 26 Sep 2016 06:21:13 -0400","

Thanks Laura Cira for the steps to reproduce.

I am willing to bet dollars to donuts (no, I don't really know what that means), that this is how Sakai has behaved pretty much forever. You can try it on Sakai 10 if you wish, we have a qa server on http://nightly2.sakaiproject.org/ .
The reason is that the item DOES have a score. The score is 0. Samigo is passing a 0 to the Gradebook. For essay questions this kind of makes sense to me. But I also understand your point.
This seems to me like a feature request and not a bug. The feature request would be that Samigo have a default of null for a score on question types that can not be auto graded. Does that make sense?

This is not a gradebook issue, it's a Samigo issue, and probably one that goes way back to many earlier versions. And I'm guessing not easy to change.

",,,23356,SAK-34232,is related to,,,,,,,,,,,35600,LowScore.png,36289,ug:043ac84d-4caa-406e-bd0a-eb836b736223,"Mon, 26 Sep 2016 06:05:37 -0400",41945,LowScore1.png,31946,ug:043ac84d-4caa-406e-bd0a-eb836b736223,"Mon, 26 Sep 2016 06:13:30 -0400",,,,,,,,,,,,,,,11.0,,,,,,,,38784,LowScore1.png,31295,ug:043ac84d-4caa-406e-bd0a-eb836b736223,"Mon, 26 Sep 2016 06:12:18 -0400",91416,557058:f40ed6cf-0104-4dc6-88be-9f2bbc0cae39,"Mon, 26 Sep 2016 06:25:02 -0400","

Yes, you are correct. This has been the case forever. It's definitely a Samigo issue. There are workarounds (hiding the item in the GB until all grading is complete, and don't release feedback in Samigo until grading is complete). It is definitely a feature request, and a very popular one.

the attchments is the result of using this markup on a wiki page and exporting the RTF
For a full list of macros and parameters, type {list-of-macros} in any page. This list gives an introduction to the most useful.
{mailto:} followed by an email address will create an email link in the page.
Create an automatic index for your Wiki
Typing {index} will create an automatically updated index of pages for your Wiki.
(No example as it takes up a lot of space!)
Create an automatic list of recently changed pages

Typing {recent-changes} will create an automatically updated list of the recently changed pages in your Wiki, together with the name of the person who last changed the page and the date and time of the change. By default, it shows all the pages changed in the last 30 days.
{recent-changes:12h} - recently changed pages in the last 12 hours.
{recent-changes:7d} - recently changed pages in the last 7 days.
(No example as it takes up a lot of space!)
Add an image to your page
Typing {image:} and including the URL of the image will display a image in your page. (This is just the same as clicking the image icon in the edit screen, which is easier to use.)
{image:/images/bear.jpg|A Bear} would show the image whose relative URL was ""/images/bear.jpg"". The alternative text shown would be ""A Bear"".
To float your image left, so that text flows round it, include the extra text ""|ext|float-left"", as below:
To float your image right, so that text flows round it, include the extra text ""|ext|float-right"", as below:

The image URL may be relative or absolute but cannot be external. The URL may also start with ""worksite:/"" to display images from this worksite. To display images from your other worksites, you may start a URL with ""sakai:/"" and include the site ID.
Typing {anchor} creates an HTML anchor tag around the text it contains.
The link to jump to that point should appear as follows:
[Go to this exciting point|Name of current page here#myLink]
RWiki uses JS Math so that you can display maths entered in TeX form.
Typing {math:display} {math} will display TeX between the two tags.
To display a quotation, type {quote} on either side of the text you want to display as a quote.

column2: Generate a list of links that point to subsites that are automatically generated for each section in your worksite. Note that there is no interface within the wiki to manage permissions on a section by section level.

column1: {worksiteinfo} Lists the information about the current site

[SAK-30758] Get rid of Mac newlines (\r) in properties files,https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/browse/SAK-30758,10057,SAK,Sakai,"

There are some files in Site Info that have Mac newlines in them (lone '\r') between lines. There is no good reason for having Mac newlines and the files should be switched to use UNIX newlines.

Having Mac newlines confuses git/github and makes patch files wrong. What's worse is that this file also has some UNIX newlines in it as well.

",,40794,SAK-30758,Get rid of Mac newlines (\r) in properties files,10007,https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/secure/viewavatar?size=medium&avatarId=10303&avatarType=issuetype,Bug,10002,https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/images/icons/priorities/major.svg,Major,10025,https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/images/icons/statuses/generic.png,Indicates QA is complete and an issue has been tested and verified (Migrated on 12 Oct 2021 03:05 UTC),Verified,3,done,green,10000,Fixed,6164d8abc7bea400699b1b9e,Core Team,557058:1126cb77-b601-4bf1-a169-76deaba72266,Matthew Buckett,"Tue, 12 Apr 2016 04:13:08 -0400","Tue, 31 May 2016 12:56:49 -0400",11.0,Site Info,0,1,Development,customfield_10000,com.atlassian.jira.plugins.jira-development-integration-plugin:devsummarycf,Rank,0|108yj4:,customfield_10019,com.pyxis.greenhopper.jira:gh-lexo-rank,Sprint,customfield_10020,com.pyxis.greenhopper.jira:gh-sprint,"Wed, 13 Apr 2016 06:07:58 -0400",,,,,,,[CHART] Time in Status,customfield_10025,com.atlassian.jira.ext.charting:timeinstatus,,,,,,11.0,12.0,57272,557058:1126cb77-b601-4bf1-a169-76deaba72266,"Tue, 12 Apr 2016 04:18:40 -0400","

This is how you find files that have different line endings, if a file has multiple line ending it will be in multiple files.
find . -name \*.properties -not -path '*/target/*' | xargs grep -Ul '[^\r]$' > unix.txt
find . -name \*.properties -not -path '*/target/*' | xargs grep -Ul '\r$' > dos.txt
find . -name \*.properties -not -path '*/target/*' | xargs grep -Ul '\r[^$]' > mac.txt
The list of files with Mac line ending is:

There's an easy fix. In an overzealous edit, the onclick declarations were removed. If you put them back it works:

However there are some issues. One is that there's a time limit to how long submit will work. After all, the due date is passed. I believe the back end has a grace period, though I don't remember how long it is. That should probably be put in the text. Otherwise if someone doesn't do it soon enough it will fail and they'll complain that we offered them an option that doesn't work.

Second, there's inconsistent behavior. If you start an assessment and reach the due date, you get this dialog. But if you start, exit, and continue, you get the count down timer, and at the due date it auto submits. I'd think it should behave the same way in both cases. But that's probably not a blocker, and this is.

",107694,6164d3a564ff010071b75c26,"Wed, 13 Apr 2016 11:31:01 -0400","

Note: how does this behavior mesh with save and autosave. If we have saved data, will the submit batch job pick it up and submit it? Even if the user said don't submit?

",141079,70121:ec0fd122-4a2d-4492-a966-78d3f9aa9080,"Wed, 13 Apr 2016 13:15:51 -0400","

Since this just clicks the submit button, if the user came to this point and clicked don't submit, if it was their only submission it would still auto submit it for them. They would only have a short window of opportunity to submit this as well.
If they had multiple submissions possible then it wouldn't auto submit again.
There's no way to say ""don't submit anything ever"". I doubt anyone would even want that. I feel like the only 2 reasons this UI exists are.

column2: • To give the user a chance to submit if auto submit isn't turned on (it isn't by default)
• To give the user a chance to not submit if it's not their first submission

column1:
",157753,70121:ec0fd122-4a2d-4492-a966-78d3f9aa9080,"Wed, 13 Apr 2016 13:24:42 -0400","

<a href=""https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/browse/SAK-37048"" class=""jira-issue-macro-key issue-link""  title=""Improve use of blockUI to prevent double-clicking "" >
There were other onclick's removed in here, I'm not sure if there's any other regressions here yet.
- <button type=""button"" onclick=""clickSubmit();""><h:outputText value=""#{deliveryMessages.button_submit}"" escape=""false""/></button>
- <a href=""#"" onclick=""clickDoNotSubmit();""><h:outputText value=""<u>#{deliveryMessages.link_do_not_submit}</u>"" escape=""false""/></a>

From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.",Resolved,3,done,green,10002,Non-Issue,557058:cdae778f-fe7d-4a6d-9667-9be789e4fbee,Brian Jones,557058:5e9b51e2-3d91-4079-943a-ed719d119ea1,Adam Marshall,"Tue, 12 Apr 2016 01:45:19 -0400","Tue, 15 Nov 2016 07:02:51 -0500",11.0,Rwiki,0,2,Development,customfield_10000,com.atlassian.jira.plugins.jira-development-integration-plugin:devsummarycf,Rank,0|108ygw:,customfield_10019,com.pyxis.greenhopper.jira:gh-lexo-rank,Sprint,customfield_10020,com.pyxis.greenhopper.jira:gh-sprint,"Tue, 15 Nov 2016 06:59:44 -0500",,,,,,,Test Plan,customfield_10038,com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.customfieldtypes:textarea,[CHART] Date of First Response,customfield_10024,com.atlassian.jira.ext.charting:firstresponsedate,,,,,108215,557058:cdae778f-fe7d-4a6d-9667-9be789e4fbee,"Tue, 15 Nov 2016 06:51:34 -0500","

This problem is actually bigger than just Wiki, and the root cause is that by default the sakai.property pointing to the source of the MathJax script is http. So by default, all browsers will display mixed content warnings if your Sakai instance is served over https. Telling your browser to render unsafe scripts solves the problem locally. However, the real solution here is to change the default URL for the MathJax source from http to https.

",124882,557058:cdae778f-fe7d-4a6d-9667-9be789e4fbee,"Tue, 15 Nov 2016 06:59:05 -0500","

I spoke before I looked; seems the default is already https. This issue is no longer reproducible in either 11 nightly or master nightly.

When testing this feature, ensure that your browser is allowing 3rd party requests/scripts, as the default is to source the MathJax JavaScript from the MathJax domain (https://cdn.mathjax.org/mathjax/latest/MathJax.js?config=default,Safe).

"" is a valid delimiter for MathJax. ""$$"" is the start and end delimiter for block level elements, and ""("" and "")"" are the delimiters for in-line. There's probably others I'm not aware of as well. Example:

<ol class=""ALPHA""><li>A. lettered list</li></ol> is rendered correctly though but is still misaligned

[SAK-38747] Remove setup.request from kernel.properties,https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/browse/SAK-38747,10057,SAK,Sakai,"

kernel.properties defines the variable setup.request from
<a href=""https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/browse/SAK-21124"" class=""jira-issue-macro-key issue-link""  title=""Sakai default config is missing a huge number of config options"" >

. Because of this any code that tries to set a sensible default (and not crash when sending email) does crash if this variable isn't set. I think this either should be set to something or just rely on the code to provide the default.
Looking through the code every getString does provide a default but slightly differnet.

This can't be set like this with the property, and hopefully people will set it, but seems better just to not set it so the default will get picked up here when provided.

[SAK-37535] Checking the link button to lessons page,https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/browse/SAK-37535,10057,SAK,Sakai,"

On the top right corner of the lessons page, there is a button that provides a direct link to the lessons page. When that button is clicked, the ""Add content"", ""more tools"", ""reorder"", and ""tips"" buttons overlap on top of the link. The link is able to be copy pasted, however there is an overlap.

","Android- Samsung Galaxy S5

Apple- iPhone + iPad",23024,SAK-37535,Checking the link button to lessons page,10007,https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/secure/viewavatar?size=medium&avatarId=10303&avatarType=issuetype,Bug,10003,https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/images/icons/priorities/minor.svg,Minor,10025,https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/images/icons/statuses/generic.png,Indicates QA is complete and an issue has been tested and verified (Migrated on 12 Oct 2021 03:05 UTC),Verified,3,done,green,10000,Fixed,6164d3a564ff010071b75c26,Charles Hedrick,70121:9b02f21d-0e4e-45b7-8126-2be52afc319f,Simoni Handoo,"Mon, 11 Apr 2016 05:21:11 -0400","Wed, 18 Apr 2018 03:29:30 -0400",11.0,Lessons,0,2,Development,customfield_10000,com.atlassian.jira.plugins.jira-development-integration-plugin:devsummarycf,Rank,0|108ybk:,customfield_10019,com.pyxis.greenhopper.jira:gh-lexo-rank,Sprint,customfield_10020,com.pyxis.greenhopper.jira:gh-sprint,"Mon, 11 Apr 2016 11:07:43 -0400",,,,,,,[CHART] Date of First Response,customfield_10024,com.atlassian.jira.ext.charting:firstresponsedate,[CHART] Time in Status,customfield_10025,com.atlassian.jira.ext.charting:timeinstatus,,,11.0,12.0,74095,6164d3a564ff010071b75c26,"Mon, 11 Apr 2016 11:18:34 -0400","

Testing should check the ""sites"" button, the menu popping up from the user icon in the upper right, chat, and the direct URL link. These should also stack in reasonable ways.

The check must be done with both side and narrow screen.

",90970,6164d3a564ff010071b75c26,"Mon, 11 Apr 2016 11:20:16 -0400","

Lessons has special z-index declarations for these because some video tools have their own z-index. To guarantee that the Lessons markup always goes on top of the content, we use larger than normal z-index values. That requires us to adjust some of the Morpheus values to go on top of the unusually large Lessons values.

",107704,70121:9b02f21d-0e4e-45b7-8126-2be52afc319f,"Mon, 18 Apr 2016 07:03:29 -0400","

[SAK-30740] assignments, gradebook: Overwrite current feedback to give multiple students same comment doesn't update comments in GB,https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/browse/SAK-30740,10057,SAK,Sakai,"

If you have already graded and released comments for an assignment that has been added to the Gradebook, then use the Show settings for sending feedback > Overwrite current feedback option in Assignments, the grades and Comments for selected students are removed from the Gradebook, even though grades/comments are still entered in Assignments and look like they should be released.

column2: • In a site with at least two students, the Assignments and Gradebook tools added, create an assignment with a Points grade and select Add Assignment to Gradebook.
• As 2 different students (e.g. student01, student02), submit the assignment.
• Click the name of one of the students who submitted to grade their submission.
• Enter a point grade and add some comments in the Instructor Summary Comments box.
• Repeat the steps to grade the other student with a submission.
• Check the boxes beside the two students' names for whom you released comments/grades.
• Enter a new comment in the box (different from the previous comment for either student selected)

column3: • Overwrite current feedback (NOTE: It does not override by default).
• Return feedback to selected students now (NOTE: This opction only returns the feedback, if you wish to publish grades, you will need to clic on 'Release grades').

column2: • Click Update. Status for both students should be Returned and there should be a check mark in the Release column for both. Instead, the check mark has been removed from the Release column for the first student selected.
• Click on the name/id of a student for whom you just entered comments. In the Instructor Summary Comments box, you should see the new comment you just entered.

• Click on the assignment's Title to view the grades. You should see the new comment in the Comments box for both students whose grades/comments you just re-released. Issue: Instead, the first student doesn't have a grade or comments released (the grade has been made null and there's no comment because of the missing check mark in the Release column in Assignments). Meanwhile, the second student's comments have not updated from the previous comment.

column3: • NOTE: If you return to the Grade screen in Assignments, you'll see that the grades and comments are STILL entered for both students.

column1:
* Safari 9.0.1",62313,SAK-30740,"assignments, gradebook: Overwrite current feedback to give multiple students same comment doesn't update comments in GB",10007,https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/secure/viewavatar?size=medium&avatarId=10303&avatarType=issuetype,Bug,10001,https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/images/icons/priorities/critical.svg,Critical,6,https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/images/icons/statuses/closed.png,"The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.",Closed,3,done,green,10002,Non-Issue,557058:f40ed6cf-0104-4dc6-88be-9f2bbc0cae39,Laura Cira,5d275d132c5a110c1d476990,Tiffany Stull,"Mon, 11 Apr 2016 04:52:19 -0400","Mon, 29 Aug 2016 07:21:31 -0400",11.0,Assignments,0,2,Development,customfield_10000,com.atlassian.jira.plugins.jira-development-integration-plugin:devsummarycf,Rank,0|108ybc:,customfield_10019,com.pyxis.greenhopper.jira:gh-lexo-rank,Sprint,customfield_10020,com.pyxis.greenhopper.jira:gh-sprint,"Fri, 13 May 2016 09:05:03 -0400",Gradebook Classic,,,,,,[CHART] Date of First Response,customfield_10024,com.atlassian.jira.ext.charting:firstresponsedate,[CHART] Time in Status,customfield_10025,com.atlassian.jira.ext.charting:timeinstatus,,,,,174447,557058:7074e357-325c-4f04-880f-321ecd7c7dc5,"Wed, 27 Apr 2016 07:43:16 -0400",

This sounds like a possible blocker. It overwrites a grade and a feedback for a student?

,57349,5d275d132c5a110c1d476990,"Wed, 27 Apr 2016 08:10:45 -0400","

The problem is that it's removing some grades from the Gradebook tool by un-releasing them, and it's not overwriting existing comments correctly within the Gradebook. The feature should allow you to overwrite comments and have the new comments show up in the gradebook, without altering any of the students' grades.

",57429,557058:7074e357-325c-4f04-880f-321ecd7c7dc5,"Thu, 12 May 2016 06:50:31 -0400",

Will be re-tested in Sakai 10. If it is an issue in 10 then probably not a blocker for 11.0 .

,"Wed, 27 Apr 2016 11:43:16 +0000",,,,,,19367,ASMTgradingRELEASES.png,77580,ug:043ac84d-4caa-406e-bd0a-eb836b736223,"Fri, 13 May 2016 09:17:11 -0400",57436,557058:f40ed6cf-0104-4dc6-88be-9f2bbc0cae39,"Fri, 13 May 2016 08:58:17 -0400","

Tiffany Stull I believe this is expected behavior, and when I tested this today, it worked as it does in Sakai 10.5. Here's why:

When you are entering comments and grades in the assignment submission grading screen, you finish by clicking ""Save and Release to Student"", but that only gives students access from within the Assignments tool.

Anytime you enter comments and grades (or later return to override those comments or grades) in the Assignment tool, you must click **Release Grades (the link at the top left of the submissions screen) to send those grades and comments to the Gradebook. Until you click that link, they will not push to the GB.

This has been confusing to faculty since the beginning of time. The link at the top of the page should probably say ""Send Grades to Gradebook"" not ""Release Grades."" It must be clicked after every session where new information is entered in the Assignments tool submissions screen if you want the info to push to the Gradebook.
Neal Caidin can this turn into an enhancement request to have that link changed to say ""Send Grades to Gradebook"" or ""Send Updates to Gradebook""?

OR - maybe change the button in the grading screen from ""Save and Release to Student"" to ""Save and Return to Student"", so it matches the state of the assignment in the student view (It displays as ""returned."")

The word ""release"" is used a lot in this tool and it means different things at different times. It's confusing.

",91133,557058:7074e357-325c-4f04-880f-321ecd7c7dc5,"Fri, 13 May 2016 09:04:09 -0400","

Laura Cira , anyone is free to open a Jira. The trick is then to get community support, which I suspect this issue would have. And then, find the resources.

",107844,557058:f40ed6cf-0104-4dc6-88be-9f2bbc0cae39,"Fri, 13 May 2016 09:05:03 -0400","

Neal Caidin this is the way Assignments works - must click ""Release Grades"" to push grades and comments to GB. If we decide that some new button text might be more helpful, would this become a feature request?

",124504,557058:7074e357-325c-4f04-880f-321ecd7c7dc5,"Fri, 13 May 2016 09:12:03 -0400","

Laura Cira, if it is only button text? Yes, put in a Jira as a feature request. It might still be a good idea to get some community feedback on the proposed re-wording, although I see what you are saying. It might be a ""no brainer""? Then it is figuring out when this could get in. Too late for Sakai 11.0 because even though it is just a text change we have to consider impact to user documentation and localization (translations).

",141226,557058:f40ed6cf-0104-4dc6-88be-9f2bbc0cae39,"Fri, 13 May 2016 09:15:42 -0400","

And now when I test again, new grade and comments are pushed to the GB without my having to click Release Grades link!

[SAK-34156] Save a matrix of choices removes old options if all the choices are not selected the first time.,https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/browse/SAK-34156,10057,SAK,Sakai,"

How to reproduce:
1. Create an assessment with 2 question (one must be matrix of choices with more than one option).
3. As student, enter the exam and fill some options of the matrix of choices question leave some blank.
4. Click next or back to go to the other question.
5. Click again to return to the matrix of choices question and fill the rest of options.
6. Go to the other question again and return.

7. The options that were filled the first time are missing.

",124439,70121:9335f09f-0d23-4a59-9aac-ba36f9cb223a,"Fri, 29 Apr 2016 08:39:46 -0400","

If there is no due date set, late submission options shouldn't apply at all.

Creating and publishing an assessment without changing the default settings (open Settings page, verify the open date is now and no due date is set, assume late submission doesn't apply if there is no due date) gives students an assessment they can't take. Default settings put the accept late submissions date now, so when student opens assessment it's no longer available (LateSubmission.png).

When that test wasn't available I tried switching late submissions to no, not after due date.

",57404,6164d3a564ff010071b75c26,"Thu, 5 May 2016 08:56:57 -0400","

I can't replicate this. I take a test with default settings, so to not accept after due date. A student can take it and submit it. Is there something else I need to do to create the problem?

2. In the Calendar tool, click on Fields.
3. To the right of the user created field, check the Remove box.
5. Applications responds with Alert: Are you sure you want to remove the following field(s):New Test Field? If yes, click 'Save Field Changes' to continue.

[SAK-37274] Improvements for Samigo submission email receipts and notifications,https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/browse/SAK-37274,10057,SAK,Sakai,"

The attached PR addresses the following concerns:

column2: • The submission information page does not tell the student they will receive an email receipt. This page has been updated to tell tell the student if they should expect an email receipt based on their current setting in Preferences (either immediate, digest, or none). It also informs them where to change the setting.

• The submission information page gives the student a confirmation number that is not included in the email for comparison/verification. The email templates and substitution values have been updated to include this information.

• As the same email templates are used for sending receipts to students AND notifications to instructors, the last sentence in these templates is inaccurate in the context of Instructor notifications. This hard-coded sentence has been replaced by a substitution variable that is now specific to both Instructors and Students. The student's will stay the same, informing them they can change their receipt settings in Preferences. The Instructor's has changed to inform them they are receiving the notification because the quiz is set to do so. As the default setting for notifications is 'None', the Instructor must already be aware of this setting. Therefore, re-iterating how to find the quiz setting is not necessary.

[SAK-30723] Download All - zip file contains folders for only students with submissions.,https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/browse/SAK-30723,10057,SAK,Sakai,"

There is an option on the Download All page, Include students who have not yet submitted. When this is selected, the zip file that is created includes folder(s) for student(s) who have submitted only.

column2: • In a site with more than 1 student, create an assignment as the instructor and submit as one of the students.
• As the instructor, click the Grade or View Submissions link under the assignment title.
• On the Download All page, select All and the option, Include students who have not yet submitted
• Expand the bulk_download.zip file and opening the assignment folder, you will see a sub-folder for just the student that submitted, not the other students in the site.
• Assignment Grade screen showing all students in the site, one with a submission.
• Expanded zip file with one student's folder

[SAK-30717] The Contact Us (Feedback) tool should appear on every site by default,https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/browse/SAK-30717,10057,SAK,Sakai,"

At the moment, the Contact Us tool appears as a regular tool in the Manage Tools list. This should not be the default situation. By default the tool should appear on every new site just above the Help Tool. Users should not be able to remove it via Site Info (cf Help Tool) although there should be a way of not having it automatically added to every site and instead allowing the tool to behave just like a regular tool. (As stated above, this is how the tool currently works on the nightly server.)
To allow it to auto-appear on every site, we need

column2: • an SQL script to backfill the tool into existing sites
• to create a special site containing the tool with a fixed site ID of ""!contact-us""
• a method of ensuring the tool is auto-added to new sites when they are created (cf Help tool)

column1: We do not propose to develop functionality to remove the tool from every site via the web UI.

Adding the tool to every site should be an operation that is performed when moving to Sakai 11 if an individual institution desires it. It should be the default action which can be skipped if so desired.

I see no harm in having the ""!contact-us"" site in all versions of Sakai 11 but the backfilling of sites plus the addition to new sites should be able to be skipped if so desired.

",,23013,SAK-30717,The Contact Us (Feedback) tool should appear on every site by default,10007,https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/secure/viewavatar?size=medium&avatarId=10303&avatarType=issuetype,Bug,10001,https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/images/icons/priorities/critical.svg,Critical,6,https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/images/icons/statuses/closed.png,"The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. [SAK-30715] Contact Us tool should use mail.support property if no specific "contact points" are set,https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/browse/SAK-30715,10057,SAK,Sakai,"

At the moment the contact us (aka Feedback) tool will display ""sub-optimally"" if any of the middle 2 'contact points' are unset in the feedback tool properties file, ie the contact email for boxes 2&3. ",,58034,SAK-30715,"Contact Us tool should use mail.support property if no specific ""contact points"" are set",10007,https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/secure/viewavatar?size=medium&avatarId=10303&avatarType=issuetype,Bug,10003,https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/images/icons/priorities/minor.svg,Minor,1,https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/images/icons/statuses/open.png,The issue is open and ready for the assignee to start work on it.,Open,2,new,blue-gray,-1,Unresolved,6164f940071a720071a765f3,Nick Wilson,557058:5e9b51e2-3d91-4079-943a-ed719d119ea1,Adam Marshall,"Fri, 8 Apr 2016 01:59:35 -0400","Wed, 28 Mar 2018 06:21:59 -0400",11.0,Feedback Tool,0,7,Development,customfield_10000,com.atlassian.jira.plugins.jira-development-integration-plugin:devsummarycf,Rank,0|108y4g:,customfield_10019,com.pyxis.greenhopper.jira:gh-lexo-rank,Sprint,customfield_10020,com.pyxis.greenhopper.jira:gh-sprint,,,,,,,,Test Plan,customfield_10038,com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.customfieldtypes:textarea,[CHART] Date of First Response,customfield_10024,com.atlassian.jira.ext.charting:firstresponsedate,,,,,141059,557058:5e9b51e2-3d91-4079-943a-ed719d119ea1,"Fri, 8 Apr 2016 02:01:21 -0400","

",57277,6164f940071a720071a765f3,"Wed, 13 Apr 2016 05:38:58 -0400","

After speaking with Adam Marshall here at Oxford, boxes 2 and 3 should show a warning if both feedback.technicalAddress and mail.support properties aren't set ; and should show the 'feedback.technicalAddress' value if that is set ; else 'mail.support' value if that is set ; and box 4 should show a warning if feedback.featureSuggestionUrl isn't set, and should show 'feedback.featureSuggestionUrl' value if that is set.

",40288,5db0830566a99f0d9c5a0770,"Thu, 14 Apr 2016 22:30:49 -0400","

Nightly servers have set the property feedback.technicalAddress=dummy@sakaiproject.org by default, so testing this JIRA is not possible unless some server admin removes/comments this property.

For example, the property is set in https://trunk-mysql.nightly.sakaiproject.org/sakai/sakai.properties so Contact Us tool sends every ""Ask for help?"" or ""Report a technical problem?"" mail to dummy@sakaiproject.org.

","

Test A
1/ feedback.technicalAddress should not be set in the properties file & mail.support should be set to (say) fred.bloggs@geemayle.com

2/ Launch the Contact Us tool, click on the link in the second or third box (doesn’t matter), complete the fields and press send. There should NOT be a message about the email address not being set in the second and third boxes.
3/ look in the logs and see that the message was sent
1/ feedback.technicalAddress should set to (say) john.doe@geemayle.com in the properties file & mail.support should be set to (say) fred.bloggs@geemayle.com

2/ Launch the Contact Us tool, click on the link in the second or third box (doesn’t matter), complete the fields and press send. There should NOT be a message about the email address not being set in the second and third boxes.
3/ look in the logs and see that the message was sent to John Doe and not Fred Bloggs
1/ feedback.technicalAddress & & mail.support should not be set

2/ Launch the Contact Us tool, check there is a message about the email address not being set in the second and third boxes.

",Duplicate,36377,SAK-30662,duplicates,10002,32356,Help_screenshot_qa.png,256527,ug:1671d36f-069f-4996-adac-04871fe3c79b,"Mon, 6 Jun 2016 10:55:38 -0400",174387,6164f940071a720071a765f3,"Fri, 15 Apr 2016 02:01:24 -0400","

Actually this Jira involves logic with all 3 properties so should really be ideally tested in all its states, i.e.:
1. When there are no (relevant) properties set, then the Contact Us tool should shows warnings for boxes 2,3, and 4 (see screenshot)
2. When only the 'mail.support' property is set, then the Contact Us tool should send an email to that 'mail.support' address for boxes 2 and 3 and should show a warning message for box 4.

3. When only the 'feedback.technicalAddress' property is set, then the Contact Us tool should send an email to that 'feedback.technicalAddress' address for boxes 2 and 3 and should show a warning message for box 4.

4. When only the 'feedback.featureSuggestionUrl' property is set, then the Contact Us tool should show a warning message for boxes 2 and 3 and should send the user to that 'feedback.featureSuggestionUrl' url for box 4.

5. When only the 'feedback.featureSuggestionUrl' and 'feedback.technicalAddress' properties are set, then the Contact Us tool should send an email to that 'feedback.technicalAddress' address for boxes 2 and should send the user to that 'feedback.featureSuggestionUrl' url for box 4.

6. When only the 'mail.support' and 'feedback.technicalAddress' properties are set, then the Contact Us tool should send an email to that 'feedback.technicalAddress' address for boxes 2 and should show a warning message for box 4.

7. When only the 'mail.support' and 'feedback.featureSuggestionUrl' properties are set, then the Contact Us tool should send an email to that 'mail.support' address for boxes 2 and should send the user to that 'feedback.featureSuggestionUrl' url for box 4.

8. When the 'mail.support' and 'feedback.featureSuggestionUrl' and 'feedback.technicalAddress' properties are set, then the Contact Us tool should send an email to that 'feedback.technicalAddress' address for boxes 2 and should send the user to that 'feedback.featureSuggestionUrl' url for box 4.

<a href=""https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/browse/SAK-31184"" class=""jira-issue-macro-key issue-link""  title=""Improvements to the Feedback Tool"" >

are off by default. They are also unconfigured by default as well; all their bundles state something along the lines of ""configure $bundleName"". They where added as we are using the feedback tool to direct users to other resources we have available; this is institution specific, so we made it generic.
Regarding the whole support.email vs mail.support email, I believe Nick Wilson made the right call going with mail.support, especially considering the changes in

<a href=""https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/browse/SAK-29935"" class=""jira-issue-macro-key issue-link""  title=""The support.email property isn't defined in sakai.properties files, change to mail.support"" >

.

It's probably best to re-open this ticket - mainly because the UI messiness that Adam/Neal refer to above at the bottom of Neal's screenshot 'Help_Screenshot_qa.png' is because of a hasty merge I did on a file for this Jira during a conflict. I'll made a PR on this ticket that fixes this.
On the topic of mail.support vs support.mail, I think that mail.support is the way to go, both because of

<a href=""https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/browse/SAK-29935"" class=""jira-issue-macro-key issue-link""  title=""The support.email property isn't defined in sakai.properties files, change to mail.support"" >
and also because support.mail isn't used in the Sakai 11 codebase anywhere at the moment.

On the issue of the bug Leonardo raises, https://github.com/sakaiproject/sakai/commit/8c99f7e1144e0f6aaad4fe9629db3c21e95aba46#diff-93a552985898760281432f2e9c355543R127, I think that yes like Leonardo says the code's probably better placed in home.handlebars, whichI can fix either in this Jira or a separate one.

[SAK-30712] More Sites: add more flexibility for new site types via sakai.properties,https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/browse/SAK-30712,10057,SAK,Sakai,"

Currently, More Sites tab classifies the sites by their site type and course term if there is one, but this has several issues.
-New site types can't be classified apart without hardcoding them.
-New course-like site types or project-like site types can't be isolated from courses/projects.

Our proposal is two optional properties in sakai.properties. One (moresites.externalConfig.siteTypes) with the list of site types and other (moresites.externalConfig.prefix) with the prefix to use in the properties files, so every site type in the list can be classified in More Sites tab by its internationalized property key.
For example, for setting two new site types (courseAsig is a new course type and course 2 is a new site type), sakai.properties would have this:
And the properties ""moresites_course_asig"" and ""moresites_course_2"" would be used for the i18n texts in sitenav.properties.

If moresites.externalConfig.siteTypes is not set or is empty, the usual logic is applied.

[SAK-30711] Update Forums grading to use the new getAssignment long method,https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/browse/SAK-30711,10057,SAK,Sakai,"

Forums uses the old method getAssignments passing the assignment name. It should use the new method to retrieve assignments by ids.

Part of the issue is that MFR_TOPIC_T and MFR_OPEN_FORUM_T store DEFAULTASSIGNNAME as a text field, so it would either have to still work with the legacy method or just change the column type and run some kind of conversion (preferred).

",,31935,SAK-30711,Update Forums grading to use the new getAssignment long method,10026,https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/secure/viewavatar?size=medium&avatarId=10300&avatarType=issuetype,Sub-task,10001,https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/images/icons/priorities/critical.svg,Critical,10025,https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/images/icons/statuses/generic.png,Indicates QA is complete and an issue has been tested and verified (Migrated on 12 Oct 2021 03:05 UTC),Verified,3,done,green,10000,Fixed,70121:ec0fd122-4a2d-4492-a966-78d3f9aa9080,Matthew Jones,70121:ec0fd122-4a2d-4492-a966-78d3f9aa9080,Matthew Jones,"Thu, 7 Apr 2016 15:54:41 -0400","Wed, 2 May 2018 07:40:58 -0400",,Forums Tool,0,3,Development,customfield_10000,com.atlassian.jira.plugins.jira-development-integration-plugin:devsummarycf,Rank,0|108y34:,customfield_10019,com.pyxis.greenhopper.jira:gh-lexo-rank,Sprint,customfield_10020,com.pyxis.greenhopper.jira:gh-sprint,"Wed, 21 Jun 2017 01:35:40 -0400",,,,,,,Test Plan,customfield_10038,com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.customfieldtypes:textarea,[CHART] Date of First Response,customfield_10024,com.atlassian.jira.ext.charting:firstresponsedate,27475,SAK-30710,12.0,,109668,557058:5c96f723-18cd-4b0b-aef2-41c52ff1f9a4,"Wed, 2 May 2018 07:40:58 -0400",

Verified on Sakai 12 nightly using test plan listed within JIRA ticket.

,,,,,,,,,"

column2: • Add Gradebook and Forums to a site
• Add a gradebook item with some point value
• Go to forums, forum settings (the default topic is fine) and assign the gradebook item under grading

column1: MFR_OPEN_FORUM_T -> DEFAULTASSIGNNAME should have the gradebook ID not a name

column2: • Verify that the grade item comes up in the menu when editing again.
• Post to that forum as a student
• Verify the grade is updated in the gradebook without error

column1: MFR_MESSAGE_T -> GRADEASSIGNMENTNAME should have the gradebook ID not a name

The best test would also verify that old forum values work, but you'd have to modify the database for this. You'd insert the name of the gradebook item in these above tables/column and verify it still functions as expected.

[SAK-30710] Update deprecated methods that use String gradebookUid in forums to use long instead of string,https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/browse/SAK-30710,10057,SAK,Sakai,"

This is a going to be a parent jira to track the work for converting tools from using the numeric gradebook id instead of the string. This will allow for more flexibility and reliability in the gradebook.
setAssignmentScoreString(String gradebookUid, String assignmentName, String studentUid, String score, String clientServiceDescription)
getAssignmentScoreString(String gradebookUid, String assignmentName, String studentUid)

These should all use the Long version.

I've accepted the PR. The code seems fine, though it may not do quite what you intended.
Please note that this will only work if called from a POST with the current tool being a Lessons tool. If that's not the environment you have in mind you may get quite unexpected results.

column2: • checks privs. This is going to expect to be able to find the current tool. If this is called from something like /direct it may fail, or even create a new page
• checks CSRF, which is expected to be set as an argument from the POST

column1:
If you want to call this from something other than a POST, e.g. /direct, you'll probably want to pull out the code that does the work into a separate method and call it from the existing one. You'll probably want to pull getCurrentSiteId() out of the inner code and make it an argument, since it depends upon finding the current site ID, which in the end looks at the current URL. That won't work in a /direct context.

",74187,70121:ec0fd122-4a2d-4492-a966-78d3f9aa9080,"Thu, 28 Apr 2016 10:05:11 -0400","

I see what you mean with the these. I thought I'd tested it but I guess not good enough. I can follow up with something on this because I don't think it will do what we want.

We wanted to have some webservice (or maybe direct) where we could run this and delete all orphan pages easier than logging into the site, like when we're provisioning courses for next term or just a periodic cleanup. Thanks for the tips.

",141343,6164d3a564ff010071b75c26,"Fri, 24 Jun 2016 06:23:07 -0400","

I recommend that sites who want the newer features of Lessons should run the copy from master, i.e. the 12 copy. I just rebuilt lessons on my Sakai 11 test system using the Sakai 12 source for lessons. No changes, even to the POM files. It seems to work OK. I had expected problems with logging, but it starts and simple tests work. I got a couple of INFO messages from Lessons in catalina.out.

I think 12 is in good shape. The main differences are a couple of University of Dayton features. I believe they're in production in Dayton. I haven't seen any issues with them.

[SAK-30708] iPad: Favorites tab in Sites drawer presents the list of sites, but you can't reorder them.,https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/browse/SAK-30708,10057,SAK,Sakai,"

Issue: If you have at least three sites, with at least two of them set to be Favorite sites, and you click the Sites drawer > Favorites tab, you see a list of favorite sites, but you can't click and drag the sites to sort them, and they aren't links. The only functional feature of the Favorites tab on an iPad is the ability to click the star icon to remove a site from the list of Favorites.

column2: • Have at least 3 sites in your Site list.
• If none of the sites are favorites, click the stars next to 2 sites to put them in your favorites.
• You should see your favorite sites, but you can't interact with the sites in the list except to deselect one by clicking its star.

column1:

",191155,6164e53cc669a60069cbc87e,"Thu, 28 Apr 2016 14:17:04 -0400","

I'll invite Jeff Pasch and Kyle Blythe to comment on this too...

In the mobile interface, favorites are not reorderable by design. Since the user's list of favorites aren't really shown anywhere else anyway, it didn't seem worth making them go through the exercise of ordering them.

However, I did notice that the drag/drop wasn't working on touch devices. Sakai's JQuery UI Sortable library doesn't support touch events, so drag/drop didn't work on those devices. I've attached a pull request to include the ""jQuery UI Touch Punch"" library, which adds touch support to jQuery UI. That seems to correct the issue, although it might be worth checking that any other uses of drag/drop in the application are still working as expected.

The sites can be reordered, but cannot be clicked to view site.

","Thu, 28 Apr 2016 02:03:12 +0000",,,,,,41803,SitesTabFavorites.PNG,47477,ug:47795aa8-f2b3-4b1d-bef5-85b7f22bc340,"Thu, 7 Apr 2016 09:48:24 -0400",191192,6164e53cc669a60069cbc87e,"Thu, 5 May 2016 11:56:48 -0400",

That sounds like it's working as intended. The sites in the reorderable list aren't clickable because it's easy to accidentally click a link when you're trying to drag (which would take you away from the sites drawer).

If you go to Delegated Access > Shopping Admin you will note that the width of the shopping period settings table does not display correctly. It is too narrow for the screen, cutting off items and requiring sideways scrolling. It also does not align with the filter options on the right.

,74247,557058:89b0bd66-0f67-42a4-b388-c7dbb7ceaa2d,"Tue, 10 May 2016 06:55:57 -0400","

To see/test the issue:

column2: • View the Edit Shopping Period screen on the desktop. Widescreen displays will show the table only on the left side of the screen, not expanding all the way across the content area. However, the ""filter by"" options align with the right margin of the screen as expected. If you resize the browser window to make it smaller, the table gets cut off on the right side.

5. View the Edit Shopping Period screen on the desktop. Widescreen displays will show the table only on the left side of the screen, not expanding all the way across the content area. [SAK-30700] selecting an option causes table alignment to shift,https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/browse/SAK-30700,10057,SAK,Sakai,"

When you edit a user to select a permission option, selecting one of the check boxes causes the alignment of the table to shift so that it isn't properly aligned with the other rows in the table.

column2: • go to delegated access as an admin user
• check the box for access admin (or shopping admin, or site access) for one of the nodes, e.g. ""Music""
• note that the alignment of the Music node has shifted so that it appears to be indented under Medicine and the other cells are likewise off-set and do not match up with the appropriate columns

column1: This issue can also be seen in the edit shopping period settings table (see second screenshot).

column2: • click on the + sign to expand the hierarchy
• check the box next to one of the nodes, e.g. ""education""
• note that the alignment of the selected node is now offset from the rest of the table

column1:

[SAK-37861] don't equalize column heights in narrow mode,https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/browse/SAK-37861,10057,SAK,Sakai,"

When there are multiple columns, I use Javascript to set the height of all columns to the maximum of any of the columns. Otherwise it looks weird. However in narrow mode columns are displayed vertically. In that case there's no reason to make them the same height, and doing so leads to unexpected and undesired extra white space. Modify the Javascript so it doesn't equalize columns for narrow screens.

",,58028,SAK-37861,don't equalize column heights in narrow mode,10007,https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/secure/viewavatar?size=medium&avatarId=10303&avatarType=issuetype,Bug,10002,https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/images/icons/priorities/major.svg,Major,6,https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/images/icons/statuses/closed.png,"The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. [SAK-30697] Stacktrace when sending a message in a site where at least one user have configured 'Email address for forwarding',https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/browse/SAK-30697,10057,SAK,Sakai,"

Test scripts - http://qa01-sakai.marist.edu:8080/ -> https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1361uEnP3Vw6yyOj3CesJgL7B6XHWteaT89zgqAR1w5k/edit#gid=1
In order to reproduce this problem, you need to make sure that you are using two different users from the same site.
1- Log in as user1, go to a site where the messages tool is on, clic on 'settings', select 'Email address for forwarding:' and configure it by adding your email address. (screenshot 1)
2- Log in as user2 (from the same site), go to the messages tool in the same site, clic on 'compose message'.
3- Create a message by adding anyone in the 'To' field. Add a subject and add something as a Message. Then, clic on 'Send'.
4- It will take you back to the same page with the message ""Required items marked with *"", even though all required fields are filled out (screenshot 2).
5- Now clic on 'Send' again and you will get the error shown in (screenshot 3).
caused by: org.sakaiproject.tool.api.ToolException: javax.servlet.ServletException: #{PrivateMessagesTool.processPvtMsgSend}: javax.faces.el.EvaluationException: java.lang.NullPointerException

[SAK-37990] Text doesn't align in CKEditor in Lessons,https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/browse/SAK-37990,10057,SAK,Sakai,"

I noticed the text in CK Editor in Lessons doesn't align properly. See attachment below. It aligns correctly in IE11(Morpheus is broken?), but not in Firefox and Chrome. I tested CKEditor and the alignment works in any other tools in Sakai11 such as Syllabus, Assignments, Forums, etc. It made me to think the problem resides in Lessons, or Morpheus.
BTW, text aligns properly in Lessons in Sakai 10.
To replicate the problem: go to Lessons, click ""Add Text"", then in CKEditor, add some text and align the text in the center, then save, you will see the text is aligned to the left.

I hope it could be fixed quickly. I think it's ""critical"" to some instructors who uses a lot of text in Lessons.

",,62356,SAK-37990,Text doesn't align in CKEditor in Lessons,10007,https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/secure/viewavatar?size=medium&avatarId=10303&avatarType=issuetype,Bug,10003,https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/images/icons/priorities/minor.svg,Minor,10025,https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/images/icons/statuses/generic.png,Indicates QA is complete and an issue has been tested and verified (Migrated on 12 Oct 2021 03:05 UTC),Verified,3,done,green,10000,Fixed,6164d3a564ff010071b75c26,Charles Hedrick,6164f867c5388b0069dc1c09,Luisa Li,"Thu, 7 Apr 2016 05:36:08 -0400","Wed, 18 Apr 2018 03:30:42 -0400",11.0,Lessons,0,3,Development,customfield_10000,com.atlassian.jira.plugins.jira-development-integration-plugin:devsummarycf,Rank,0|108xy0:,customfield_10019,com.pyxis.greenhopper.jira:gh-lexo-rank,Sprint,customfield_10020,com.pyxis.greenhopper.jira:gh-sprint,"Thu, 7 Apr 2016 06:12:39 -0400",,,,,,,[CHART] Date of First Response,customfield_10024,com.atlassian.jira.ext.charting:firstresponsedate,[CHART] Time in Status,customfield_10025,com.atlassian.jira.ext.charting:timeinstatus,,,11.0,12.0,74080,557058:44e469a8-2a5c-4613-bc70-a38cc1b36433,"Thu, 7 Apr 2016 05:50:52 -0400","

Parent div is only as wide as the text it contains. It does not span 100% so it is not rendering center as it should. [SAK-33081] Comment flag in cell not displayed when there's a comment but no score,https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/browse/SAK-33081,10057,SAK,Sakai,"

The comment for a particular cell is only retrieved from the service if the cell has a score. This means the comment flag for an empty cell is not displayed even if a comment has been added for a particular grade.
1. Find a grade cell that has never had a score set before
2. In the cell's menu, select Edit Comment
3. Enter a comment and hit ""Save Comment""
4. Cell will render with the speech bubble flag within the cell
5. Reset the tool via the breadcrumb

6. The cell no longer shows the speech bubble flag

",,45426,SAK-33081,Comment flag in cell not displayed when there's a comment but no score,10007,https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/secure/viewavatar?size=medium&avatarId=10303&avatarType=issuetype,Bug,,,,6,https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/images/icons/statuses/closed.png,"The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. [SAK-30682] Chat Room "set as default" link disappears if clicked too many times.,https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/browse/SAK-30682,10057,SAK,Sakai,"

When you have multiple chat rooms, under Options, you can click a link under one to ""set as default."" If you click it, the link disappears (as it should, because it is now the default) and appears under any other chat rooms you have. However, if you once you have clicked on each of them, setting each as default in turn, it no longer appears under any chat rooms. Shouldn't only one chat room be able to be the default?

column2: • Click ""set as default"" as it appears under whichever chat room is not the current default until you have assigned each one as default and the link disappears altogether.

The action images are not keyboard selectable:
These actions are not in the tabindex and cannot be selected with the keyboard (or the key combination is unclear).

<a href=""https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/browse/SAK-9118"" class=""jira-issue-macro-key issue-link""  title=""Agree and implement consistent UI for pages which involve reordering "" >

, Fluid's reorder would be prefered, but I'm sure jquery-ui can be made accessible here too (I'll comment with some ideas).

This is another instance where jquery-ui.css needs to be loaded when jquery-ui.js is. I've fixed it in headscripts.js, which is where the load happens. It's easy to verify that the problem reported in this jira has been fixed. The question is whether it breaks any other tools. That would happen only if another tool uses a class that's defined by jquery-ui in a way the conflicts with this css. I think that's unlikely, but it's hard to test for.

If the 11 master chooses not to accept this patch for 11, I'll fix the one specific screen that causes this problem.
